analyzed: atha ratnapāṇiḥ bodhisattvaḥ bhagavantam etat avocat paripṛccheyam aham bhagavan praśna vyāharaṇam uddeśam kidṛśaḥ valokiteśvarasya bodhisattvasya
translated: Then the Bodhisattva Ratnapāṇi said this to the Blessed One: Blessed One, I would like to ask a question. What kind of merit accumulation does the Bodhisattva

analyzed: mahāsattvasya puṇya saṃbhāraḥ
translated: Mahāsattva Avalokiteśvara have?

analyzed: bhagavān āha śṛṇu kula putra
translated: The Blessed One said, Listen, son of noble family.

original: nirdeśayāmi asyāvalokiteśvarasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya nāmagrahaṇāt puṇyasaṃbhārasya pramāṇam /
analyzed: nirdeśayāmi asya avalokiteśvarasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya nāma grahaṇāt puṇya saṃbhārasya pramāṇam
translated: I will explain the measure of the merit accumulation of this Bodhisattva Mahāsattva Avalokiteśvara, from merely hearing his name.

original: tadyathā api nāma kulaputra kecideva sattvā gaṅgānadīvālukopamāstathāgatā arhantaḥ
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma kula putra kecid eva sattvāḥ gaṅgā nadī vālukā upamāḥ tathāgatāḥ arhantaḥ
translated: For example, son of noble family, if some beings equal to the sands of the Ganges River were Tathāgatas, Arhats,

analyzed: samyaksaṃbuddhāḥ divya kalpa puṣpa dhūpa gandha mālya vilepana cūrṇa cīvara chatra dhvaja ghaṇṭā patākābhiḥ vividhābhiḥ
translated: They are attended with divine flowers, incense, perfumes, garlands, ointments, powders, robes, parasols, banners, flags, and various other things.

analyzed: cīvara piṇḍa pātra śayana āsana glāna pratyaya bhaiṣajya pariṣkāraiḥ upasthitāḥ bhavanti
translated: They are attended with robes, alms-food, bedding and seats, and medicines for the sick.

analyzed: yaḥ ca teṣām tathāgatānām puṇya skandhaḥ prabhavati
translated: And whatever is the accumulation of merit of those Tathāgatas,

analyzed: avalokiteśvarasya eka vāla agre sa puṇya skandhaḥ
translated: that accumulation of merit is in a single hair-tip of Avalokiteśvara.

original: tadyathā api nāma kulaputra dvādaśamāsikena saṃvatsareṇa caturmahādvīpeṣu rātriṃdivamavicchinnaṃ devo varṣati /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma kula putra dvādaśa māsikena saṃvatsareṇa catur mahā dvīpeṣu rātriṃdivam avicchinnam devaḥ varṣati
translated: Just as, noble son, the god rains continuously day and night for twelve months, in the four great continents,

analyzed: tat śakyam ekaikam bindum gaṇayitum
translated: it is possible to count each drop.

original: na tu kulaputra avalokiteśvarasya śakyaṃ mayā puṇyasaṃbhāraṃ gaṇayitum /
analyzed: na tu kula putra avalokiteśvarasya śakyam mayā puṇya saṃbhāram gaṇayitum
translated: But, noble son, it is not possible for me to count the accumulation of merit of Avalokiteśvara.

analyzed: tat yathā api nāma kula putra mahā samudraḥ caturaśīti yojana sahasrāṇi gāmbhīryeṇa
translated: Just as, noble son, the great ocean is eighty-four thousand yojanas deep,

analyzed: aprameyaḥ vaipulyena
translated: incalculable in width,

analyzed: vaḍavāmukha paryantam
translated: up to the mouth of the submarine fire,

analyzed: tat mayā śakyam ekaikam bindum gaṇayitum
translated: it is possible for me to count each drop.

original: na tu kulaputra avalokiteśvarasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya śakyate puṇyasaṃbhāraṃ gaṇayitum /
analyzed: na tu kula putra avalokiteśvarasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya śakyate puṇya saṃbhāram gaṇayitum
translated: But, noble sir, it is not possible to calculate the merit accumulation of the bodhisattva mahāsattva Avalokiteśvara.

original: tadyathāpi nāma kulaputra caturmahādvīpeṣu ye keciccatuṣpādā siṃhavyāghraṛkṣatarakṣumṛgoṣṭraśṛgālādayo gogardabhāḥ paśavaḥ hastino 'śvā mahiṣā
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma kula putra catur mahā dvīpeṣu ye kecid catuṣpādā siṃha vyāghra ṛkṣa tarakṣu mṛga uṣṭra śṛgāla ādayaḥ go gardabhāḥ paśavaḥ śvā mahiṣāḥ
translated: For example, noble sir, in the four great continents, whatever four-legged animals there are, such as lions, tigers, bears, leopards, deer, camels, jackals, and so on, cows, donkeys, horses, buffalo,

original: eteṣu catuṣpadeṣu śakyate mayaikaikaṃ romaṃ gaṇayitum /
analyzed: eteṣu catuṣpadeṣu śakyate mayā ekaikam romam gaṇayitum
translated: it is possible for me to count each hair of those four-legged animals.

original: na tu kulaputra avalokiteśvarasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya śakyate puṇyasaṃbhāraṃ gaṇayitum /
analyzed: na tu kula putra avalokiteśvarasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya śakyate puṇya saṃbhāram gaṇayitum
translated: But, noble sir, it is not possible to calculate the merit accumulation of the bodhisattva mahāsattva Avalokiteśvara.

original: tadyathāpi nāma kulaputra kaścideva kulaputro vā kuladuhitā vā paramāṇurajopamāstathāgatā arhataḥ samyaksaṃbuddhā divyasauvarṇaratnamayān stūpān
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma kula putra kaścid eva kula putraḥ vā kula duhitā vā paramāṇu raja upamāḥ tathāgatāḥ arhataḥ samyaksaṃbuddhāḥ divya sauvarṇa ratna mayān stūpān
translated: For example, noble sir, some son or daughter of good family, having caused stūpas made of divine gold and jewels, equal in number to the thus-gone, worthy, perfect buddhas,

analyzed: kārayitvā ca eka dine dhyāna avaropaṇam kuryāt
translated: to be made, would plant the thought of enlightenment in one day.

original: tacchakyaṃ mayā kulaputra teṣāṃ sauvarṇarajatamayānāṃ tathāgatānāṃ karaṇeṣu puṇyaskandhaṃ gaṇayitum /
analyzed: tat śakyam mayā kula putra teṣām sauvarṇa rajata mayānām tathāgatānām karaṇeṣu puṇya skandham gaṇayitum
translated: That, noble sir, I am able to calculate the merit accumulation of those thus-gone ones made of gold and silver in their making.

original: na tu kulaputra avalokiteśvarasya bodhisattvasya śakyate puṇyasaṃbhāraṃ gaṇayitum /
analyzed: na tu kula putra avalokiteśvarasya bodhisattvasya śakyate puṇya saṃbhāram gaṇayitum
translated: But, son of noble family, it is not possible to calculate the merit accumulation of the bodhisattva Avalokiteśvara.

original: tadyathāpi nāma kulaputra śakyate mayā śīrṣavanasyaikaikaṃ patrāṇi gaṇayitum /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma kula putra śakyate mayā śīrṣavanasya ekaikam patrāṇi gaṇayitum
translated: For example, son of noble family, I am able to count the leaves of the Śrīparvata tree,

original: na tvavalokiteśvarasya śakyate mayā puṇyasaṃbhāraṃ gaṇayitum /🔽tadyathāpi nāma kulaputra caturmahādvīpeṣu strīpuruṣadārakadārikāste sarve srotāpattiphale sakṛdāgāmiphale 'nāgāmiphale 'rhattve pratyekabodhau
analyzed: na tu avalokiteśvarasya śakyate mayā puṇya saṃbhāram gaṇayitum  tat yathā api nāma kula putra catur mahā dvīpeṣu strī puruṣa dāraka dārikāḥ te sarve srotāpatti phale sakṛdāgāmi phale nāgāmi phale rhat tve pratyeka bodhau
translated: but I am not able to calculate the merit accumulation of Avalokiteśvara.

analyzed: niyojayeyam
translated: For example, son of noble family, if I were to establish all the women, men, boys and girls in the four great continents in the fruit of stream-entry, in the fruit of once-returning, in the fruit of non-returning, in arhatship,🔽in pratyekabuddha-enlightenment,

analyzed: yaḥ ca eteṣu puṇya skandhaḥ
translated: and if there were a merit accumulation from that,

analyzed: avalokiteśvarasya pūrvavat bāla agre sa puṇya skandhaḥ
translated: that merit accumulation of Avalokiteśvara would be at the tip of the hair, as before.

analyzed: iti avalokiteśvarapuṇyaskandhakathanam nāma saptamam prakaraṇam  start kvyu
translated: Thus ends the seventh chapter on the description of the merit accumulation of Avalokiteśvara.

analyzed: vaineya dharma upadeśaḥ aṣṭamam prakaraṇam
translated: Here begins the eighth chapter on the teaching of the Dharma for those to be trained.

original: atha ratnapāṇirbodhisattvo mahāsattvo bhagavantametadavocat na me bhagavana kvacidīdṛśaḥ acintyastathāgatānāṃ puṇyaskandho dṛṣṭo vā śruto
analyzed: atha ratnapāṇiḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ bhagavantam etat avocat na me bhagavana kvacid īdṛśaḥ acintyaḥ tathāgatānām puṇya skandhaḥ dṛṣṭaḥ vā śrutaḥ
translated: Then the Bodhisattva Mahāsattva Ratnapāṇi said this to the Blessed One: Blessed One, I have never seen or heard of such an inconceivable mass of merit of the Tathāgatas,

analyzed: vā prāk eva bodhisattva bhūtasya
translated: let alone when the Blessed One was a Bodhisattva.

analyzed: yādṛśaḥ bhagavataḥ valokiteśvarasya bodhisattvasya puṇya skandhaḥ
translated: The mass of merit of the Bodhisattva Avalokiteśvara is like this.

original: bhagavānāha yatkhalu kulaputra mama sadṛśāḥ gaṅgānadīvālukopamāstathāgatā arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhā bhaveyuḥ /
analyzed: bhagavān āha yat khalu kula putra mama sadṛśāḥ gaṅgā nadī vālukā upamāḥ tathāgatāḥ arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhāḥ bhaveyuḥ
translated: The Blessed One said, Son of noble family, if there were Tathāgatas, Arhats, Perfectly Awakened Ones equal to me, as numerous as the sands of the Ganges river,

analyzed: te ca eka sthāne vaidya
translated: and they were to uphold the Dharma in one place,

analyzed: dhārayeyuḥ satkārāya divya kalpa cīvara piṇḍa pātra śayana āsana glāna pratyaya bhaiṣajya pariṣkāraiḥ
translated: honoring it with divine robes, alms-food, bedding, seats, medicine for curing the sick, and necessities,

original: te ca tathāgatā arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhāḥ sarvathaikatra saṃnipātyante /
analyzed: te ca tathāgatāḥ arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhāḥ sarvathā ekatra saṃnipātyante
translated: and those Tathāgatas, Arhats, Perfectly Awakened Ones, having assembled in one place in every way,

original: sarve avalokiteśvarasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya na śankuvanti puṇyaskandhaṃ gaṇayitum /
analyzed: sarve avalokiteśvarasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya na śankuvanti puṇya skandham gaṇayitum
translated: all of them would not be able to calculate the mass of merit of the Bodhisattva Avalokiteśvara.

original: prāgeva kulaputra ahamekākī asmin lokadhātau viharāmi /
analyzed: prāk eva kula putra aham ekākī asmin lokadhātau viharāmi
translated: Son of noble family, let alone when I am alone dwelling in this world-realm.

original: tatkathaṃ śaknuyāṃ tasya puṇyaskandhaṃ vācā vyāhartum /🔽api ca kulaputra sarve tathāgatā daśabhyo vāgbhiḥ evaṃ vācamabhāṣanta te sattvāḥ sukhitā loke bhavanti /
analyzed: tat katham śaknuyām tasya puṇya skandham vācā vyāhartum  api ca kula putra sarve tathāgatāḥ daśabhyaḥ vāgbhiḥ evam vācam abhāṣanta te sattvāḥ sukhitāḥ loke bhavanti
translated: How can I describe the extent of his merit with words?

analyzed: ye avalokiteśvarasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya nāmadheyam anusmaranti
translated: Moreover, noble sir, all the Tathāgatas, with ten kinds of speech, have spoken thus: “Those beings who remember the name of the Bodhisattva Mahāsattva Avalokiteśvara are happy in the world.

analyzed: te jarā maraṇa vyādhi śoka parideva duḥkha daurmanasyebhyaḥ parimuktāḥ bhavanti
translated: They are liberated from old age, death, sickness, sorrow, lamentation, pain, and despair.

analyzed: te āpaścima sāṃsārikam duḥkham na anubhavanti
translated: They do not experience the last worldly suffering.

original: te śuklapāṇḍarapaṭā iva rājahaṃsāḥ plutavāyuvegā iva gacchanti sukhāvatīlokadhātumamitābhasya tathāgatasya saṃmukhaṃ dharmaśravaṇāya /
analyzed: te śukla pāṇḍara paṭāḥ iva rājahaṃsāḥ pluta vāyu vegāḥ iva gacchanti sukhāvatī lokadhātum amitābhasya tathāgatasya saṃmukham dharma śravaṇāya
translated: Like white swans, they go swiftly like the wind to the Sukhāvatī world-system, to listen to the Dharma face-to-face with the Tathāgata Amitābha.

original: dharmaṃ śrutvā ca sāṃsārikaṃ duḥkhaṃ teṣāṃ kāye na bādhate /
analyzed: dharmam śrutvā ca sāṃsārikam duḥkham teṣām kāye na bādhate
translated: Having heard the Dharma, the worldly suffering does not afflict their bodies.

original: na ca rāgadveṣamohena jarāmaraṇam /🔽na ca teṣāṃ kṣutpipāsā duḥkhaṃ kāye na bādhate /
analyzed: na ca rāga dveṣa mohena jarā maraṇam  na ca teṣām kṣudh pipāsā duḥkham kāye na bādhate
translated: They are not subject to old age, death, or the suffering of passion, hatred, and delusion.🔽Hunger, thirst, and suffering do not afflict their bodies.

analyzed: na ca te garbhāvāsa duḥkham anusmaranti
translated: They do not remember the suffering of dwelling in the womb.

analyzed: tasmin eva padme jāyante
translated: They are born in that very lotus.

original: dharmarasena pūryamāṇāḥ satataparigrahaṃ vyavasthāpitāḥ tāvadasmiṃllokadhātau tiṣṭhanti /
analyzed: dharma rasena pūryamāṇāḥ satata parigraham vyavasthāpitāḥ tāvat asmin lokadhātau tiṣṭhanti
translated: They are filled with the essence of Dharma and are established to be always maintained in this world-realm.

original: yāvadavalokiteśvarasya bodhisattvasya dṛḍhapratijñā na paripūritā bhavati sarvasattvā sarvaduḥkhebhyaḥ parimokṣitāḥ yāvadanuttarāyāḥ samyaksaṃbodhau
analyzed: yāvat avalokiteśvarasya bodhisattvasya dṛḍha pratijñā na paripūritā bhavati sarva sattvāḥ sarva duḥkhebhyaḥ parimokṣitāḥ yāvat anuttarāyāḥ samyaksaṃbodhau
translated: As long as the firm vow of the bodhisattva Avalokiteśvara is not fulfilled, as long as all beings are not liberated from all suffering and established in the unsurpassed perfect enlightenment,

analyzed: na pratiṣṭhāpitāḥ bhavanti
translated: they remain.

original: atha ratnapāṇirbodhisattvo bhagavantametadavocat katamena kālena bhagavato 'sya dṛḍhapratijñāṃ paripūrayati /

analyzed: sarva sattvāḥ ca mokṣa mārge pratiṣṭhāpitāḥ bhaveyuḥ

original: bhagavānāha bahubhiḥ kulaputra kāraṇaiḥ sattvāḥ kāraṇāt saṃsāre saṃsaranti /
analyzed: bhagavān āha bahubhiḥ kula putra kāraṇaiḥ sattvāḥ kāraṇāt saṃsāre saṃsaranti

analyzed: devatā sattvān paripācayati

analyzed: tādṛśaḥ tathāgatānām api na saṃvidyate
translated: Such a realm does not even exist for the Tathāgatas.

original: bhagavānāha asti kulaputra asminneva jambudvīpe vajrakukṣirnāma guhā /
analyzed: bhagavān āha asti kula putra asmin eva jambudvīpe vajrakukṣiḥ nāma guhā
translated: The Blessed One said, Son of noble family, there is a cave named Vajrakukshi in this very Jambudvīpa.

analyzed: atra anekāni asura koṭī niyuta śata sahasrāṇi prativasanti sma
translated: There many hundreds of thousands of millions of billions of asuras dwell.

original: tatra kulaputra avalokiteśvaro bodhisattvo 'surarūpeṇāsurāṇāṃ dharmaṃ deśayati /
analyzed: tatra kula putra avalokiteśvaraḥ bodhisattvaḥ sura rūpeṇa asurāṇām dharmam deśayati
translated: Son of noble family, there the bodhisattva Avalokiteśvara, in the form of an asura, teaches the Dharma to the asuras.

analyzed: imam ca kāraṇḍa vyūha mahāyāna sūtra ratna rājam uddeśayati
translated: And he proclaims this precious king of the Mahāyāna sūtras, the Karuṇāpuṇḍarīka.

original: dharmaśravaṇāyāgatānasurānevaṃ ca kathayati sma asurāṇāṃ dharmaṃ śṛṇvantu bhavantaḥ /
analyzed: dharma śravaṇāya āgatān asurān evam ca kathayati sma asurāṇām dharmam śṛṇvantu bhavantaḥ
translated: And he spoke thus to the asuras who had come to listen to the Dharma: Listen, sirs, to the Dharma of the asuras.

original: ye cānye 'suraparṣadaste maitracittāḥ śāntacittāḥ dayācittāḥ sattvānāmantike hitasukhacittā bhāvaṃ samanvāhṛtya imaṃ kāraṇḍavyūhaṃ dharmaparyāyaṃ
analyzed: ye ca anye sura parṣadaḥ te maitra cittāḥ śānta cittāḥ dayā cittāḥ sattvānām antike hita sukha cittāḥ bhāvam samanvāhṛtya imam kāraṇḍa vyūham dharmaparyāyam
translated: And you other asura assemblies, with a mind of friendliness, a mind of peace, a mind of compassion, with a mind of benefit and happiness for beings, having directed your thoughts, listen to this Dharma discourse, the Karandavyūha.

analyzed: śrotavyam
translated: [You should listen to it].

original: atha te 'surāḥ kṛtakarapuṭā avalokiteśvarasyāntikamimaṃ dharmaparyāyaṃ śṛṇvanti sma /
analyzed: atha te surāḥ kṛta kara puṭāḥ avalokiteśvarasya antikam imam dharmaparyāyam śṛṇvanti sma
translated: Then those asuras, with palms joined, listened to this Dharma discourse from Avalokiteśvara.

original: te sukhitā loke ye īdṛśaṃ cintāmaṇisadṛśaṃ kāraṇḍavyūhaṃ mahāyānasūtraratnarājamabhimukhīkurvanti /
analyzed: te sukhitāḥ loke ye īdṛśam cintāmaṇi sadṛśam kāraṇḍa vyūham mahāyāna sūtra ratna rājam abhimukhīkurvanti
translated: Those who in the world face this jewel king of the great vehicle sūtras, the Karandavyūha, which is like a wish-fulfilling gem,

analyzed: śṛṇvanti
translated: and listen to it,

analyzed: śrutvā ca abhiśraddadhāsyanti  pratīṣyanti  likhiṣyanti
translated: and having heard it, will have faith in it,🔽will accept it,🔽will write it,

analyzed: likhāpayiṣyanti
translated: will cause it to be written,

analyzed: dhārayiṣyanti
translated: will uphold it,

analyzed: vācayiṣyanti  pūjayiṣyanti
translated: will recite it,🔽will worship it,

analyzed: cintayiṣyanti
translated: will contemplate it,

analyzed: parebhyaḥ ca vistareṇa saṃprakāśayiṣyanti
translated: and will explain it extensively to others,

analyzed: bhāvayiṣyanti
translated: will meditate on it,

analyzed: parama prītyā gauraveṇa adhyāśayena ca namaskurvanti
translated: and will pay homage with supreme joy, reverence, and higher intention,

analyzed: teṣām ca pañca ānantaryāṇi karmāṇi kṣapayanti
translated: And they will exhaust their five heinous karma.

analyzed: kṣapayitvā pariśuddha kāyāḥ bhaviṣyanti
translated: Having exhausted them, they will have pure bodies.

analyzed: jāti smarāḥ ca
translated: And they will remember their past lives.

analyzed: maraṇa kāle dvādaśa tathāgatāḥ upasaṃkramiṣyanti
translated: At the time of death, twelve Tathagatas will approach them.

original: te ca sarve tathāgatā āśvāsayiṣyanti mā bhaiṣīḥ kulaputra /
analyzed: te ca sarve tathāgatāḥ āśvāsayiṣyanti mā bhaiṣīḥ kula putra
translated: And all those Tathagatas will comfort them, saying, 'Do not be afraid, son of noble family.

analyzed: tvayā kāraṇḍa vyūham mahāyāna sūtra ratna rājam śrutam
translated: You have heard the Karandavyūha, the great vehicle, the jewel of the sutra king.

analyzed: vividhāḥ te ṛtha mārgāḥ sajjīkṛtāḥ sukhāvatī gamanāya ca
translated: Those various paths of meaning have been prepared for you to go to Sukhāvatī.

original: tatra sukhāvatyāṃ lokadhātau tavārthe vicitraṃ ca te chatraṃ sihāsanaṃ sajjīkṛtam /
analyzed: tatra sukhāvatyām lokadhātau tava arthe vicitram ca te chatram sihāsanam sajjīkṛtam
translated: For your sake, in that realm of Sukhāvatī, a variegated parasol and lion throne have been prepared for you.

analyzed: divya maulī kuṇḍala sraj dāmam īdṛśasya nimittam
translated: Such are the signs of the divine crown, earrings, and garlands.

analyzed: maraṇa kāla samaya paripanthitaḥ eva sukhāvatīm anugacchati
translated: At the time of death, you will go to Sukhāvatī.'

original: evaṃ sa ratnapāṇe prativiśiṣṭataraṃ puṇyaphalaṃ darśayannavalokiteśvaro bodhisattvo mahāsattvo nirvāṇikīṃ bhūmimupadarśayati sma /
analyzed: evam sa ratnapāṇe prativiśiṣṭataram puṇya phalam darśayan avalokiteśvaraḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ nirvāṇikīm bhūmim upadarśayati sma
translated: In this way, Avalokiteśvara, the Bodhisattva Mahāsattva, showing the superior fruit of merit, revealed the stage leading to Nirvāṇa.

analyzed: asurāṇām nirvāṇa patham upadarśitam sarva pāpa mati nivāraṇa artham anuttare bodhimārge pratiṣṭhāpana artham
translated: In order to prevent all evil and to establish them in the unsurpassed path of enlightenment.

original: atha ratnapāṇirbodhisattvo mahāsattvo bhagavataḥ pādau śirasābhivandya tatraiva prakrāntaḥ //🔽iti asurāśvāsanaṃ nāma navamaṃ prakaraṇam //
analyzed: atha ratnapāṇiḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ bhagavataḥ pādau śirasā abhivandya tatra eva prakrāntaḥ  iti asurāśvāsanam nāma navamam prakaraṇam
translated: Then the Bodhisattva Mahasattva Ratnapāṇi bowed his head at the feet of the Blessed One and departed from there.

analyzed: start kvyu
translated: Thus ends the ninth chapter named The Assurance of the Asuras in the Ratnaketuparivarta of the Mahāsaṃnipāta Sūtra.

analyzed: kāñcana maya bhūmi ādi upasthānam daśamam prakaraṇam
translated: Here begins the tenth chapter named The Adornments of the Golden Ground.

original: athe sarvanīvaraṇaviṣkambhī bhagavantametadavocat atidurlabhaṃ bhagavan asyāvalokiteśvarasya vikurvitāni śrūyante guṇodbhāvanāni ca /🔽bhagavānāha api ca kulaputra tasmād Vaidya
analyzed: sarva nīvaraṇa viṣkambhī bhagavantam etat avocat ati durlabham bhagavan asya avalokiteśvarasya vikurvitāni śrūyante guṇa udbhāvanāni ca  bhagavān āha api ca kula putra tasmāt vaidya
translated: Then Sarvanīvaraṇaviṣkambhin said this to the Blessed One: Blessed One, the transformations and praises of the qualities of this Avalokiteśvara are extremely rare to hear.

analyzed: vajrakukṣeḥ yadā niṣkrāntaḥ
translated: The Blessed One said, Moreover, noble son, from that womb of vajra🔽when he emerged,

analyzed: kāñcana mayyām bhūmyām praviṣṭaḥ
translated: he entered the golden ground.

analyzed: tadā guṇa udbhāvanām śṛṇu
translated: Then listen to the praise of his qualities.

analyzed: tat api pūrvatara pravacanam
translated: That too is an earlier teaching.

original: tadapi samatikramya viśvabhūrnāma tathāgato 'rhan samyaksaṃbuddho babhūva vidyācaraṇasaṃpannaḥ
analyzed: tat api samatikramya viśvabhūḥ nāma tathāgataḥ rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ babhūva vidyā caraṇa saṃpannaḥ
translated: Surpassing that, there was a Tathāgata, Arhat, Perfectly Enlightened One named Viśvabhū, who was accomplished in knowledge and conduct,

original: sugato lokavidanuttaraḥ puruṣadamyasārathiḥ śāstā devānāṃ ca manuṣyāṇāṃ ca buddho bhagavān /
analyzed: sugataḥ loka vid anuttaraḥ puruṣa damya sārathiḥ śāstā devānām ca manuṣyāṇām ca buddhaḥ bhagavān
translated: The Sugata, the knower of the world, the unexcelled, the charioteer of human beings to be tamed, the teacher of gods and humans, the Buddha, the Blessed One.

original: tena kālena tena samayena ahaṃ sarvanīvaraṇaviṣkambhī bodhisattvaḥ kṣāntivādī ṛṣirabhūt girigahvarāntarakarvaṭasthānavāsī /
analyzed: tena kālena tena samayena aham sarva nīvaraṇa viṣkambhī bodhisattvaḥ kṣānti vādī ṛṣiḥ abhūt giri gahvara antara karvaṭa sthāna vāsī
translated: At that time, on that occasion, I, Sarvanīvaraṇaviṣkambhin, was the bodhisattva Kṣāntivādin Ṛṣi, dwelling in a mountain cave.

analyzed: manuṣyāṇām avacare pṛthivī pradeśe vyaharan
translated: I was living in a place on the earth inhabited by humans.

original: tadā kālānukālaṃ mayā tasya viśvabhuvaḥ tathāgatasya sakāśāt guṇodbhāvanā avalokiteśvarasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya śrutā vividhasarvasattvaparipācanam
analyzed: tadā kāla anukālam mayā tasya viśvabhuvaḥ tathāgatasya sakāśāt guṇa udbhāvanā avalokiteśvarasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya śrutā vividha sarva sattva paripācanam
translated: At that time, from time to time, I heard from that Tathāgata Viśvabhū the praise of the qualities of the bodhisattva mahāsattva Avalokiteśvara, which brings about the ripening of all beings in various ways.

original: asti sarvanīvaraṇaviṣkambhin sā kāñcanamayī nāma bhūmirasti yaduttarasyāṃ kāñcanamayyāṃ
analyzed: asti sarva nīvaraṇa viṣkambhin sā kāñcana mayī nāma bhūmiḥ asti yat uttarasyām kāñcana mayyām
translated: Sarvanīvaraṇaviṣkambhin, there is a land called Kāñcanamāyā, which is to the north of the Kāñcanamāyā land.

original: bhūmyāṃ gatvā avalokiteśvaro bodhisattvo mahāsattvo 'dhomukhānāṃ sattvānāṃ dharmaṃ deśayati sma /
analyzed: bhūmyām gatvā avalokiteśvaraḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ dhomukhānām sattvānām dharmam deśayati sma
translated: Having gone to the northern Kāñcanamāyā land, the bodhisattva mahāsattva Avalokiteśvara taught the Dharma to beings who were facing downwards.

analyzed: ārya aṣṭāṅgika mārgam nirvāṇam upadarśayati
translated: He showed them the noble eightfold path and nirvāṇa.

original: sa tataḥ kāñcanamayyā bhūmyā niṣkramitvā rūpyamayyāṃ bhūmyāṃ praviśati /
analyzed: sa tatas kāñcana mayyāḥ bhūmyāḥ niṣkramitvā rūpya mayyām bhūmyām praviśati
translated: Then, emerging from the golden ground, he enters the silver ground.

original: tatra sa paśyati catuṣpādikāni sattvāni puruṣapudgalāni /
analyzed: tatra sa paśyati catuṣpādikāni sattvāni puruṣa pudgalāni
translated: There he sees four-legged beings, male persons.

original: dṛṣṭvā teṣāmavalokiteśvaro bodhisattvo mahāsattvo sarvasattvānāmeva dharmaṃ deśayati
analyzed: dṛṣṭvā teṣām avalokiteśvaraḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ sarva sattvānām eva dharmam deśayati
translated: Having seen them, the Bodhisattva Mahāsattva Avalokiteśvara teaches the Dharma to all beings.

original: śṛṇvantu bhavantaḥ sarve puruṣapudgalā abhimukhaṃ dharmaparyāyaṃ pracalamānasucetasā nirvāṇikam /
analyzed: śṛṇvantu bhavantaḥ sarve puruṣa pudgalāḥ abhimukham dharmaparyāyam pracalamāna su cetasā nirvāṇikam
translated: Listen, all you male persons, to the Dharma discourse that is being proclaimed with a pure mind, leading to Nirvāṇa.

analyzed: satvaram anuvicintayata
translated: Contemplate it quickly!

original: athe te sarve puruṣā avalokiteśvarasya purataḥ sthitvā etadavocat āśvāsaya tvam /
analyzed: atha e te sarve puruṣāḥ avalokiteśvarasya puratas sthitvā etat avocat āśvāsaya tvam
translated: Then all those men, standing before Avalokiteśvara, said this: Comfort us.

original: andhabhūtānāṃ sattvānāṃ mārgamupadarśako bhava /🔽atrāṇānāṃ sattvānāṃ trāṇaṃ bhava /
analyzed: andha bhūtānām sattvānām mārgam upadarśakaḥ bhava  atrāṇānām sattvānām trāṇam bhava
translated: For blind beings, be one who shows the path.🔽For unprotected beings, be a protector.

original: aśaraṇānāṃ sattvānāṃ śaraṇaṃ parāyaṇaṃ mātāpitṛbhūto bhava /
analyzed: aśaraṇānām sattvānām śaraṇam parāyaṇam mātā pitṛ bhūtaḥ bhava
translated: For those without refuge, be a refuge, a final resort, like a mother and father.

analyzed: tamaḥ abhibhūtānām sattvānām pranaṣṭa mārgāṇām dīpa bhūtaḥ bhava
translated: For beings overwhelmed by darkness, who have lost their way, be like a lamp.

analyzed: sa cetaka mahā karuṇayā mokṣa mārgasya upadarśaka
translated: With great compassion, show the path to liberation.

original: sukhitāste sattvā ye tava satataṃ parigrahaṃ nāmamanusmaranti /
analyzed: sukhitāḥ te sattvāḥ ye tava satatam parigraham nāmam anusmaranti
translated: Blessed are those beings who constantly remember and recite your name,

analyzed: udīrayanti ca
translated: and who proclaim it.

original: idaṃ ca samāgāḍhataraṃ duḥkhaṃ na kadācitpratyanubhavanti /
analyzed: idam ca samāgāḍhataram duḥkham na kadācid pratyanubhavanti
translated: They will never again experience such intense suffering.

original: muñcanti te hīdṛśaṃ duḥkhaṃ yāvadyādṛśaṃ vayaṃ pratyanubhavāmaḥ //
analyzed: muñcanti te hi īdṛśam duḥkham yāvat yādṛśam vayam pratyanubhavāmaḥ
translated: They will be released from such suffering as we are now experiencing.

original: atha sa teṣāṃ sattvānāṃ kāraṇḍavyūhaṃ nama mahāyanasūtraratnarājaṃ karṇapuṭe niścārayati sma /
analyzed: atha sa teṣām sattvānām kāraṇḍa vyūham mahā ayana sūtra ratna rājam karṇa puṭe niścārayati sma
translated: Then he caused the great vehicle sutra jewel king called the Karanda-vyuha to issue forth from the ear-holes of those beings.

original: te ca sattvā amuṃ dharmaparyāyaṃ śrutvā anyonyavihitaśrotṛkarṇapuṭā niścaranti sma /
analyzed: te ca sattvāḥ amum dharmaparyāyam śrutvā anyonya vihita śrotṛ karṇa puṭāḥ niścaranti sma
translated: And those beings, having heard this Dharma discourse, caused it to issue forth from their own ear-holes, having listened to it and understood it.

original: tadapi te puruṣāḥ śrutvā avaivartikabhūminiṣpāditāḥ paramasukhasamarpitāḥ saṃskṛtāḥ //
analyzed: tat api te puruṣāḥ śrutvā a vaivartika bhūmi niṣpāditāḥ parama sukha samarpitāḥ saṃskṛtāḥ
translated: And those men, having heard it, attained the stage of non-retrogression and were filled with the highest bliss.

original: atha āryāvalokiteśvaro bodhisattvo mahāsattvastasyā rūpamayyā niṣkramyānyatarāyāṃ
analyzed: atha ārya avalokiteśvaraḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ tasyāḥ rūpa mayyāḥ niṣkramya anyatarāyām
translated: Then the noble Avalokitesvara, the Bodhisattva, the Great Being, having emerged from that earth made of jewels,

original: bhūmyāṃ praviśati sattvaparipākāya mahākaruṇāsaṃpīḍitahṛdayo 'yomayyāṃ bhūmyāṃ yatra
analyzed: bhūmyām praviśati sattva paripākāya mahā karuṇā saṃpīḍita hṛdayaḥ yaḥ mayyām bhūmyām yatra
translated: entered another earth for the sake of ripening beings, his heart oppressed by great compassion, into the iron earth where

analyzed: sa rājā baliḥ asura indraḥ baddhaḥ
translated: the king Bali, the lord of the asuras, was bound.

analyzed: sa tasya eva sakāśam upasaṃkrāntaḥ
translated: He approached him.

original: upasaṃkramya ca rājño balerasurendrasya dūrataścakṣurdarśanaṃ yāti sma suvarṇabimbamiva raśmibhiḥ pramuñcamānairnānāvarṇaiḥ //
analyzed: upasaṃkramya ca rājñaḥ baleḥ asura indrasya dūratas cakṣuḥ darśanam yāti sma suvarṇa bimbam iva raśmibhiḥ pramuñcamānaiḥ nānā varṇaiḥ
translated: Having approached, he was seen by King Bali, the lord of the asuras, from afar, with his eyes, like a golden disc emitting various colored rays.

original: iti kāñcanamayabhūmyādyupasthānaṃ nāma daśamaṃ prakaraṇam //🔽START Kvyu / /
analyzed: iti kāñcanamayabhūmyādyupasthānam nāma daśamam prakaraṇam  start kvyu
translated: Thus ends the tenth chapter named The Offering of Golden Ground and So Forth in the Bodhisattvāvadānakalpalatā composed by Kṣemendra.

analyzed: bali samāśvāsanam ekādaśamam prakaraṇam
translated: Here begins the eleventh chapter named The Consolation of Bali in the Bodhisattvāvadānakalpalatā composed by Kṣemendra.

original: atha sa rājā balirasurendro 'valokiteśvaraṃ bodhisattvaṃ mahāsattvaṃ dūrata evāgacchantaṃ paśyati sma /
analyzed: atha sa rājā baliḥ asura indraḥ valokiteśvaram bodhisattvam mahāsattvam dūratas eva āgacchantam paśyati sma
translated: Then that King Bali, the lord of the asuras, saw the Bodhisattva Mahāsattva Avalokiteśvara coming from afar.

analyzed: dṛṣṭvā ca sa antaḥpura parivāraiḥ sārdham anekaiḥ asura śata sahasraiḥ kubja vāmanaka ādibhiḥ
translated: And having seen him, together with his harem and retinue, with many hundreds of thousands of asuras, hunchbacks, dwarfs, and so forth,

original: sahasraparivārairgatvā avalokiteśvarasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya pādayornipatyedamudānayati sma
analyzed: sahasra parivāraiḥ gatvā avalokiteśvarasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya pādayoḥ nipatya idam udānayati sma
translated: with a retinue of thousands, he went and fell at the feet of the Bodhisattva Mahāsattva Avalokiteśvara and uttered this exclamation:

analyzed: vaidya
translated: Vaidya

original: adya me saphalaṃ janma jīvitaṃ puṇyameva ca /
analyzed: adya me saphalam janma jīvitam puṇyam eva ca
translated: Today my birth, my life, and my merit have borne fruit.

original: adya me hīdṛśaṃ caiva paripūrṇaṃ manoratham // / / //
analyzed: adya me hi īdṛśam ca eva paripūrṇam manoratham
translated: Today my wishes have been fulfilled in this way.

original: adya me āśayaḥ pūrṇaḥ pariśuddhaśca duḥkhataḥ /
analyzed: adya me āśayaḥ pūrṇaḥ pariśuddhaḥ ca duḥkhataḥ
translated: Today my wishes are fulfilled and I am completely purified from suffering,

analyzed: yat mayā darśane samyak dṛṣṭvā loka eka bāndhavaḥ
translated: Since I have seen the sole friend of the world in a vision.

original: tadā me sarvasaukhyaṃ ca kāme saṃtiṣṭhate punaḥ /
analyzed: tadā me sarva saukhyam ca kāme saṃtiṣṭhate punar
translated: Then all my happiness and desires are fulfilled again.

analyzed: saukhyāḥ bhavanti te sattvāḥ sarva duḥkha vivarjitāḥ
translated: Those beings become happy, free from all suffering.

analyzed: saṃsāra bandhanāt muktāḥ tiṣṭhanti sukha modakāḥ
translated: Liberated from the bonds of saṃsāra, they remain joyful and delighted.

analyzed: mama api darśanena eva sarve sphuṭita bandhanāḥ
translated: Even by seeing me, all their bonds are shattered.

analyzed: dūrāt dūrataram yānti garūḍasya iva pannagāḥ
translated: They go farther and farther away, like snakes from Garuḍa.

original: atha sa rājā balistasya bhagavato 'valokiteśvarasya pādayoḥ praṇipatya ratnapīṭhakaṃ dattvā daśanakhāñjaliṃ kṛtvaivamāha
analyzed: atha sa rājā baliḥ tasya bhagavataḥ valokiteśvarasya pādayoḥ praṇipatya ratna pīṭhakam dattvā daśa nakha añjalim kṛtvā evam āha
translated: Then King Bali, having bowed at the feet of the Blessed Avalokiteśvara, having offered a jeweled seat, and having joined his palms, said this:

analyzed: api ca bhagavan
translated: Moreover, Blessed One.

analyzed: niṣīdasva asmin āsane
translated: Sit on this seat.

analyzed: anugraham kuru
translated: Show your favor.

original: pāparatānāṃ jātyandhabhūtānāṃ paradāragamanaprasaktānāṃ prāṇātipātodyuktānāṃ paraprāṇāhiṃsakānāṃ jarāmaraṇabhayabhītānāmudvignamānasānāṃ saṃsāraduṣṭavārtānāṃ
analyzed: pāpa ratānām jāti andha bhūtānām para dāra gamana prasaktānām prāṇa atipāta udyuktānām para prāṇa ahiṃsakānām jarā maraṇa bhaya bhītānām udvigna mānasānām saṃsāra duṣṭa vārtānām
translated: To those engaged in evil, those born blind, those attached to going after others' spouses, those intent on taking life, those who harm others' lives, those frightened by the danger of old age and death, those with anxious minds, those with corrupt affairs in saṃsāra,

analyzed: trātā bhava
translated: be their protector.

analyzed: anāthānām mātā pitṛ bhūtaḥ bhava
translated: Be a mother and father to the helpless.

analyzed: duṣṭa dāruṇa caṇḍa bhūtānām bhagavan trātā bhava
translated: O Blessed One, be a savior to the wicked, cruel, and violent beings.

analyzed: parama dāruṇa duṣṭa praśamakaḥ bhava
translated: Be one who pacifies the extremely cruel and wicked.

original: eṣāmasmākaṃ bandhanabaddhānāṃ tava darśanena sarvabandhanādayaḥ parimuktāḥ /
analyzed: eṣām asmākam bandhana baddhānām tava darśanena sarva bandhana ādayaḥ parimuktāḥ
translated: By seeing you, all the bonds and so on of these bound ones are released.

analyzed: sphuṭitāḥ dūrāt dūrataram palāyanti
translated: They burst open and flee far away.

original: tvaddarśanamātreṇa yāni tāni rājñaścakravartinaśca śubhakarmajātāni cakravartisukhāni mama saṃvidyante /
analyzed: tvad darśana mātreṇa yāni tāni rājñaḥ cakravartinaḥ ca śubha karma jātāni cakravarti sukhāni mama saṃvidyante
translated: By merely seeing you, I possess those auspicious deeds born of the wheel-turning king and the happiness of the wheel-turner.

analyzed: tat sa bhagavan tādṛśam dharma mārgam upadarśaya
translated: Therefore, Blessed One, show me that path of Dharma.

analyzed: yena evam punar eva bandhana duḥkham na pratyanubhavema
translated: By which I may never again experience the suffering of bondage.

original: na ca punarimāni yāni sarvabandhanāni cakṣuṣu ābhāsamāgaccheyuḥ //
analyzed: na ca punar imāni yāni sarva bandhanāni cakṣuṣu ābhāsam āgaccheyuḥ
translated: And may these all bonds never come into the range of vision of the eyes.

original: atha āryāvalokiteśvaro bodhisattvo mahāsattvo rājānaṃ balimasurendramevamāha ye mahārāja sattvānāmantike avihiṃsācittamutpādayanti /
analyzed: atha ārya avalokiteśvaraḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ rājānam balim asura indram evam āha ye mahā rāja sattvānām antike avihiṃsā cittam utpādayanti
translated: Then the noble Avalokiteśvara, the Bodhisattva Mahāsattva, said this to King Bali, the Lord of the Asuras: Great King, those who generate a non-harming mind towards beings,

analyzed: tathāgata śāsane piṇḍa pātram anuprayacchanti
translated: and offer almsfood in the teachings of the Tathāgata,

analyzed: kārā upakāram bahutaram kurvanti
translated: They perform many more acts of kindness.

original: na ca teṣāṃ kecitsattvāḥ svapnenāpi pīḍayanti /
analyzed: na ca teṣām kecid sattvāḥ svapnena api pīḍayanti
translated: And no beings, not even in their dreams, will harm them.

analyzed: amum ca kāraṇḍa vyūham mahāyāna sūtra ratna rājam likhanti
translated: They write out this great vehicle sutra, the precious king of sutras, the Karandavyūha.

analyzed: likhāpayanti  antatas nāmadheyam api
translated: They cause it to be written out.

analyzed: asmāt dharmaparyāyam śṛṇvanti
translated: At the very least, they hear the name of this sutra.

analyzed: asya bodhisattvasya ekam api piṇḍa pātram anuprayacchanti
translated: They offer even a single alms bowl of food to this bodhisattva.

original: teṣāṃ ca dharmabhāṇakānāmasya dharmaparyāyasya dhārakānāṃ vācakānāṃ lekhakānāṃ saṃśrāvakāṇām /
analyzed: teṣām ca dharma bhāṇakānām asya dharmaparyāyasya dhārakānām vācakānām lekhakānām saṃśrāvakāṇām
translated: And to those dharma preachers who uphold this sutra, who expound it, who write it out, and who listen to it.

original: asya ca tathāgatasya dharmaparyāyamuddiśya ekadivasamapi purobhaktamapi piṇḍapātramanupradāsyati /
analyzed: asya ca tathāgatasya dharmaparyāyam uddiśya eka divasam api purobhaktam api piṇḍa pātram anupradāsyati
translated: They will offer even a single day's meal, or a single alms bowl of food, for the sake of this tathagata's sutra.

original: te sarve cakravartirājyalābhino bhaviṣyanti /🔽na ca kadācitkṣutpipāsāduḥkhaṃ pratyanubhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: te sarve cakravarti rājya lābhinaḥ bhaviṣyanti  na ca kadācid kṣudh pipāsā duḥkham pratyanubhaviṣyanti
translated: All of them will attain the kingdom of a universal monarch.🔽And they will never again experience the suffering of hunger or thirst.

analyzed: na ca kadācid naraka bandhana duḥkham pratyanubhaviṣyanti
translated: And they will never again experience the suffering of hell or imprisonment.

analyzed: na ca priya viprayoga duḥkham
translated: And they will not suffer from separation from loved ones.

analyzed: api ca sarva duḥkhebhyaḥ vimucyante
translated: Moreover, they will be freed from all suffering.

analyzed: sukhāvatī lokadhātum anugamiṣyanti
translated: they will go to the world system of Sukhāvatī.

original: tasya ca bhagavato 'mitābhasya tathāgatasya purataḥ saṃmukhaṃ dharmaṃ śrutvā vyākaraṇamanuprāpsyanti /
analyzed: tasya ca bhagavataḥ mitābhasya tathāgatasya puratas saṃmukham dharmam śrutvā vyākaraṇam anuprāpsyanti
translated: And having heard the Dharma in the presence of the Blessed One, the Tathāgata Amitābha, they will attain the prophecy.

analyzed: api ca mahā rāja
translated: Moreover, great king,

analyzed: śrūyatām dāna phalam
translated: listen to the fruit of generosity.

original: tadyathāpi nāma kulaputra ye tathāgatasyārhataḥ samyaksaṃbuddhasya tiṣṭhataḥ parinirvṛtasya vā piṇḍapātramanuprayacchanti /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma kula putra ye tathāgatasya arhataḥ samyaksaṃbuddhasya tiṣṭhataḥ parinirvṛtasya vā piṇḍa pātram anuprayacchanti
translated: Just as, noble sir, those who offer alms-food to the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One, whether present or in parinirvāṇa,

analyzed: teṣām idam puṇya skandham pravakṣyāmi
translated: I will proclaim the mass of merit of those.

analyzed: tat yathā api nāma kula putra vaidya
translated: Just as, noble sir, a physician

original: dvādaśagaṅgānadīvālukopamā mama sadṛśā bodhisattvā mahāsattvā bhaveyuḥ /🔽te caikasthāne dhārayeyurdivyakalpatatpuṇyapramāṇamudgrahītuṃ sarvasukhopadhānena samupatiṣṭhamānāḥ /
analyzed: dvādaśa gaṅgā nadī vālukā upamāḥ mama sadṛśāḥ bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ bhaveyuḥ  te ca eka sthāne dhārayeyuḥ divya kalpa tad puṇya pramāṇam udgrahītum sarva sukha upadhānena samupatiṣṭhamānāḥ
translated: twelve koṭīs of my equals, bodhisattva mahāsattvas,🔽and they, maintaining themselves in one place, would be able to grasp the measure of the merit of that divine eon, by providing all forms of comfort.

original: te 'pi sarve samagrībhūtā na śakyante ekasya piṇḍaprātrapradānasya kuśalamūlasaṃbhārasya puṇyaskandhaṃ gaṇayitum /
analyzed: te pi sarve samagrībhūtāḥ na śakyante ekasya piṇḍa prātra pradānasya kuśala mūla saṃbhārasya puṇya skandham gaṇayitum
translated: All of them together would not be able to calculate the mass of merit, the accumulation of the root of merit, from giving a single alms-meal.

analyzed: prāk eva aham ekākī asmin asura bhavane viharāmi
translated: I used to stay alone in this asura palace long ago.

original: tadyathāpi nāma kulaputra śakyate mayā paramāṇurajasāṃ pramāṇamudgrahītum /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma kula putra śakyate mayā paramāṇu rajasām pramāṇam udgrahītum
translated: Just as, noble son, I am able to grasp the measure of the atoms,

original: na tu kulaputra śakyaṃ mayā piṇḍapātrasya puṇyaskandhaṃ gaṇayitum /
analyzed: na tu kula putra śakyam mayā piṇḍapātrasya puṇya skandham gaṇayitum
translated: but, noble son, I am not able to calculate the merit-aggregate of the alms-food.

original: tadyathāpi nama kulaputra caturṣu mahādvīpeṣu strīpuruṣadārakadārikādayaste sarve kṛṣikarmānte udyuktā bhaveyuḥ /
analyzed: tat yathā api nama kula putra caturṣu mahā dvīpeṣu strī puruṣa dāraka dārikā ādayaḥ te sarve kṛṣi karmānte udyuktāḥ bhaveyuḥ
translated: Just as, noble son, in the four great continents, all the women, men, boys, girls, and so on, would be engaged in agricultural work,

analyzed: te catur mahā dvīpeṣu na anyam kṛṣim kārayeyuḥ
translated: and in the four great continents they would not do any other agriculture,

analyzed: kālena kālam nāga rājānaḥ varṣa dhārām anuprayacchanti
translated: and the naga kings would rain down water at the right time,

analyzed: te ca sarṣapāt niṣpādyante
translated: and those mustard seeds would be produced,

analyzed: tat ca eka dvīpa khalam kuryāt
translated: and that would make one great granary in one continent.

original: sarve te strīpuruṣadārakadārikādayaḥ śakaṭairbhārairmuṭaiḥ pīṭhakairuṣṭrairgobhirgardabhaiḥ sarve te mardayitvā tasmin mahākhalake mahāntaṃ
analyzed: sarve te strī puruṣa dāraka dārikā ādayaḥ śakaṭaiḥ bhāraiḥ muṭaiḥ pīṭhakaiḥ uṣṭraiḥ gobhiḥ gardabhaiḥ sarve te mardayitvā tasmin mahā khalake mahāntam
translated: All those women, men, boys, girls, and so on, with carts, loads, baskets, seats, camels, cows, donkeys, all of them would grind it and make a great

analyzed: rāśim kuryāt
translated: heap in that great granary.

analyzed: gobhiḥ gardabha ādibhiḥ mardayitvā mahāntam rāśim niṣpādayitvā
translated: having ground it with cows, donkeys, and so on, and produced a great heap,

analyzed: tat śakyam kula putre ekam ekam phalam gaṇayitum
translated: Noble one, it is possible to count each individual fruit,

original: na tu kulaputra śakyate piṇḍapātrasya puṇyaskandhaṃ gaṇayitum /
analyzed: na tu kula putra śakyate piṇḍapātrasya puṇya skandham gaṇayitum
translated: but, noble one, it is not possible to calculate the heap of merit from the alms offering.

original: tadyathāpi nāma kulaputra sumeruḥ parvatarājaḥ caturaśītiyojanasahasrāṇi adhastādupagataḥ ūrdhveṇa caturaśītiyojanasahasrāṇyucchrayeṇa ca /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma kula putra sumeruḥ parvata rājaḥ caturaśīti yojana sahasrāṇi adhastāt upagataḥ ūrdhveṇa caturaśīti yojana sahasrāṇi ucchrayeṇa ca
translated: For example, noble one, Mount Sumeru, the king of mountains, is 84,000 yojanas deep and 84,000 yojanas high.

analyzed: sa kula putra bhūrja rāśiḥ bhavet
translated: That, noble one, would be a pile of birch bark.

analyzed: mahā samudraḥ melanduka parimaṇḍalam bhavet
translated: The great ocean would be the size of the moon's orb.

original: ye caturdvīpanivāsinaḥ puruṣadārakadārikāste ca sarve lekhakā bhaveyuḥ /
analyzed: ye catur dvīpa nivāsinaḥ puruṣa dāraka dārikāḥ te ca sarve lekhakāḥ bhaveyuḥ
translated: And all the men, boys, and girls living in the four continents would be scribes.

analyzed: tat ca sumeru parvata rāja anta paryantam likhitam bhavet
translated: And that, up to the end of Mount Sumeru, the king of mountains, would be written.

analyzed: tat ca kula putra śakyam mayā ekaika akṣaram gaṇayitum
translated: That, noble one, it is possible for me to count each individual letter,

original: na tu kulaputra śakyate piṇḍapātrasya puṇyaskandhaṃ gaṇayitum /
analyzed: na tu kula putra śakyate piṇḍapātrasya puṇya skandham gaṇayitum
translated: but, noble one, it is not possible to calculate the heap of merit from the alms offering.

original: tadyathāpi nāma kulaputra lekhakāḥ sarve te daśabhūmipratiṣṭhitā bodhisattvā bhaveyuḥ paryāpannāḥ /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma kula putra lekhakāḥ sarve te daśa bhūmi pratiṣṭhitāḥ bodhisattvāḥ bhaveyuḥ paryāpannāḥ
translated: For example, noble one, all those scribes would be bodhisattvas established in the ten grounds, having attained them.

original: yacca teṣāṃ daśabhūmipratiṣṭhitānāṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānāṃ puṇyaskandhaṃ tamekasya piṇḍapātrasya puṇyaskandhaṃ gaṇayitum /
analyzed: yat ca teṣām daśa bhūmi pratiṣṭhitānām bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām puṇya skandham tam ekasya piṇḍa pātrasya puṇya skandham gaṇayitum
translated: And the heap of merit of those bodhisattva mahāsattvas established in the ten grounds, compared to the heap of merit of a single alms offering,

original: tadyathāpi nāma kulaputra gaṅgāyā nadyā vālukāsamudrasya ca śakyaṃ mayā ekaikaṃ vālukāṃ gaṇayitum /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma kula putra gaṅgāyāḥ nadyāḥ vālukā samudrasya ca śakyam mayā ekaikam vālukām gaṇayitum
translated: Just as, noble son, I am able to count each grain of sand in the Ganges river and in the ocean,

original: na tu kulaputra śakyate mayā piṇḍapātrasya puṇyaskandhaṃ gaṇayitum /
analyzed: na tu kula putra śakyate mayā piṇḍapātrasya puṇya skandham gaṇayitum
translated: but, noble son, I am not able to count the heap of merit of an alms offering.

original: tadyathāpi nāma kulaputra śakyate mayā sarvamaturāsrāṃ /🔽pramāṇamudgrahītum /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma kula putra śakyate mayā sarvam atura asrām  pramāṇam udgrahītum
translated: Just as, noble son, I am able to grasp the measure of all the atoms,

original: na śakyaṃ mayā kulaputra piṇḍapātrasya puṇyaskandhaṃ gaṇayitum //
analyzed: na śakyam mayā kula putra piṇḍapātrasya puṇya skandham gaṇayitum
translated: but, noble son, I am not able to count the heap of merit of an alms offering.

original: atha balisurendraḥ idaṃ ca tasya bhagavato 'valokiteśvarasyāntikātpiṇḍapātrakuśalabhūtasya
analyzed: atha bali sura indraḥ idam ca tasya bhagavataḥ valokiteśvarasya antikāt piṇḍa pātra kuśala bhūtasya
translated: Then Bali, the lord of the asuras, having rejoiced in all that was being taught by the Blessed One Avalokiteśvara about the merit of alms offerings,

analyzed: su kṣetra avarūḍha bīja pātra bhūtasya nirdeśyamānasya tat sarvam anumodya sa aśru durdina vadanaḥ
translated: which is like a field for planting seeds, with a face full of tears and sorrow,

original: gadgadakaṇṭhaḥ bāṣpaparipūrṇa ucchvasan avalokiteśvaraṃ bodhisattvaṃ mahāsattvametadavocat
analyzed: gadgada kaṇṭhaḥ bāṣpa paripūrṇaḥ ucchvasan avalokiteśvaram bodhisattvam mahāsattvam etat avocat
translated: With a choked voice, his throat filled with tears, he said to the Bodhisattva Mahāsattva Avalokiteśvara:

original: kīdṛśaṃ mayā bhagavan balinā karma kṛtaṃ dānaṃ dattam /
analyzed: kīdṛśam mayā bhagavan balinā karma kṛtam dānam dattam
translated: What kind of offering have I made, Blessed One? What gift have I given?

analyzed: yena iha eva janmani bandhanam anuprāptam
translated: By what means have I attained bondage in this very life?

original: sāntaḥ puraparivāreṇa kukṣetre mayā dānaṃ dattam /
analyzed: sa antar pura parivāreṇa ku kṣetre mayā dānam dattam
translated: With my inner retinue, I have given gifts in a bad field.

analyzed: tasya eva tad karmaṇaḥ phalam anubhavāmi
translated: I experience the fruit of that very karma.

analyzed: athavā sarvajña kṣetre bhasma muṣṭim upakṣiptam api amṛtam pariniṣpadyate
translated: Or, even a handful of ashes thrown into the field of the Omniscient One becomes perfected nectar.

analyzed: mayā ajñānena yajitam
translated: By me, in ignorance, a sacrifice was performed.

original: yadā mayā ca bhagavan tairthikadṛṣṭiparyāpannena mānagrastamānasena ca yajñaṃ yajatā mahādānasamucchrayaṃ kartumārabdham /
analyzed: yadā mayā ca bhagavan tairthika dṛṣṭi paryāpannena māna grasta mānasena ca yajñam yajatā mahā dāna samucchrayam kartum ārabdham
translated: When, Blessed One, by me, fallen into the views of the tīrthikas, with a mind seized by pride, a sacrifice was begun to be performed, and a great heap of gifts was started,

original: tadā me tatra yajñe vāmanakarūpeṇa yācanako hiṃsraḥ samāgataḥ /
analyzed: tadā me tatra yajñe vāmanaka rūpeṇa yācanakaḥ hiṃsraḥ samāgataḥ
translated: then to me in that sacrifice, a cruel beggar in the form of a dwarf came.

original: tasya me maulīkuṇḍalasragdāmāni ratnābharaṇāni hyaśvarathādīni muktvā ratnakavacāni marakatapralambitāni Vaidya
analyzed: tasya me maulī kuṇḍala sraj dāmāni ratna ābharaṇāni hi aśva ratha ādīni muktvā ratna kavacāni marakata pralambitāni vaidya
translated: Having given him my turban, earrings, garlands, jewels, horses, chariots, and so on, my jeweled armor adorned with emeralds, my

original: cāmarapralambitāni muktāhārāṇi muktikājālapralambitāni muktikājālapraticchannāni muktikākalāpajālāṅgulīkāni sauvarṇaghaṇṭikārūpyanibaddhāni
analyzed: cāmara pralambitāni muktā hārāṇi muktikā jāla pralambitāni muktikā jāla praticchannāni muktikā kalāpa jāla aṅgulīkāni sauvarṇa ghaṇṭikā rūpya nibaddhāni
translated: with pearl necklaces hanging down, covered with nets of pearls, with fingers adorned with garlands of pearls, with golden bells bound with silver,

analyzed: raṇaraṇāyamānāni anyāni ca
translated: and others

original: kapilāsahasrāṇi rūpyapādāni sauvarṇaśṛṅgāni muktājālapralambitāni muktikājālapraticchannāni arghapātrasamāyuktāni nānāvicitraghaṇṭāratnasamāyuktāni /
analyzed: kapilā sahasrāṇi rūpya pādāni sauvarṇa śṛṅgāni muktā jāla pralambitāni muktikā jāla praticchannāni arghapātra samāyuktāni nānā vicitra ghaṇṭā ratna samāyuktāni
translated: with thousands of tawny cows with silver hooves and golden horns, hanging with nets of pearls, covered with nets of pearls, equipped with offering bowls, equipped with various wonderful jeweled bells.

analyzed: tādṛkṣāṇi kapilā sahasrāṇi anyāni ca
translated: Such were the thousands of tawny cows, and others

original: kumārīṇāṃ śatasahasrāṇi paramayā gurvaruṇapuṣkalatayā samanvāgatānāṃ nānāvicitrāṇāṃ
analyzed: kumārīṇām śata sahasrāṇi paramayā guru aruṇa puṣkala tayā samanvāgatānām nānā vicitrāṇām
translated: with hundreds of thousands of young girls endowed with the utmost beauty and excellence, of various kinds,

analyzed: kanyā lakṣaṇa samalaṃkṛtānām parama rūpa śobhamānām apsarasām api pratispardhinīnām divya alaṃkāra vibhūṣitānām
translated: adorned with the marks of maidens, of supreme beauty and splendor, rivaling even the celestial nymphs, adorned with celestial ornaments,

analyzed: maulī kuṇḍala sraj dāma parikṣepikāṇām keyūra kaṭaka nūpura kaṭi mekhalā hasta uttaryā karṇa pṛṣṭha uttaryā
translated: with diadems, earrings, garlands, and wreaths, with bracelets, armlets, anklets, waistbands, hand covers, ear covers,🔽and others

analyzed: hasta aṅgulīya samāyuktānām sarasarāyamāṇa mālā samāyuktānām nānā raṅga uparakta vastra prāvṛtānām anyāni
translated: They were adorned with finger rings, necklaces, and various colored garments.

analyzed: ratna pīṭha śata sahasrāṇi anekāni suvarṇa rāśi rūpya rāśīni ratna rāśīni sthāpitāni
translated: Hundreds of thousands of jeweled seats, many heaps of gold, silver, and jewels were set up.

original: anekāni ca vastrābharaṇāni sthāpitāni /🔽anekāni ca gokulaśatāni sagopālasamāyuktāni sajjīkṛtāni /
analyzed: anekāni ca vastra ābharaṇāni sthāpitāni  anekāni ca go kula śatāni sa gopāla samāyuktāni sajjīkṛtāni
translated: Many garments and ornaments were set up.🔽Many hundreds of thousands of cowherds were prepared.

analyzed: anekāni anna pāna śatānām sthāpitāni
translated: Many hundreds of foods and drinks were set up.

original: divyarasarasāgropetānyāhārāṇi sajjīkṛtāṇi /🔽anekāni suvarṇarūpyamayāni daṇḍāni ratnasaṃyuktāni satataṃ vyavasthāpitāni /
analyzed: divya rasa rasa agra upetāni āhārāṇi sajjīkṛtāṇi  anekāni suvarṇa rūpya mayāni daṇḍāni ratna saṃyuktāni satatam vyavasthāpitāni
translated: Divine elixirs and delicacies were prepared.🔽Many golden and silver staffs adorned with jewels were always set up.

analyzed: muktā āhāra śata sahasrāṇi pralambitāni  kāśika vastra sat cīvarāṇi pralambitāni
translated: hundreds of thousands of pearl necklaces hanging down,

original: lohitadaṇḍāni suvarṇarūpyapatrāṇi anekāni puṣpavṛkṣaśatāni anekāni puṣkariṇīśatāni puṣpaparipūrṇāni paramaśobhanīyāni prādurbhūtāni //
analyzed: lohita daṇḍāni suvarṇa rūpya patrāṇi anekāni puṣpavṛkṣa śatāni anekāni puṣkariṇī śatāni puṣpa paripūrṇāni parama śobhanīyāni prādurbhūtāni
translated: red-stemmed golden and silver-leafed flowers, hundreds of thousands of flower trees, and hundreds of lotus ponds filled with flowers of supreme beauty.

original: atha gaganagañjo bodhisattvo mahāsattvo bhagavantametadavocat nāgacchati bhagavannavalokiteśvaro bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ /
analyzed: atha gaganagañjaḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ bhagavantam etat avocat na āgacchati bhagavan avalokiteśvaraḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ
translated: Then the Bodhisattva Mahāsattva Gaganagañja said this to the Blessed One: Blessed One, the Bodhisattva Mahāsattva Avalokiteśvara has not come.

original: bhagavānāha eṣa kulaputra tato balerasurendrasya bhavanānniṣkamya paramabhīṣaṇīyaṃ
analyzed: bhagavān āha eṣa kula putra tatas baleḥ asura indrasya bhavanāt niṣkamya parama bhīṣaṇīyam
translated: The Blessed One said, Noble son, he has emerged from the abode of the asura king Bali and is coming here with a retinue of many hundreds of thousands of asuras, causing a great, terrifying, and hair-raising uproar.

original: tamondhakāraṃ nāma pṛthivīpradeśaṃ yakṣarākṣasānāṃ bhūmiṃ amanuṣyāvacaramapṛthivīpradeśaṃ tatra gacchati /
analyzed: tamaḥ undhakāram nāma pṛthivī pradeśam yakṣa rākṣasānām bhūmim a manuṣya avacarama pṛthivī pradeśam tatra gacchati
translated: He goes to a place on earth named Tamonandhara, a land of Yakshas and Rakshasas, a place on earth inhabited by non-humans,

analyzed: yatra kula putra candra ādityau na jñāyete
translated: where, son of good family, neither the moon nor the sun are known.

original: tatra ca pṛthivīpradeśe varado nāma cintāmaṇiratnarājo 'sti /
analyzed: tatra ca pṛthivī pradeśe varadaḥ nāma cintāmaṇi ratna rājaḥ sti
translated: And in that place on earth, there is a wish-fulfilling jewel named Varada,

analyzed: sa ca tatra avabhāsam kurute
translated: which shines there.

analyzed: anekāni yakṣa rākṣasa śata sahasrāṇi tasmin dvīpe prativasanti
translated: Many hundreds of thousands of Yakshas and Rakshasas dwell on that island.

analyzed: yadā avalokiteśvaraḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ prativasati
translated: When the Bodhisattva Mahasattva Avalokitesvara dwells there,

analyzed: tadā darśana mātrāt sarva yakṣa rākṣasāḥ parama hṛṣṭa tuṣṭāḥ pramudita hṛdayāḥ bhavanti
translated: then merely by seeing him, all the Yakshas and Rakshasas become extremely joyful, satisfied, and delighted in their hearts.

analyzed: atha te valokiteśvarasya purastāt dhāvanti
translated: Then they run in front of Avalokitesvara,

analyzed: nirdhāvanti
translated: and run after him.

original: dhāvitvā pādayoḥ praṇipatya saṃbhāṣayanti mā tvaṃ bhagavan śrāntaklānto yastvaṃ cirakālena dṛṣṭaḥ /
analyzed: dhāvitvā pādayoḥ praṇipatya saṃbhāṣayanti mā tvam bhagavan śrānta klāntaḥ yaḥ tvam cira kālena dṛṣṭaḥ
translated: Having run, they bow at his feet and say, Do not tire yourself, Blessed One, since you are seen after a long time.

analyzed: yaḥ tvam asyām tamaḥ ndhakārāyām bhumau viharasi
translated: You who dwell on this dark earth.

original: Vaidya sa kathayati anekāni kartavyāni me /
analyzed: vaidya sa kathayati anekāni kartavyāni me
translated: The doctor says, I have many things to do.

analyzed: na ca mayā eka sattvasya arthe ātma bhāvaḥ pariniṣpāditaḥ
translated: And I have not perfected my body for the sake of a single being.

analyzed: api tu sarva sattvānām antike mayā mahā karuṇā citta tā utpādayitavyā
translated: Rather, I should arouse the mind of great compassion towards all beings.

original: atha te sarve yakṣarākṣasā divyasuvarṇaratnamayaṃ siṃhāsanaṃ prasamayanti tasyāvalokiteśvarasyārthe vicitraiḥ puṣpamayaiḥ saṃchāditam /
analyzed: atha te sarve yakṣa rākṣasāḥ divya suvarṇa ratna mayam siṃhāsanam tasya avalokiteśvarasya arthe vicitraiḥ puṣpa mayaiḥ saṃchāditam
translated: Then all those yakshas and rakshasas prepare a lion throne made of divine gold and jewels for Avalokiteshvara, covered with various flower-made [ornaments].

analyzed: yatra ca bhagavān niṣadya dharmam deśayati
translated: Where the Blessed One sits and teaches the Dharma.

original: sa tairyakṣarākṣasairnītvā tatra divyasuvarṇaratnamaye siṃhāsane viśrāmitaḥ /
analyzed: sa taiḥ yakṣa rākṣasaiḥ nītvā tatra divya suvarṇa ratna maye siṃhāsane viśrāmitaḥ
translated: He is taken there by those yakshas and rakshasas and rested on that lion throne made of divine gold and jewels.

original: tataḥ avalokiteśvarasteṣāṃ yakṣarākṣasānāṃ dharma deśayati śṛṇvattu bhavantaḥ /
analyzed: tatas avalokiteśvaraḥ teṣām yakṣa rākṣasānām dharma deśayati śṛṇvat tu bhavantaḥ
translated: Then Avalokiteshvara teaches the Dharma to those yakshas and rakshasas, saying, Listen, you should listen.

original: āryakāraṇḍavyūhasya mahāyānasūtraratnarājasya catuṣpādikāmapi gāthāṃ ye śroṣyanti /
analyzed: ārya kāraṇḍa vyūhasya mahāyāna sūtra ratna rājasya catuṣpādikām api gāthām ye śroṣyanti
translated: Those who will hear even a four-line verse from the precious king of great vehicle sutras, the noble Karandavyūha,

analyzed: śrutvā ca dhārayiṣyanti paryavāpsyanti pravartayiṣyanti
translated: having heard it, will remember it, master it, and propagate it.

analyzed: yoniśam ca manasi kariṣyanti
translated: And they will properly contemplate it.

analyzed: teṣām idam puṇya skandha saṃcodanaḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: For them, this will be an encouragement to accumulate this heap of merit.

original: tadyathāpi nāma kulaputrāḥ śakyaṃ mayā paramāṇurajasāṃ pramāṇamudgrahītum /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma kula putrāḥ śakyam mayā paramāṇu rajasām pramāṇam udgrahītum
translated: “Noble ones, I can count the number of atoms in a world realm,

original: na tu kulaputrāḥ śakyaṃ mayā kāraṇḍavyūhasya mahāyānasūtraratnarājasya puṇyaskandhaṃ gaṇayitum /
analyzed: na tu kula putrāḥ śakyam mayā kāraṇḍa vyūhasya mahāyāna sūtra ratna rājasya puṇya skandham gaṇayitum
translated: but, noble ones, I cannot measure the amount of merit of the precious king of the Mahāyāna sūtras, The Sūtra of the Basket’s Display.

original: tadyathāpi nāma kulaputrāḥ śakyaṃ mayā mahāsamudrasyaikamudakabinduṃ gaṇayitum /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma kula putrāḥ śakyam mayā mahā samudrasya ekam udaka bindum gaṇayitum
translated: “Noble ones, I can count the number of drops in the ocean,

original: na tu kulaputrāḥ śakyaṃ mayā kāraṇḍavyūhasya mahāyānasūtraratnarājasya catuṣpādikāyā api gāthāyāḥ puṇyaskandhaṃ gaṇayitum /🔽tadyathāpi nāma kulaputrāḥ dvādaśagaṅgānadīvālukopamāstathāgatā arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhādvādaśakalpānekasthāne dhārayeyuḥ /
analyzed: na tu kula putrāḥ śakyam mayā kāraṇḍa vyūhasya mahāyāna sūtra ratna rājasya catuṣpādikāyāḥ api gāthāyāḥ puṇya skandham gaṇayitum  tat yathā api nāma kula putrāḥ dvādaśa gaṅgā nadī vālukā upamāḥ tathāgatāḥ arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhāḥ dvādaśa kalpān eka sthāne dhārayeyuḥ
translated: but, noble ones, I cannot count the amount of merit in even one four-line verse of the precious king of the Mahāyāna sūtras, The Sūtra of the Basket’s Display.

analyzed: cīvara piṇḍa pātra śayana āsana glāna pratyaya bhaiṣajya pariṣkāraiḥ puṣpa dhūpa gandha mālya vilepana cūrṇa cīvara chatra dhvaja ghaṇṭā patākābhiḥ
translated: “Noble ones, suppose that tathāgatas, arhats, perfectly enlightened buddhas equal to the number of grains of sand in twelve Ganges Rivers were to live for eons equal to the number of grains of sand in twelve Ganges Rivers, and were to be attended with robes, alms, beds, and medicines for the sick, and with all that is necessary, and with flowers, incense, perfume, garlands, ointments, powders, clothing, parasols, banners, flags, and lamps.

original: te 'pi tathāgatāḥ sarve sahitā bhūtvā kāraṇḍavyūhasya mahāyānasūtraratnarājasya catuṣpādikāyā api gāthāyāḥ puṇyaskandhaṃ gaṇayituṃ na śaknuvanti
analyzed: te pi tathāgatāḥ sarve sahitāḥ bhūtvā kāraṇḍa vyūhasya mahāyāna sūtra ratna rājasya catuṣpādikāyāḥ api gāthāyāḥ puṇya skandham gaṇayitum na śaknuvanti
translated: All those Tathāgatas together would not be able to calculate the merit of even a four-line verse from the precious king of sūtras of the Great Vehicle called The Flower Ornament.

analyzed: prāk eva aham ekākī tamaḥ ndhakāra bhūmau viharāmi
translated: How much less so could I alone, dwelling in the darkness of ignorance?

original: tadyathāpi nāma kulaputrāścaturmahādvīpeṣvekaikadvīpapramāṇaṃ gṛhaṃ vihāraṃ vā kārayeddivyasuvarṇaratnamayam /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma kula putrāḥ catur mahā dvīpeṣu ekaika dvīpa pramāṇam gṛham vihāram vā kārayet divya suvarṇa ratna mayam
translated: Just as, noble sons, one might build a house or a monastery in each of the four great continents, the size of each continent, made of divine gold and jewels,

original: tatra gṛhe vihāre vā stūpasahasraṃ kuryāt /
analyzed: tatra gṛhe vihāre vā stūpa sahasram kuryāt
translated: and in that house or monastery, one might build a thousand stūpas,

analyzed: teṣām ca eka dine dhātvā avaropaṇam kuryāt
translated: and on one day, one might perform the enshrinement of relics in them,

analyzed: yat ca teṣām dhātvā avaropaṇeṣu pūjāyām puṇya skandham
translated: and the accumulation of merit from that worship of the enshrinements of relics,

original: tato bahutaraṃ kāraṇḍavyūhasya mahāyānasūtraratnarājasya catuṣpādikāyā api gāthāyāḥ puṇyaskandham /
analyzed: tatas bahutaram kāraṇḍa vyūhasya mahāyāna sūtra ratna rājasya catuṣpādikāyāḥ api gāthāyāḥ puṇya skandham
translated: that is far greater than the accumulation of merit of even a four-line verse from the precious king of sūtras of the Great Vehicle called The Flower Ornament.

original: tadyathāpi nāma kulaputrāḥ pañca mahānadyo sahasranadīparivārā mahāsamudramupasaṃkrāmanti /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma kula putrāḥ pañca mahā nadyaḥ sahasra nadī parivārāḥ mahā samudram upasaṃkrāmanti
translated: Just as, noble sons, the five great rivers, with their thousand accompanying rivers, flow into the great ocean,

original: evameva kulaputrā asya kāraṇḍavyūhamahāyānasūtraratnarājasya catuṣpādikāmapi gāthāṃ śṛṇvatāṃ puṇyaughapravāhamupapravahati //
analyzed: evam eva kula putrāḥ asya kāraṇḍa vyūha mahāyāna sūtra ratna rājasya catuṣpādikām api gāthām śṛṇvatām puṇya ogha pravāham upapravahati
translated: In the same way, noble ones, even those who hear a quarter of a verse from this precious king of the great vehicle sūtras, the Sūtra of the White Lotus of the Good Dharma, will have a great flood of merit flow towards them.”

original: atha te yakṣarākṣasā avalokiteśvarametadavocan ye sattvāḥ kāraṇḍavyūhaṃ mahāyānasūtraratnarājaṃ likhāpayiṣyanti /
analyzed: atha te yakṣa rākṣasāḥ avalokiteśvaram etat avocan ye sattvāḥ kāraṇḍa vyūham mahāyāna sūtra ratna rājam likhāpayiṣyanti
translated: Then those yakṣas and rākṣasas said to Avalokiteśvara, “Those beings who will cause the precious king of the great vehicle sūtras, the Sūtra of the White Lotus of the Good Dharma, to be written,

original: teṣāṃ kidṛśaṃ puṇyaskandhaṃ bhavati /🔽sa āha aprameyaṃ teṣāṃ kulaputrāḥ puṇyaskandhaṃ prabhavati /
analyzed: teṣām kidṛśam puṇya skandham bhavati  saḥ āha aprameyam teṣām kula putrāḥ puṇya skandham prabhavati
translated: what kind of mass of merit will they have?”

analyzed: ye kāraṇḍa vyūham mahāyāna sūtra ratna rājam likhāpayanti
translated: He said, “Noble ones, the mass of merit of those who cause the precious king of the great vehicle sūtras, the Sūtra of the White Lotus of the Good Dharma, to be written, becomes immeasurable.

analyzed: taiḥ caturaśīti dharma skandha sahasrāṇi likhāpiutāni bhavanti
translated: By them the eighty-four thousand parts of the Dharma have been caused to be written.

analyzed: te rājānaḥ bhavanti
translated: They become kings.

analyzed: cakravartinaḥ catur dvīpa īśvarāḥ bhavanti
translated: They become universal monarchs, lords of the four continents.

original: te sahasraṃ putrāṇāṃ śūrāṇāṃ vīrāṇāṃ varāṅgarūpiṇāṃ parasainyapramardakānāṃ janayanti /
analyzed: te sahasram putrāṇām śūrāṇām vīrāṇām vara aṅga rūpiṇām para sainya pramardakānām janayanti
translated: They give birth to a thousand sons, who are brave, heroic, beautiful, and crush the armies of others.

analyzed: ye satata parigraham kāraṇḍa vyūhasya mahāyāna sūtra ratna rājasya nāmam anusmaranti
translated: Those who constantly remember the name of the precious king of the great vehicle sūtras, the Sūtra of the White Lotus of the Good Dharma,

analyzed: mucyante te īdṛśāt saṃsārikāt duḥkhāt
translated: They are liberated from such suffering in the cycle of existence.

analyzed: bhavanti
translated: They are liberated from birth, old age, sickness, death, sorrow, lamentation, pain, grief, and despair.

analyzed: yatra yatra upapadyante
translated: Wherever they are reborn,

original: tatra tatra jātau jātau jātismarā bhavanti /
analyzed: tatra tatra jātau jātau jātismarāḥ bhavanti
translated: in that very birth they will remember their past lives.

original: Vaidya teṣāṃ ca kāyāt gośīrṣacandanagandho vāsyati /
analyzed: vaidya teṣām ca kāyāt gośīrṣa candana gandhaḥ vāsyati
translated: And from their bodies will emanate the fragrance of gośīrṣa sandalwood.

analyzed: nīlotpala gandhinaḥ mukhāḥ bhavanti
translated: Their mouths will have the fragrance of blue lotuses.

analyzed: paripūrṇa gātrāḥ ca bhavanti
translated: They will have perfect bodies.

analyzed: mahānagnāḥ aparimāṇa puṇya bala samanvāgatāḥ ca te sat purūṣāḥ bhaviṣyanti
translated: Those good men will have great splendor and be endowed with immeasurable merit and strength.

original: na kadācit yakṣatvaṃ na rākṣasatvaṃ na pretatvaṃ na piśācatvaṃ na pūtanātvaṃ na kaṭapūtanātvaṃ na manuṣyadāridryaṃ pratyanubhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: na kadācid yakṣa tvam na rākṣasa tvam na preta tvam na piśāca tvam na pūtanā tvam na kaṭapūtanā tvam na manuṣya dāridryam pratyanubhaviṣyanti
translated: They will never experience the state of being a yakṣa, a rākṣasa, a preta, a piśāca, a pūtanā, a kaṭapūtanā, or the poverty of being a human.

original: gaṅgānadīvālukāsamānāṃ buddhānāṃ bhagavatāṃ sevāpuṇyaskandhena samanvāgatā bhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: gaṅgā nadī vālukā samānām buddhānām bhagavatām sevā puṇya skandhena samanvāgatāḥ bhaviṣyanti
translated: They will be endowed with the merit and accumulation of virtue of serving buddhas as numerous as the sands of the Ganges River.

original: ye 'pi kecit kulaputrāḥ sattvā asmāt kāraṇḍavyūhamahāyānasūtraratnarājādekākṣaramapi nāmadheyamapi catuṣpādikāmapi gāthāṃ likhāpayiṣyanti /
analyzed: ye pi kecid kula putrāḥ sattvāḥ asmāt kāraṇḍa vyūha mahāyāna sūtra ratna rājāt eka akṣaram api nāmadheyam api catuṣpādikām api gāthām likhāpayiṣyanti
translated: Those sons of good family who will cause even a single syllable, a name, or even a four-line verse of this precious king of sūtras, the Great Vehicle sūtra called The Basket's Display, to be written down,

original: teṣāṃ pañcānantaryāṇi karmāṇi niravaśeṣaṃ parikṣayaṃ gamiṣyanti /
analyzed: teṣām pañca ānantaryāṇi karmāṇi niravaśeṣam parikṣayam gamiṣyanti
translated: their five acts of immediate retribution will be completely exhausted without remainder.

analyzed: te ca abhirūpāḥ bhaviṣyanti
translated: They will be handsome.

analyzed: prāsādikāḥ bhaviṣyanti
translated: They will be pleasing.

analyzed: darśanīyāḥ ca bhaviṣyanti
translated: They will be beautiful to behold.

analyzed: bahu jana priya manāpa darśanena ca bhaviṣyanti
translated: They will be loved and delightful to many people.

original: teṣāṃ na kaścit kāye vyādhiḥ prabhaviṣyati /
analyzed: teṣām na kaścid kāye vyādhiḥ prabhaviṣyati
translated: No disease will prevail in their bodies.

original: na cakṣurogaṃ na śrotrarogaṃ na ghrāṇarogaṃ na jihvārogaṃ na kāyarogam /
analyzed: na cakṣu rogam na śrotra rogam na ghrāṇa rogam na jihvā rogam na kāya rogam
translated: No eye disease, no ear disease, no nose disease, no tongue disease, no body disease.

analyzed: na hīna aṅgāni bhaviṣyanti
translated: They will not have incomplete limbs.

analyzed: na pratyantikeṣu janapadeṣu pratyājāyante
translated: They will not be reborn in border regions.

original: na mleccheṣu na pāpakuleṣu norabhrikeṣu na kaukkuṭikeṣu na jatyeṣu /
analyzed: na mleccheṣu na pāpa kuleṣu na urabhrikeṣu na kaukkuṭikeṣu na jatyeṣu
translated: Not among barbarians, not in evil families, not among shepherds, not among poultry keepers, not among hunters.

analyzed: pratyājāyante
translated: They will be reborn.

analyzed: su pariśuddha kāyāḥ ca te sat puruṣāḥ bhaviṣyanti
translated: Those good men will have extremely pure bodies.

original: atha āryāvalokiteśvaro bodhisattvo mahāsattva evaṃ teṣāṃ yakṣarākṣasānāṃ tamondhakāravāsināṃ sarveṣāṃ cānulomikāṃ dharmadeśanāṃ kṛtavān /
analyzed: atha ārya avalokiteśvaraḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ evam teṣām yakṣa rākṣasānām tamaḥ ndhakāra vāsinām sarveṣām ca ānulomikām dharma deśanām kṛtavān
translated: Then the noble Avalokiteśvara, the Bodhisattva, the Great Being, gave to all those Yakṣas and Rākṣasas dwelling in the darkness a Dharma discourse in accordance with their dispositions.

original: te yakṣarākṣasāstāṃ dharmadeśanāṃ śubhāṃ śrutvā kecit srotaāpattiphale pratiṣṭhitāḥ /🔽kecit sakṛdāgāmiphale /
analyzed: te yakṣa rākṣasāḥ tām dharma deśanām śubhām śrutvā kecid srotaāpatti phale pratiṣṭhitāḥ  kecid sakṛdāgāmi phale
translated: Those Yakṣas and Rākṣasas, having heard that auspicious Dharma discourse, some were established in the fruit of entering the stream.🔽Some in the fruit of the once-returner.

analyzed: kecid anāgami phale
translated: Some in the fruit of the non-returner.

analyzed: kecid arhat tve
translated: Some in arhatship.

analyzed: kecid prabhu tva bodhau pratiṣṭhitāḥ
translated: Some were established in the enlightenment of a powerful one.

original: ato yenāryāvalokiteśvaro bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ tenopasaṃkramya pādayoḥ praṇipatya evaṃ kathayanti ihaiva bhagavan viharasva /
analyzed: atas yena ārya avalokiteśvaraḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ tena upasaṃkramya pādayoḥ praṇipatya evam kathayanti iha eva bhagavan viharasva
translated: Then, wherever the Bodhisattva, the Great Being, the noble Avalokiteśvara was, they approached him, bowed at his feet, and said this: Stay here, Blessed One.

analyzed: mā anyatra sthāne kvacid gaccha
translated: Do not go to any other place.

analyzed: vayam te upasthāna paricaryām kariṣyāmaḥ
translated: We will serve and attend to you.

original: vayaṃ ca tavāntike asminneva tamondhakārabhūmau tavārthāya divyāni sauvarṇamayāni caṃkramaṇāni kariṣyāmaḥ /
analyzed: vayam ca tava antike asmin eva tamaḥ ndhakāra bhūmau tava arthāya divyāni sauvarṇa mayāni caṃkramaṇāni kariṣyāmaḥ
translated: For your sake, we will make divine golden walking paths right here in this dark and gloomy place.

analyzed: mā bhagavan anyatra pradeśam gacchasva
translated: Blessed One, do not go to any other place.

analyzed: vayam tava adarśanāt katham tiṣṭhāmaḥ
translated: How can we remain without seeing you?

original: atha āryāvalokiteśvaro bodhisattvo mahāsattvastāṃśca yakṣarākṣasānetadavocat anekāni ca mayā kulaputrāḥ sattvāni bodhimārge niyojayitavyāni

analyzed: tat vayam dharma sāṃkathya viprahīṇāḥ bhaviṣyāmaḥ

analyzed: kim asmābhiḥ kartavyam

translated: Then the bodhisattva mahāsattva noble Avalokiteśvara set out from that dark and gloomy land.

original: atha te tamondhakāraprativāsino yakṣarākṣasāstasya bhagavato 'valokiteśvarasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya pṛṣṭhataḥ pṛṣṭhataḥ samanubaddhā
analyzed: atha te tamaḥ undhakāra prativāsinaḥ yakṣa rākṣasāḥ tasya bhagavataḥ valokiteśvarasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya pṛṣṭhatas pṛṣṭhatas samanubaddhā
translated: Then those yakṣas and rākṣasas who lived in the darkness followed closely behind the blessed bodhisattva mahāsattva noble Avalokiteśvara.

analyzed: gacchanti sma

analyzed: atha avalokiteśvaraḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ tān etat avocat pratinivartayadhvam

analyzed: dūratam evam āha

original: iti yakṣādisamāśvāsanaṃ nāma dvādaśaṃ prakaraṇam //🔽START Kvyu / /🔽Vaidya

analyzed: deva bhavana bhramaṇam trayodaśam prakaraṇam

analyzed: atha āryāvalokiteśvaraḥ jvalat iva agni piṇḍam ākāśe ntarhitaḥ
translated: Then the noble Avalokiteśvara, blazing like a ball of fire, disappeared in the sky.

analyzed: tatas deva bhavanam gatvā śuddhāvāsa kāyika devaputrāṇām sakāśam upasaṃkrāntaḥ

analyzed: upasaṃkramya brāhmaṇa rūpam ātmānam abhinirmāya agamat

analyzed: tatra devanikāyeṣu sukuṇḍalaḥ nāma deva putraḥ daridraḥ duścittaḥ ca iti

analyzed: divyaiḥ vastraiḥ pravāritaḥ

analyzed: sa bhuktvā ca svastikāram anukurute

translated: Then the brahmin said to the god, That realm is inhabited by Tathagatas, delightful, adorned with divine jewel-studded moats,
