translated: families of worms.

original: tato 'valokiteśvaro bodhisattvo mahāsattva upasaṃkramya tatrāsa tāni prāṇiśatasahasrāṇi dṛṣṭvā ātmānaṃ bhramararūpamabhinirmāya ghuṇaghuṇāyamāṇam
analyzed: tatas valokiteśvaraḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ upasaṃkramya tatra āsa tāni prāṇi śata sahasrāṇi dṛṣṭvā ātmānam bhramara rūpam abhinirmāya ghuṇaghuṇāyamāṇam
translated: Then the bodhisattva mahāsattva Avalokiteśvara approached and saw those hundreds of thousands of living beings there. He manifested himself in the form of a bee, buzzing

analyzed: tat eṣām śabdam niścārayati namaḥ buddhāya
translated: and making that sound, Homage to the Buddha!

analyzed: namaḥ dharmāya
translated: Homage to the Dharma!

analyzed: namaḥ saṃghāya iti
translated: Homage to the Saṅgha!

original: tacchrutvā te ca sarve prāṇakāḥ namo buddhāya namo dharmāya namaḥ saṃghāyeti nāmamanusmārayanti /
analyzed: tat śrutvā te ca sarve prāṇakāḥ namaḥ buddhāya namaḥ dharmāya namaḥ saṃghāya iti nāmam anusmārayanti
translated: Hearing that, all those living beings remembered the name, Homage to the Buddha! Homage to the Dharma! Homage to the Saṅgha!

original: te ca sarve buddhanāmasmaraṇamātreṇa viṃśatiśikharasamudgataṃ satkāyadṛṣṭiśailaṃ🔽jñānavajreṇa bhittvā sarve te sukhāvatyāṃ lokadhātāvupapannāḥ sugandhamukhā nāma
analyzed: te ca sarve buddha nāma smaraṇa mātreṇa viṃśati śikhara samudgatam satkāyadṛṣṭi śailam  jñāna vajreṇa bhittvā sarve te sukhāvatyām lokadhātau upapannāḥ sugandhamukhāḥ nāma
translated: And by merely remembering the Buddha's name, the mountain of the view of the transitory collection, which was twenty thousand leagues high,

analyzed: bodhisattvāḥ babhūvuḥ
translated: was shattered by the vajra of wisdom. All of them were reborn in the world system of Sukhāvatī, and became bodhisattvas named Sugandhaमुख (Sweet-smelling Face).

original: sarve te bhagavato 'mitābhasya tathāgatasyāntikādidaṃ kāraṇḍavyūhaṃ nāma mahāyānaṃ śrutvā anumodya ca nānādigbhyo vyākaraṇāni pratilabdhāni
analyzed: sarve te bhagavataḥ mitābhasya tathāgatasya antikāt idam kāraṇḍavyūham nāma mahāyānam śrutvā anumodya ca nānā digbhyaḥ vyākaraṇāni pratilabdhāni
translated: All of them, having heard and rejoiced in this Mahayana sutra called Karandavyuha from the Tathagata Amitabha, received predictions from various directions.

analyzed: vaidya
translated: Vaidya

original: atha āryāvalokiteśvaro bodhisattvo mahāsattvo sattvaparipākaṃ kṛtvā tasyā vārāṇasyā mahānagaryāḥ prakrāntaḥ //
analyzed: atha ārya avalokiteśvaraḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ sattva paripākam kṛtvā tasyāḥ vārāṇasyāḥ mahā nagaryāḥ prakrāntaḥ
translated: Then the Bodhisattva Mahasattva Arya Avalokitesvara, having matured beings, departed from that great city of Varanasi.

original: iti vārāṇasībhramaṇaṃ nāma pañcadaśaṃ prakaraṇam //🔽START Kvyu / /
analyzed: iti vārāṇasībhramaṇam nāma pañcadaśam prakaraṇam  start kvyu
translated: Thus ends the fifteenth chapter on the wandering in Varanasi, in the Bodhisattva Avadana Sataka composed by the great teacher Arya Ashvaghosa.

original: magadhabhramaṇaṃ ṣoḍaśaṃ prakaraṇam /🔽tadā sa magadhābhimukhaṃ pratyudgacchati /
analyzed: magadha bhramaṇam ṣoḍaśam prakaraṇam  tadā sa magadha abhimukham pratyudgacchati
translated: Here begins the sixteenth chapter on the wandering in Magadha.🔽Then he proceeded towards Magadha.

analyzed: sa magadha viṣayam anuprāptaḥ
translated: Having reached the Magadha country,

original: yāvat sattvān paśyanti sma parasparaṃ māṃsabhakṣaṇaṃ kurvāṇān /
analyzed: yāvat sattvān paśyanti sma parasparam māṃsa bhakṣaṇam kurvāṇān
translated: he saw beings eating each other's flesh.

original: atha āryāvalokiteśvaro bodhisattvo mahāsattvastānevamāha kasmādbhoḥ /🔽yūyaṃ anyonyaṃ māsaṃ bhakṣayatha /
analyzed: atha ārya avalokiteśvaraḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ tān evam āha kasmāt bhoḥ  yūyam anyonyam māsam bhakṣayatha
translated: Then the Bodhisattva Mahasattva Arya Avalokitesvara said to them, Why, sirs,🔽do you eat each other's flesh?

analyzed: te ca āhuḥ na adya eva māsam bhakṣaṇam
translated: They said, Not only now do we eat each other's flesh.

original: viṃśativarṣāṇi paripūrṇāni kāntārasya ca pratipannasya ca /
analyzed: viṃśati varṣāṇi paripūrṇāni kāntārasya ca pratipannasya ca
translated: For twenty full years we have been in the wilderness and on the road.

analyzed: na atra kiṃcid anna pānam saṃvidyate
translated: There is no food or drink here at all.

analyzed: tasmāt vayam anyonyam virodham kurvāṇāḥ jīvitāḥ
translated: Therefore, we are alive, mutually harming each other.

analyzed: evam kṛtvā māṃsa bhakṣaṇam kurvāmaḥ
translated: Having done so, we eat each other's flesh.

original: atha avalokiteśvaro bodhisattvaścintāmāpede kenopāyenāhaṃ sattvān sarvān sukhopadhānaistasmātkāntārānmahādārūṇādakālamaraṇātparimocayeyaṃ
analyzed: atha avalokiteśvaraḥ bodhisattvaḥ cintām āpede kena upāyena aham sattvān sarvān sukha upadhānaiḥ tasmāt kāntārāt mahā dārūṇāt akāla maraṇāt parimocayeyam
translated: Then the Bodhisattva Avalokiteśvara thought, By what means can I deliver all beings from that terrible and fearful wilderness, from untimely death, and provide them with all happiness?

analyzed: atha avalokiteśvaraḥ vividhāni varṣāṇi pravarṣitum ārabdhaḥ
translated: Then Avalokiteśvara began to pour down various rains.

analyzed: prathamam udaka varṣam
translated: First, a rain of water.

analyzed: yadā udakena saṃtarpitāḥ prīṇita gātrāḥ ca bhavanti
translated: When they are satisfied and their bodies are refreshed by the water,

original: tadā paścāddivyāni piṣṭakāni rasarasāgropetāni tenāhāreṇa paripūrṇāni /
analyzed: tadā paścāt divyāni piṣṭakāni rasa rasa agra upetāni tena āhāreṇa paripūrṇāni
translated: then afterwards, divine cakes with the best of flavors and essences fall, filling them with that food.

original: yadāhāreṇa saṃtarpitā bhavanti tadā dhānyavarṣāṇi patanti /
analyzed: yad āhāreṇa saṃtarpitāḥ bhavanti tadā dhānya varṣāṇi patanti
translated: When they are satisfied with that food, then rains of grain fall.

analyzed: anyāni ca tila taṇḍula kola mudga māṣa kalāva masūra yava godhūma śāli dhānya kulattha ādīni patanti sma
translated: And other things, such as sesame, rice, beans, lentils, peas, horse gram, barley, wheat, sali rice, mustard seeds, and so on, fall.

original: vividhāni ca vastrābharaṇāni ca pravarṣanti sma /
analyzed: vividhāni ca vastra ābharaṇāni ca pravarṣanti sma
translated: And various garments and ornaments rain down.

original: yadā yadā teṣāṃ sarveṣāṃ sattvānāṃ ke 'pyabhiprāyā bhavanti /
analyzed: yadā yadā teṣām sarveṣām sattvānām ke pi abhiprāyāḥ bhavanti
translated: Whenever any of those beings have any wishes,

analyzed: tadā tadā teṣām sattvānām abhiprāyāḥ anusidhyante
translated: at that time the wishes of those beings are fulfilled.

original: atha te māgadhakāḥ sattvāstadidaṃ vicitraṃ svātmasukhaṃ dṛṣṭvā duḥkhaṃ ca vyupaśāntam /
analyzed: atha te māgadhakāḥ sattvāḥ tat idam vicitram sva ātma sukham dṛṣṭvā duḥkham ca vyupaśāntam
translated: Then those Magadha beings, seeing this wonderful personal happiness and the cessation of suffering,

analyzed: tadā parama vismayam āpannāḥ
translated: became extremely amazed.

analyzed: te ca sarve eka sthāne viśrāntāḥ
translated: And they all rested in one place.

analyzed: viśramitvā parasparam evam āhuḥ kasya devasya ayam prabhāvaḥ
translated: Having rested, they said to each other, Whose power is this?

original: tatasteṣāṃ puruṣāṇāṃ madhye jīrṇo vṛddho mahallakaḥ kubjo gopāṇasīvakro 'dhibhagno dāṇḍaparāyaṇaḥ anekavarṣaśatasahasrāyuṣikaḥ /
analyzed: tatas teṣām puruṣāṇām madhye jīrṇaḥ vṛddhaḥ mahallakaḥ kubjaḥ gopāṇasī vakraḥ dhi bhagnaḥ dāṇḍa parāyaṇaḥ aneka varṣa śata sahasra āyuṣikaḥ
translated: Then among those men, there was an old, aged, decrepit, hunchbacked, crooked, crippled, stick-dependent, many hundreds of thousands of years old man.

original: sa teṣāṃ madhye sthitvā kathayati na yuṣmākamanyadevasya kasyacidīdṛśaṃ prabhāvo bhavati virahitādavalokiteśvarasya /
analyzed: sa teṣām madhye sthitvā kathayati na yuṣmākam anya devasya kasyacid īdṛśam prabhāvaḥ bhavati virahitāt avalokiteśvarasya
translated: Standing in their midst, he said, This power does not belong to any other god than Avalokiteśvara.

original: tatastā parṣadaḥ pṛcchanti kīdṛśaṃ tasya nimittamavalokiteśvarasya /
analyzed: tatas tāḥ parṣadaḥ pṛcchanti kīdṛśam tasya nimittam avalokiteśvarasya
translated: Then the assembly asked, What are the signs of Avalokiteśvara?

original: atha sa puruṣa āryāvalokiteśvarasya guṇodbhāvanāṃ bhāṣitumārabdhaḥ
analyzed: atha sa puruṣaḥ ārya avalokiteśvarasya guṇa udbhāvanām bhāṣitum ārabdhaḥ
translated: Then that man began to speak the praise of noble Avalokiteśvara:

analyzed: śṛṇuta kula putrāḥ
translated: Listen, sons of noble family!

analyzed: avalokiteśvaraḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ ndha bhūtānām dīpa bhūtaḥ
translated: The bodhisattva mahāsattva Avalokiteśvara is a lamp for the blind,

analyzed: sūrya tāpa dagdhānām chatrībhūtaḥ
translated: a parasol for those scorched by the sun's heat,

analyzed: tṛṣā upadrutānām nadī bhūtaḥ  bhaya bhītānām abhayaṃdadaḥ
translated: a river for those afflicted by thirst,🔽a giver of fearlessness to the fearful,

analyzed: vyādhi paripīḍitānām vaidya bhūtaḥ
translated: a physician for those tormented by illness,

analyzed: duḥkhitānām sattvānām mātā pitṛ bhūtaḥ
translated: a mother and father for suffering beings,

analyzed: avīci upapannānām sattvānām nirvāṇa pradarśakaḥ
translated: and a demonstrator of nirvāṇa for beings born in the Avīci hell.

analyzed: īdṛśāni bhavantaḥ tasya guṇa viśeṣāṇi
translated: Such are the special qualities of him, sons.

original: sukhitāste sattvā loke ye tasya nāmamanusmaranti /
analyzed: sukhitāḥ te sattvāḥ loke ye tasya nāmam anusmaranti
translated: Blessed are those beings in the world who remember his name.

analyzed: te āpaścimam sāṃsārikam duḥkham parivarjayanti
translated: They will avoid the last suffering of saṃsāra.

original: sacetanāste puruṣapuṃgavā ye avalokiteśvarasya satataparigrahaṃ puṣpadhūpaṃ niryātayanti /
analyzed: sa cetanāḥ te puruṣa puṃgavāḥ ye avalokiteśvarasya satata parigraham puṣpa dhūpam niryātayanti
translated: Those who are conscious, those bulls among men who always offer flowers and incense to Avalokiteśvara,

analyzed: ye valokiteśvarasya puratas catur asram maṇḍalakam kurvanti
translated: those who make a square maṇḍala in front of Avalokiteśvara,

analyzed: te rājānaḥ bhavanti cakravartinaḥ sapta ratna samanvāgatāḥ
translated: they become universal monarchs possessing the seven jewels.

analyzed: tat yathā cakra ratnam
translated: Namely, the jewel of the wheel,

original: aśvaratnaṃ hastiratnaṃ maṇiratnaṃ strīratnaṃ gṛhapatiratnaṃ pariṇāyakaratnam /
analyzed: aśva ratnam hasti ratnam maṇi ratnam strī ratnam gṛhapati ratnam pariṇāyaka ratnam
translated: The jewel of the horse, the jewel of the elephant, the jewel of the gem, the jewel of the woman, the jewel of the householder, the jewel of the counselor.

analyzed: evam sapta ratnāni
translated: Thus, there are seven jewels.

analyzed: ebhiḥ sapta ratnaiḥ samanvāgatāḥ bhavanti
translated: They are endowed with these seven jewels.

original: ye cāvalokiteśvarasyaikamapi puṣpaṃ niryātayanti / te Vaidya
analyzed: ye ca avalokiteśvarasya ekam api puṣpam niryātayanti te vaidya
translated: And those who offer even a single flower to Avalokiteśvara, they🔽become physicians

analyzed: sugandhikāyāḥ bhavanti
translated: with fragrant bodies.

original: yatra yatropapadyante tatra tatra parīpūrṇakāyāśca bhavanti /
analyzed: yatra yatra upapadyante tatra tatra parīpūrṇa kāyāḥ ca bhavanti
translated: Wherever they are reborn, there they have perfect bodies.

analyzed: evam sa puruṣaḥ guṇa viśeṣam kṛtavāna
translated: Thus, that man created a special quality.

analyzed: tāḥ ca parṣadaḥ svaka svakeṣu bhavaneṣu pratyudgatāḥ
translated: And those assemblies returned to their own abodes.

original: anantavimalā nāma kāyapariśuddhiḥ tāṃ pratilabhante sma /
analyzed: anantavimalā nāma kāya pariśuddhiḥ tām pratilabhante sma
translated: They attained the endless and stainless purification of the body.

original: atha sa jīrṇapurūṣaḥ ānulomikīṃ dharmadeśanāṃ kṛtvā svakaṃ gṛhaṃ niveśanaṃ pratyudgataḥ /
analyzed: atha sa jīrṇa purūṣaḥ ānulomikīm dharma deśanām kṛtvā svakam gṛham niveśanam pratyudgataḥ
translated: Then, the old man, having given a Dharma talk in accordance with the Dharma, returned to his own house.

analyzed: atha avalokiteśvaraḥ tatra eva ākāśe ntarhitaḥ
translated: Then Avalokiteśvara disappeared right there in the sky.

original: atha sa ākāśe cintāmāpede viśvabhūstathāgato me cirakālaṃ dṛṣṭaḥ /
analyzed: atha saḥ ākāśe cintām āpede viśvabhūḥ tathāgataḥ me cira kālam dṛṣṭaḥ
translated: Then he thought in the sky, I have seen the Tathāgata Viśvabhū a long time ago.

analyzed: saḥ nupūrveṇa jetavanam vihāram anupraviṣṭaḥ
translated: He gradually entered the Jetavana monastery.

analyzed: yāvat paśyati anekāni deva nāga yakṣa gandharva asura garuḍa kinnara mahoraga manuṣya amanuṣya śata sahasrāṇi
translated: He saw many hundreds of thousands of gods, nāgas, yakṣas, gandharvas, asuras, garuḍas, kinnaras, mahoragas, humans, and non-humans,

analyzed: anekāni ca bodhisattva śata sahasrāṇi saṃnipatitāni
translated: and many hundreds of thousands of bodhisattvas assembled.

original: atha gaganagañjo bodhisattvo bhagavantametadavocat katamo 'yaṃ bhagavan bodhisattva āgacchati /
analyzed: atha gaganagañjaḥ bodhisattvaḥ bhagavantam etat avocat katamaḥ yam bhagavan bodhisattvaḥ āgacchati
translated: Then the bodhisattva Gaganagañja said to the Blessed One, Blessed One, which bodhisattva is coming?

original: bhagavānāha eṣa kulaputra avalokiteśvaro bodhisattvo mahāsattva āgacchati /
analyzed: bhagavān āha eṣa kula putra avalokiteśvaraḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ āgacchati
translated: The Blessed One said, Noble son, this is the bodhisattva mahāsattva Avalokiteśvara coming.

analyzed: atha gaganagañjaḥ bodhisattvaḥ tūṣṇīṃbhāvena vyavasthitaḥ
translated: Then the bodhisattva Gaganagañja remained silent.

original: athāvalokiteśvaro bodhisattvastaṃ bhagavantaṃ triḥ pradakṣiṇīkṛtya vāmapārśve viśrāntaḥ //
analyzed: atha avalokiteśvaraḥ bodhisattvaḥ tam bhagavantam tris pradakṣiṇīkṛtya vāma pārśve viśrāntaḥ
translated: Then the bodhisattva Avalokiteśvara circumambulated the Blessed One three times and rested on his left side.

original: atha sa punaḥ śrāntaṃ viditvā bhagavān pṛcchati śrāntastvaṃ kulaputra /
analyzed: atha sa punar śrāntam viditvā bhagavān pṛcchati śrāntaḥ tvam kula putra
translated: Then, knowing that he was tired, the Blessed One asked, Noble son, are you tired?

analyzed: kīdṛśī karma bhūmiḥ tvayā niṣpāditāḥ
translated: What kind of field of action have you accomplished?

original: tana tasya bhūtapūrvaṃ varṇitam sadā preteṣvavīcyupapanneṣu kālasūtrarauravopapanneṣu hāhe tapane mahānarake /
analyzed: tana tasya bhūta pūrvam varṇitam sadā preteṣu avīci upapanneṣu kālasūtra raurava upapanneṣu hāhe tapane mahā narake
translated: Then he described to him his previous deeds among the pretas born in Avīci, Kālasūtra, Raurava, and the great hell of Tāpana.

analyzed: sitodake mahānarake  asi chede mahā narake
translated: In the great hell of white water.🔽In the great hell of sword-cutting.

analyzed: saṃvare mahā narake
translated: In the great hell of restraint.

original: eṣu mahānarakeṣu ye sattvā upapannāsteṣāṃ ca karmabhūmiḥ sattvānāmaparipākakṛtā kartavyā /
analyzed: eṣu mahānarakeṣu ye sattvāḥ upapannāḥ teṣām ca karma bhūmiḥ sattvānām a paripāka kṛtā kartavyā
translated: In these great hells, the beings who have been reborn there, their karmic ground should be made ripe for the beings.

analyzed: kṛtvā ca anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau pratiṣṭhāpayitavyāḥ
translated: And having done so, they should be established in unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

analyzed: īdṛśaḥ mayā sattva paripākaḥ kṛtaḥ
translated: Such is the ripening of beings that I have done.

original: atha gaganagañjo bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ paramavismayamāpannaḥ na ca me bodhisattvabhūtasya īdṛśaṃ viṣayaṃ dṛṣṭaṃ śruta vā /
analyzed: atha gaganagañjaḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ parama vismayam āpannaḥ na ca me bodhisattva bhūtasya īdṛśam viṣayam dṛṣṭam vā
translated: Then the bodhisattva mahāsattva Gaganagañja, filled with supreme amazement, said, I have never seen or heard such an object of perception as a bodhisattva.

analyzed: tathāgatānām īdṛśam viṣayam na saṃvidyate
translated: Such an object of perception does not exist even for the Tathāgatas.

original: athe gaganagañjo bodhisattvo 'valokiteśvarasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya purataḥ sthitvā avalokiteśvaramevamāha mā tvaṃ śrāntaḥ /
analyzed: athe gaganagañjaḥ bodhisattvaḥ valokiteśvarasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya puratas sthitvā avalokiteśvaram evam āha mā tvam śrāntaḥ
translated: Then the bodhisattva Gaganagañja, standing in front of the bodhisattva mahāsattva Avalokiteśvara, said to Avalokiteśvara, Do not be tired.

analyzed: kliṣṭaḥ tvam
translated: You are afflicted.

original: sa āha na cāhaṃ yuṣmākaṃ madhye śrānto na kliṣṭaḥ /
analyzed: saḥ āha na ca aham yuṣmākam madhye śrāntaḥ na kliṣṭaḥ
translated: He said, I am not tired or afflicted among you.

original: tau parasparaṃ sāṃkathyaṃ kṛtvā tūṣṇīṃbhāvena vyavasthitau //
analyzed: tau parasparam sāṃkathyam kṛtvā tūṣṇīṃbhāvena vyavasthitau
translated: They conversed with each other and then remained silent.

original: atha bhagavān ṣaṭpāramitānirdeśaṃ dharmaṃ deśayitumārabdhaḥ śṛṇvantu kulaputrāḥ /
analyzed: atha bhagavān ṣaṣ pāramitā nirdeśam dharmam deśayitum ārabdhaḥ śṛṇvantu kula putrāḥ
translated: Then the Blessed One began to teach the Dharma of the six perfections, saying, Listen, sons of good family!

analyzed: prathamam bodhisattva bhūtena dāna pāramitā paripūrayitavyā
translated: First, when one is a bodhisattva, the perfection of generosity should be fulfilled.

analyzed: evam śīla pāramitā kṣānti pāramitā dhaivī
translated: Thus, the perfection of morality, the perfection of patience, the perfection of diligence,

analyzed: rya pāramitā dhyāna pāramitā prajñāpāramitā paripūrayitavyā
translated: the perfection of concentration, and the perfection of wisdom should be fulfilled.

original: imāṃ cānulomikāṃ dharmadeśanāṃ kṛtvā tūṣṇīṃbhāvena vyavasthitaḥ /
analyzed: imām ca ānulomikām dharma deśanām kṛtvā tūṣṇīṃbhāvena vyavasthitaḥ
translated: Having given this appropriate Dharma teaching, he remained silent.

analyzed: atha tāḥ parṣadaḥ svaka svaka sthāneṣu prakrāntāḥ
translated: Then the assembly went to their own places.

original: te ca bodhisattvāḥ svakasvakeṣu buddhakṣetreṣu prakrāntāḥ //
analyzed: te ca bodhisattvāḥ svaka svakeṣu buddhakṣetreṣu prakrāntāḥ
translated: And those bodhisattvas went to their own buddha-fields.

original: atha sarvanīvaraṇaviṣkambhī bhagavantametadavocat yadā bhagavan samantabhadreṇa bodhisattvena mahāsattvena na dṛṣṭaṃ dvādaśavarṣāṇi paribhramatā /
analyzed: atha sarva nīvaraṇa viṣkambhī bhagavantam etat avocat yadā bhagavan samantabhadreṇa bodhisattvena mahāsattvena na dṛṣṭam dvādaśa varṣāṇi paribhramatā
translated: Then Sarvanīvaraṇaviṣkambhin said to the Blessed One, Blessed One, when the bodhisattva mahāsattva Samantabhadra did not see them, wandering for twelve years,

original: na ca tena tāni romavivarāṇi dṛṣṭāni /
analyzed: na ca tena tāni roma vivarāṇi dṛṣṭāni
translated: and he did not see those pores,

original: asyaikaikaromavivare sthitaṃ buddhaśataṃ tenāpi na dṛṣṭam /
analyzed: asya ekaika roma vivare sthitam buddha śatam tena api na dṛṣṭam
translated: and a hundred buddhas present in each pore were not seen by him,

analyzed: tadā teṣām roma vivarāṇām antatas ham api kim gamiṣyāmi
translated: then how could I possibly go to the ends of those pores?

analyzed: āha kula putra
translated: He said, Noble son,

original: mayāpi tasya romavivaraṃ vīkṣamāṇena parimārgayamāṇena na dṛśyate /
analyzed: mayā api tasya roma vivaram vīkṣamāṇena parimārgayamāṇena na dṛśyate
translated: even when I was looking at his pores and searching for them, I did not see them.

analyzed: sarva nīvaraṇa viṣkambhin kula putra
translated: Sarvanivarana Viskambhin, son of noble family,

analyzed: ayam māyāvī asādhyaḥ sūkṣmaḥ evam anudṛśyate
translated: This one is a magician, invincible, subtle, and thus invisible.

analyzed: nirañjanaḥ rūpī mahāpī
translated: He is free from passion, has form, is great,

original: śatasahasrabhujaḥ koṭiśatasahasranetro viśvarūpī ekādaśaśīrṣaḥ mahāyogī nirvāṇabhūmivyavasthitaḥ
analyzed: śata sahasra bhujaḥ koṭi śata sahasra netraḥ viśva rūpī ekādaśa śīrṣaḥ mahāyogī nirvāṇa bhūmi vyavasthitaḥ
translated: has a hundred thousand arms, a hundred thousand koṭis of eyes, has a universal form, eleven heads, is a great yogi, and abides in the stage of nirvana.

original: sucetano mahāprājñaḥ bhavottārakaḥ kulīno 'nādarśī prājño nirdeśastathācchāyābhūtaḥ sarvadharmeṣu /
analyzed: su cetanaḥ mahā prājñaḥ bhava uttārakaḥ kulīnaḥ na ādarśī prājñaḥ nirdeśaḥ tathā a chāyā bhūtaḥ sarva dharmeṣu
translated: He has good thoughts, is greatly wise, delivers from existence, is of noble family, is fearless, wise, and is like a shadow in all dharmas.

original: evameva kulaputra avalokiteśvaro bodhisattvo na śruto na kenacid dṛśyate /
analyzed: evam eva kula putra avalokiteśvaraḥ bodhisattvaḥ na śrutaḥ na kenacid dṛśyate
translated: In the same way, son of noble family, the Bodhisattva Avalokitesvara is not heard by anyone, nor is he seen by anyone.

analyzed: tasya svabhāvakāḥ anyathā ārta gatāḥ na paśyanti
translated: Those who have a different nature or state do not see him.

analyzed: prāk eva samantabhadra ādayaḥ nye ca bodhisattvāḥ
translated: How much less so the other Bodhisattvas such as Samantabhadra.

original: acintyo 'yaṃ kulaputra avalokiteśvaro bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ prātihāryāṇi samupadarśayati /
analyzed: acintyaḥ yam kula putra avalokiteśvaraḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ prātihāryāṇi samupadarśayati
translated: Son of noble family, this Bodhisattva Mahasattva Avalokitesvara is inconceivable, displaying miracles,

analyzed: anekāni ca bodhisattva koṭi niyuta śata sahasrāṇi paripācayati
translated: and maturing many hundreds of thousands of niyutas of koṭis of Bodhisattvas.

analyzed: sattvān ca tān bodhi mārge pratiṣṭhāpayati
translated: He establishes those beings in the path to enlightenment.

analyzed: pratiṣṭhāpayitvā sukhāvatī lokadhātum anugacchati
translated: and having established them, he goes to the world system Sukhāvatī.

analyzed: amitābhasya tathāgatasya antike dharmam anuśṛṇoti
translated: He listens to the Dharma in the presence of the Tathāgata Amitābha.

original: atha sarvanīvaraṇaviṣkambhī bhagavantametadavocat kenopāyena bhagavan paśyāmi ahamavalokiteśvaraṃ bodhisattvaṃ mahāsattvam /
analyzed: atha sarva nīvaraṇa viṣkambhī bhagavantam etat avocat kena upāyena bhagavan paśyāmi aham avalokiteśvaram bodhisattvam mahāsattvam
translated: Then Sarvanīvaraṇaviṣkambhin said to the Blessed One, By what means, Blessed One, can I see the Bodhisattva Mahāsattva Avalokiteśvara?

original: bhagavānāha yadi kulaputra ihaiva sahālokadhātumāgacchati mama darśanāya vandanāya paryupāsanāya /
analyzed: bhagavān āha yadi kula putraḥ iha eva sahā lokadhātum āgacchati mama darśanāya vandanāya paryupāsanāya
translated: The Blessed One said, If he comes here to the Sahā world system to see me, to pay homage to me, and to honor me.

analyzed: atha sarva nīvaraṇa viṣkambhī bhagavantam etat avocat anujānāmi aham bhagavan
translated: Then Sarvanīvaraṇaviṣkambhin said to the Blessed One, I give permission, Blessed One.

analyzed: avalokiteśvaraḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ āgacchati
translated: The Bodhisattva Mahāsattva Avalokiteśvara is coming.

analyzed: bhagavān āha yadā kula putra sattva paripākaḥ bhavati
translated: The Blessed One said, When, son of noble family, it is time to ripen beings,

analyzed: tadā avalokiteśvaraḥ prathamataram āgacchati
translated: then Avalokiteśvara comes first.

original: atha sarvanīvaraṇaviṣkambhī bodhisattvaḥ kare kapolaṃ dattvā cintāparo vyavasthitaḥ
analyzed: atha sarva nīvaraṇa viṣkambhī bodhisattvaḥ kare kapolam dattvā cintā paraḥ vyavasthitaḥ
translated: Then the Bodhisattva Sarvanīvaraṇaviṣkambhin put his hand on his cheek and remained absorbed in thought.

analyzed: kim mayā pāpa ratena cira kāla jīvikayā tena avalokita īśvara darśana viprahīṇena andha bhūtena
translated: What is the use of my living for a long time, engaged in sinful activities, deprived of seeing Avalokiteshvara, like one who is blind,

analyzed: tamaḥ nuprāpta mārga saṃprasthitena
translated: setting out on a path leading to darkness?

original: atha sarvanīvaraṇaviṣkambhī bodhisattvaḥ punarapi bhagavantametadavocat katamasmin kāle bhagavannavalokiteśvara āgacchati /
analyzed: atha sarva nīvaraṇa viṣkambhī bodhisattvaḥ punar api bhagavantam etat avocat katamasmin kāle bhagavan avalokiteśvaraḥ āgacchati
translated: Then the Bodhisattva Sarvanivaranaviskambhin again said to the Blessed One, At what time, Blessed One, does Avalokiteshvara come?

analyzed: atha bhagavān api idam vacanam śrutvā hasati
translated: Then the Blessed One, having heard these words, laughed,

analyzed: vyavahasati ca akālaḥ te kula putra avalokiteśvarasya āgamana kāla samayaḥ
translated: and said, It is not the right time for you, noble son, for the arrival of Avalokiteshvara.

original: tadyathāpi nāma kulaputra tato romavivarādavatīrya amṛtabindurnāma romavivaraḥ /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma kula putra tatas roma vivarāt avatīrya amṛtabinduḥ nāma roma vivaraḥ
translated: Just as, noble son, having descended from that pore, there is a pore named Amritabindu,

analyzed: tatra anekāni devaputra koṭi niyuta śata sahasrāṇi vaidya
translated: where many hundreds of thousands of millions of billions of devas

analyzed: prativasanti
translated: dwell as physicians,

analyzed: kecid eka bhūmikā
translated: some on one level,

analyzed: kecid dvi bhūmikāḥ  kecid tri bhūmikāḥ
translated: some on two levels,🔽some on three levels,

analyzed: kecid catur bhūmikāḥ
translated: some on four levels,

analyzed: kecid pañca bhūmikāḥ
translated: some on five levels,

analyzed: kecid ṣaṣ bhūmikāḥ  kecid sapta bhūmikāḥ
translated: some on six levels,🔽some on seven levels,

analyzed: kecid aṣṭa bhūmikāḥ
translated: some on eight levels,

analyzed: kecid nava bhūmikāḥ
translated: some on nine levels,

analyzed: kecid daśa bhūmikāḥ pratiṣṭhitāḥ bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ vasanti
translated: Some of the bodhisattva mahāsattvas who are established in the ten grounds reside there.

original: tadyathāpi nāma sarvanīvaraṇaviṣkambhin asminnamṛtabindau romavivare ṣaṣṭiparvatāḥ suvarṇarūpyamayāḥ /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma sarva nīvaraṇa viṣkambhin asmin amṛtabindau roma vivare ṣaṣṭi parvatāḥ suvarṇa rūpya mayāḥ
translated: Sarvanīvaraṇaviṣkambhin, in this Amṛtabindu hair follicle there are sixty mountains made of gold and silver.

analyzed: ekaika parvataḥ ṣaṣṭi yojanā sahasrāṇi ucchrayeṇa
translated: Each mountain is sixty thousand yojanas high.

analyzed: tat eṣām parvatānām nava navati śṛṅga sahasrāṇi divya suvarṇa ratna upacitāni
translated: These mountains have nine hundred thousand peaks adorned with divine gold and jewels.

analyzed: pārśve kecid eka citta utpādikāḥ bodhisattvāḥ prativasanti
translated: Some bodhisattvas who have generated a single thought of enlightenment reside on the sides of those mountains.

analyzed: teṣu parvata rājiṣu anekāni gandharva koṭi niyuta śata sahasrāṇi prativasanti
translated: On those mountain ranges, many hundreds of thousands of millions of koṭis of gandharvas reside.

original: ye tasmin romavivare satatasamitaṃ nirnāditaṃ sūryaṃ dhārayati /
analyzed: ye tasmin roma vivare satata samitam nirnāditam sūryam dhārayati
translated: They constantly and always emit a sound in that hair follicle, holding the sun.

original: tadyathāpi nāma sarvanīvaraṇaviṣkambhin tasmiṃścāmṛtabindau romavivare anekāni vimānakoṭiniyutaśatasahasrāṇi
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma sarva nīvaraṇa viṣkambhin tasmin ca amṛtabindau roma vivare anekāni vimāna koṭi niyuta śata sahasrāṇi
translated: Sarvanīvaraṇaviṣkambhin, in that Amṛtabindu hair follicle there are many hundreds of thousands of millions of koṭis of celestial palaces

original: ratnaparikhacitāni śobhanīyāni darśanīyāni vicitrāṇi muktāhāraśatasahasrāṇi pralambitāni /
analyzed: ratna parikhacitāni śobhanīyāni darśanīyāni vicitrāṇi muktā hāra śata sahasrāṇi pralambitāni
translated: adorned with jeweled moats, beautiful, delightful, and various, with many hundreds of thousands of pearl necklaces hanging down.

original: teṣu vimāneṣu bodhisattvā viśramitvā dharmasāṃkathyaṃ kurvanti /
analyzed: teṣu vimāneṣu bodhisattvāḥ viśramitvā dharma sāṃkathyam kurvanti
translated: In those palaces, the bodhisattvas rest and have discussions about the Dharma.

analyzed: tatas vimānāt niṣkramya svaka svakāni caṃkramaṇāni pratyudgatāḥ
translated: Then, emerging from the palaces, they go to their own respective courtyards.

original: caṃkrame caṃkrame saptati saptati puṣkariṇyaḥ kecidaṣṭāṅgopetena vāriṇā paripūrṇāḥ /
analyzed: caṃkrame caṃkrame saptati saptati puṣkariṇyaḥ kecid aṣṭa aṅga upetena vāriṇā paripūrṇāḥ
translated: In each courtyard there are seventy ponds filled with water endowed with the eight qualities,

analyzed: kecid vividha puṣpa paripūrṇāḥ
translated: some filled with various flowers.

analyzed: utpala padma kumuda puṇḍarīka saugandhika māndārava mahāmāndārava puṣpa paripūrṇāḥ
translated: Filled with blue lotuses, red lotuses, white lotuses, jasmine flowers, coral trees, and great coral trees.

original: teṣu caṃkrameṣu manoramāḥ kalpavṛkṣāḥ lohitavarṇāḥ suvarṇarūpyapatrā divyālaṃkārapralambitā maulīkuṇḍalasragdāmapralambitā hārārdhahārapralambitāḥ
analyzed: teṣu caṃkrameṣu manoramāḥ kalpavṛkṣāḥ lohita varṇāḥ suvarṇa rūpya patrāḥ divya alaṃkāra pralambitāḥ maulī kuṇḍala sraj dāma pralambitāḥ hāra ardhahāra pralambitāḥ
translated: In those courtyards there are delightful wish-fulfilling trees, red in color, with leaves of gold and silver, hanging with divine ornaments, hanging with head ornaments, earrings, and garlands, hanging with necklaces and half-necklaces,

analyzed: keyūra pralambitāḥ
translated: hanging with bracelets,

analyzed: tad anye vividha alaṃkāra pralambitāḥ
translated: and hanging with various other ornaments.

analyzed: teṣu caṃkrameṣu rātrau te bodhisattvāḥ caṃkramanti
translated: In those courtyards, at night, those bodhisattvas walk.

analyzed: vividham ca mahāyānam anusmaranti
translated: And they recollect the various great vehicles.

analyzed: nairvāṇikīm bhūmim anuvicintayanti
translated: They contemplate the stage of nirvana.

analyzed: sāṃsārikam duḥkham anuvicintayanti
translated: They contemplate the suffering of samsara.

analyzed: naraka niryāsam cintayanti
translated: They think of escaping from hell.

analyzed: saṃcintayitvā maitrīm bhāvayanti
translated: Having contemplated, they cultivate loving-kindness.

original: evameva sarvanīvaraṇaviṣkambhin tasmin romavivare īdṛśā bodhisattvā vasanti /
analyzed: evam eva sarva nīvaraṇa viṣkambhin tasmin roma vivare īdṛśāḥ bodhisattvāḥ vasanti
translated: In the same way, Sarvanīvaraṇaviṣkambhin, such bodhisattvas dwell in that pore.

analyzed: tatas mṛtavittabindu roma vivarāt avatīrya vajramukhaḥ nāma roma vivaraḥ
translated: Then, descending from the pore named Amṛtavittibindu, there is a pore named Vajramukha.

analyzed: tatra anekāni kinnara śata sahasrāṇi prativasanti
translated: There, many hundreds of thousands of kinnaras dwell.

analyzed: aṅgada kuṇḍala keyūra vicitra mālya ābharaṇa anulepana parama śobhanāni dṛśyante
translated: They are seen to be supremely beautiful, with various garlands, ornaments, and unguents, such as bracelets, earrings, and armlets.

original: satatakālaṃ buddhadharmasaṃghābhiprasannāḥ ekāgradharmamaitrīvihārikāḥ kṣāntisaṃbhāvitā nirvāṇacintakāḥ saṃvegamānuṣyakāḥ /
analyzed: satata kālam buddha dharma saṃgha abhiprasannāḥ ekāgra dharma maitrī vihārikāḥ kṣānti saṃbhāvitāḥ nirvāṇa cintakāḥ saṃvega mānuṣyakāḥ
translated: They are always devoted to the Buddha, Dharma, and Saṅgha, dwell in the Dharma of one-pointedness and loving-kindness, are cultivated in patience, contemplate nirvāṇa, and are disgusted with the human condition.

analyzed: īdṛśāḥ te kula putra kinnarāḥ dharma abhiratāḥ
translated: Such are those kinnaras, son of noble family, who delight in the Dharma.

analyzed: tasmin eva roma vivare anekāni parvata vivarāṇi śata sahasrāṇi
translated: In that very pore, there are many hundreds of thousands of mountain caves.

analyzed: kecid vajra mayāḥ kecid padmarāga mayāḥ kecid indranīla mayāḥ kecid sapta ratna mayāḥ
translated: Some are made of diamond, some of ruby, some of sapphire, and some of the seven precious substances.

original: īdṛśāni ca tatra kulaputra romavivare saddharmanimittāni ca dṛśyante /
analyzed: īdṛśāni ca tatra kula putra roma vivare saddharma nimittāni ca dṛśyante
translated: Such are the signs of the true Dharma, son of noble family, that are seen in that pore.

analyzed: tatra roma vivare anekāḥ kalpavṛkṣāḥ
translated: There, in that pore, there are many wish-fulfilling trees,

analyzed: aneka vidruma vṛkṣāḥ candrana vṛkṣāḥ saugandhika vṛkṣāḥ
translated: many coral trees, moon trees, and fragrant trees.

analyzed: anekāni puṣkariṇī śata sahasrāṇi
translated: There are many hundreds of thousands of lotus ponds.

analyzed: divyāni vimānāni
translated: There are divine palaces,

original: sphaṭikarajatasaṃyuktāḥ paramaśobhanīyāḥ ramaṇīyāḥ prāsādāḥ /🔽yatra īdṛśāni vimānāni prādurbhavanti /
analyzed: sphaṭika rajata saṃyuktāḥ parama śobhanīyāḥ ramaṇīyāḥ prāsādāḥ  yatra īdṛśāni vimānāni prādurbhavanti
translated: made of crystal and silver, extremely beautiful and delightful, with mansions.🔽In those palaces, such divine abodes appear.

analyzed: teṣu vimāneṣu kinnarāḥ viśrāntāḥ
translated: In those palaces, the kinnaras rest.

analyzed: viśramitvā dharma sāṃkathyam kurvanti
translated: Having rested, they engage in Dharma discussions.

analyzed: yat uta dāna pāramitā sāṃkathyam kurvanti
translated: Namely, they engage in discussions on the perfection of generosity.

analyzed: dhyāna pāramitā sāṃkathyam kurvanti
translated: They engage in discussions on the perfection of concentration.

analyzed: prajñāpāramitā sāṃkathyam kurvanti
translated: They engage in discussions on the perfection of wisdom.

original: evaṃ ṣaṭpāramitāsāṃkathyaṃ kṛtvā svakasvakāni caṃkramaṇāni caṃkramanti /
analyzed: evam ṣaṣ pāramitā sāṃkathyam kṛtvā svaka svakāni caṃkramaṇāni caṃkramanti
translated: Having thus engaged in discussions on the six perfections, they each go to their own walking paths and walk.

analyzed: kecid suvarṇa mayāḥ caṃkramāḥ
translated: Some of those walking paths are made of gold.

original: teṣu caṃkrameṣu sāmantakeṣu kalpavṛkṣā lohitadaṇḍāḥ sauvarṇarūpyapatrā divyālaṃkārapralambitāḥ maulikuṇḍalasragdāmapralambitā hārārdhahārapralambitā
analyzed: teṣu caṃkrameṣu sāmantakeṣu kalpavṛkṣāḥ lohita daṇḍāḥ sauvarṇa rūpya patrāḥ divya alaṃkāra pralambitāḥ mauli kuṇḍala sraj dāma pralambitā hāra ardhahāra pralambitā
translated: On those walking paths, in the surrounding areas, there are wish-fulfilling trees with red trunks, golden and silver leaves, adorned with divine ornaments, with head ornaments, earrings, and garlands hanging from them, with necklaces and half-necklaces hanging from them,

analyzed: ratna hāra pralambitāḥ
translated: with jeweled necklaces hanging from them.

analyzed: te ca kalpavṛkṣāḥ tasmin caṃkrame kūṭāgāra vat saṃsthitāḥ  kūṭāgāra sadṛśeṣu vaidya
translated: And those wish-fulfilling trees stand in that walkway like a peaked hall.

analyzed: teṣu caṃkrameṣu kinnarāḥ caṃkramanti
translated: In those peaked halls, the Kinnaras walk.

analyzed: caṃkramyamāṇāḥ sāṃsārikam satyam anuvicintayanti aho duḥkham
translated: While walking, they reflect on the truth of worldly suffering: Alas, suffering!

analyzed: jātiḥ duḥkham
translated: Birth is suffering.

analyzed: aho duḥkham
translated: Alas, suffering!

analyzed: jarā maraṇa duḥkham
translated: The suffering of old age and death.

analyzed: aho duḥkham
translated: Alas, suffering!

analyzed: tat api dāridrya duḥkham
translated: That poverty is also suffering.

analyzed: iṣṭa priya viyoga apriya aviyoga duḥkham
translated: The suffering of separation from what is loved and union with what is not loved.

analyzed: tat api kaṣṭataram duḥkham
translated: That is even more terrible suffering.

analyzed: ye ca avīcau upapannāḥ raurava upapannāḥ
translated: And those who have been reborn in Avīci, those reborn in Raurava,

analyzed: kālasūtra upapannāḥ
translated: those reborn in Kālasūtra,

analyzed: hāhave mahā narake upapannāḥ
translated: those reborn in the great hell of Hāhava,

analyzed: pratāpane narake upapannāḥ  agni ghaṭeṣu upapannāḥ  vajraśaileṣu upapannāḥ
translated: those reborn in the hell of Pratāpana,🔽those reborn in the fire-pots,🔽those reborn on the diamond mountains,

analyzed: preta nagara upapannāḥ
translated: those reborn in the city of the hungry ghosts,

analyzed: tat eṣām sarva sattvānām duḥkhataram
translated: that is more painful for all those beings.

analyzed: evam ca te kinnarāḥ cittena cintayanti
translated: And those Kinnaras think like this with their minds.

analyzed: cintayitvā nairvāṇikīm bhūmīm cintayanti
translated: Having thought, they think of the stage of nirvāṇa.

original: evameva kulaputra kinnarā dharmābhiratāḥ satatakālamavalokiteśvarasya nāmanusmaranti /
analyzed: evam eva kula putra kinnarāḥ dharma abhiratāḥ satata kālam avalokiteśvarasya nām anusmaranti
translated: In the same way, noble son, the kinnaras, who delight in the Dharma, constantly remember Avalokiteśvara's name.

analyzed: yadā te nāma anusmaranti
translated: When they remember his name,

analyzed: tadā teṣām sarva upakaraṇaiḥ upasthitāḥ bhavanti
translated: then they are provided with all the requisites.

original: evaṃ durlabhaḥ kulaputra avalokiteśvaro bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ sarvasattvānāṃ mātāpitṛbhūtaḥ sarvasattveṣvabhayaṃdadaḥ /
analyzed: evam durlabhaḥ kula putra avalokiteśvaraḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ sarva sattvānām mātā pitṛ bhūtaḥ sarva sattveṣu abhayaṃdadaḥ
translated: In this way, noble son, Avalokiteśvara, the bodhisattva mahāsattva, is difficult to find. He is like a mother and father to all beings. He gives fearlessness to all beings.

analyzed: sarva sattveṣu mārga upadarśakaḥ
translated: He shows the path to all beings.

analyzed: sarva sattveṣu kalyāṇa mitraḥ

translated: Then Sarvanīvaraṇaviṣkambhin said this to the Blessed One: As instructed by the Blessed One.

original: atha sarvanīvaraṇaviṣkambhī bodhisattvo mahāsattva anekairbodhisattvaparṣadgṛhasthaiḥ pravrajitairdārakadārikādibhiḥ saṃprasthitaḥ /
analyzed: atha sarva nīvaraṇa viṣkambhī bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattva anekaiḥ bodhisattva parṣad gṛhasthaiḥ pravrajitaiḥ dāraka dārikā ādibhiḥ saṃprasthitaḥ
translated: Then the bodhisattva mahāsattva Sarvanīvaraṇaviṣkambhin set out with many assemblies of bodhisattvas, both householders and renunciants, boys and girls, and so forth.

original: tasya dharmabhāṇakasya pūjākarmaṇe divyāni chatrāṇi divyāni upānahāni maulīkuṇḍalasragdāmakeyūrahārārdhahāraratnahāraskandhopariṣvajānikapṛṣṭhottaryāṇi
analyzed: tasya dharmabhāṇakasya pūjā karmaṇe divyāni chatrāṇi divyāni upānahāni maulī kuṇḍala sraj dāma keyūra hāra ardha hāra ratna hāra skandha upariṣvaja ānika pṛṣṭha uttaryāṇi
translated: For the sake of worshipping that Dharma teacher, they offered divine parasols, divine shoes, head ornaments, earrings, garlands, wreaths, bracelets, necklaces, half-necklaces, jeweled necklaces, shoulder ornaments, armlets, and upper garments,

original: aṅguṣṭhavibhedikāni anyāni ca vividhāni vastrāṇi cīvarādhyuṣitāni vidyādharasaṃcoditāni🔽kāśikavastrāṇyagniśaucavastrāṇi ca anyāni ca vividhāni vastrāṇi puṣpāṇi /
analyzed: aṅguṣṭha vibhedikāni anyāni ca vividhāni vastrāṇi cīvara adhyuṣitāni vidyādhara saṃcoditāni  kāśika vastrāṇi agni śauca vastrāṇi ca anyāni ca vividhāni vastrāṇi puṣpāṇi
translated: and various other garments suitable for monks, inspired by the knowledge-holders.

analyzed: tat yathā utpala padma kumuda puṇḍarīka māndārava mahāmāndāravāṇi mañjūṣaka mahāmañjūṣakāṇi
translated: They also offered various other garments and flowers, such as blue, red, and white lotuses, coral jasmine, great coral jasmine, jasmine, great jasmine,

original: caudumbarāṇi anyāni vividhāni kāṣṭhapuṣpāṇi campakakaravīrapāṭalāni muktakavārṣikāṇi🔽śakunakādhyuṣitāni /🔽sumanānavamālikacakravākopaśobhitāni /
analyzed: ca audumbarāṇi anyāni vividhāni kāṣṭha puṣpāṇi campaka karavīra pāṭalāni muktaka vārṣikāṇi  śakunaka adhyuṣitāni  sumanā navamālika cakravāka upaśobhitāni
translated: golden showers, and various other wooden flowers like champak, oleander, trumpet flower, jasmine, and night-flowering jasmine.🔽They also offered flowers that are the abode of birds,🔽such as the blue, red, and white water lilies, and flowers adorned with chakora birds, jasmine, and chakravakas.

analyzed: śāli kautsukyāni śatapatrikāṇi nīla pīta lohita avadāta māñjiṣṭha sphaṭika rajata varṇāni
translated: They offered flowers that are the abode of shali birds, and flowers with a hundred petals, in blue, yellow, red, white, orange, crystal, and silver colors.

original: anyāni ca sthalajalajāni puṣpāṇi vividhāni gṛhītvā yena vārāṇasī mahānagarī tenopajagāma /
analyzed: anyāni ca sthala jala jāni puṣpāṇi vividhāni gṛhītvā yena vārāṇasī mahā nagarī tena upajagāma
translated: He also gathered various other flowers, both terrestrial and aquatic, and went to the great city of Vārāṇasī.

analyzed: anupūrveṇa vārāṇasīm mahā nagarīm anuprāptaḥ  yena sa dharmabhāṇakaḥ tena upasaṃkrāntaḥ
translated: In due course, he arrived at the great city of Vārāṇasī.🔽He approached the Dharma teacher.

original: upasaṃkramya pādau śirasābhivandya sa tena dṛṣṭaḥ śīlavipanna ācāravipanno 'saṃvṛteryāpathaḥ /
analyzed: upasaṃkramya pādau śirasā abhivandya sa tena dṛṣṭaḥ śīla vipannaḥ ācāra vipannaḥ saṃvṛta īryāpathaḥ
translated: When he approached, he bowed his head to the feet of the Dharma teacher. The Dharma teacher saw him, and he was one who had fallen from morality, fallen from proper conduct, and whose deportment was unrestrained.

analyzed: tena tāṇi chātrāṇi upānahāni vastra ābharaṇāni gandha mālya vilepanāni upaḍhaukitāni
translated: He offered him those shoes, clothes, ornaments, and fragrant ointments.

original: tairvastrābharaṇaiḥ gandhamālyaiśca mahatīṃ pūjāṃ kṛtvā tasya dharmabhāṇakasya purastātprāñjalībhūtaḥ
analyzed: taiḥ vastra ābharaṇaiḥ gandha mālyaiḥ ca mahatīm pūjām kṛtvā tasya dharmabhāṇakasya purastāt prāñjalībhūtaḥ
translated: With those clothes, ornaments, and fragrant ointments, he made a great offering and, with palms joined,

analyzed: tad vijñam idam avocat aho dharma nidhāna āsvādakaḥ mṛta nidhiḥ iva saṃcaya an avagāhaḥ si
translated: he said to the Dharma teacher, Ah! You are a treasure of the Dharma, like a storehouse of nectar. You are unfathomable, like the ocean.

original: sāgaro yathā bhājanabhūto 'si sarvamānuṣyabhūteṣu eva te /
analyzed: sāgaraḥ yathā bhājana bhūtaḥ si sarva mānuṣya bhūteṣu eva te
translated: You are a vessel, like the ocean. You are the best among all human beings.

original: tava sakāśāddharmaṃ deśayataḥ devā nāgā yakṣā gandharvā asurā garūḍāḥ kinnarā mahoragā manuṣyāmanuṣyāḥ sarve te saṃnipatitāḥ /
analyzed: tava sakāśāt dharmam deśayataḥ devāḥ nāgāḥ yakṣāḥ gandharvāḥ asurāḥ garūḍāḥ kinnarāḥ mahoragāḥ manuṣya amanuṣyāḥ sarve te saṃnipatitāḥ
translated: From you, who teach the Dharma, gods, nāgas, yakṣas, gandharvas, asuras, garuḍas, kinnaras, mahoragas, humans, and non-humans, all of them have assembled.

original: tava dharmaśravaṇakāle mahāvajrasamaye dharmaparyāyaṃ nirdiśasi parimokṣayasi /
analyzed: tava dharma śravaṇa kāle mahāvajra samaye dharmaparyāyam nirdiśasi parimokṣayasi
translated: At the time of listening to your Dharma, you explain and liberate the Dharma discourse of the great vajra-like samādhi.

analyzed: bahavaḥ sattvāḥ ye saṃsāre bandhana baddhāḥ
translated: Many beings are bound by the fetters of saṃsāra.

original: puṇyavantaste sattvāḥ ye 'syāṃ vārāṇasyāṃ mahānagaryāṃ vasanti /
analyzed: puṇyavantaḥ te sattvāḥ ye syām vārāṇasyām mahā nagaryām vasanti
translated: Those beings who dwell in this great city of Vārāṇasī are meritorious.

analyzed: paśyanti
translated: They see you.

analyzed: tava satatam parigraham kurvanti
translated: They constantly take refuge in you.

analyzed: darśana mātreṇa sarva pāpāni nirdahasi
translated: Merely by seeing you, you burn away all their evil deeds.

analyzed: yathā agniḥ dahati vana antaram vaidya
translated: Just as fire burns a forest, O physician,

analyzed: evam tvam darśanena sarva pāpāni dahasi
translated: in the same way, by seeing you, you burn away all their evil deeds.

analyzed: jānante tava tathāgatāḥ arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhāḥ
translated: The Tathāgatas, Arhats, Perfectly Awakened Ones know you.

analyzed: anye ca aneka bodhisattva koṭī niyuta śata sahasrāṇi tava pūjā karmaṇaḥ upasaṃkrāmanti
translated: And many hundreds of thousands of millions of billions of other Bodhisattvas come to make offerings to you.

analyzed: brahma a viṣṇu maheśvara candra āditya vāyu varuṇa agnayaḥ yamaḥ ca dharma rājaḥ nye ca catvāraḥ mahā rājānaḥ
translated: Brahmā, Viṣṇu, Maheśvara, Candra, Āditya, Vāyu, Varuṇa, Agni, Yama the Lord of Dharma, and the other Four Great Kings,🔽all of them come to make offerings to you.

original: athe sa dharmabhāṇakastasyaitadavocat mā tvaṃ kulaputra kaukṛtyamutpādayasi /
analyzed: atha i sa dharmabhāṇakaḥ tasya etat avocat mā tvam kula putra kaukṛtyam utpādayasi
translated: Then the Dharma preacher said this to him: Do not give rise to regret, son of noble family.

original: kati māṣāḥ kleṣā aupabhogikāḥ saṃsārasya naimittikāḥ prajāmaṇḍalasyotpādikāḥ /
analyzed: kati māṣāḥ kleṣāḥ aupabhogikāḥ saṃsārasya naimittikāḥ prajā maṇḍalasya utpādikāḥ
translated: How many māṣas of afflictions are there, which are enjoyed, which are the causes of saṃsāra, which give rise to the circle of beings?

original: ye ca kulaputrāḥ ṣaḍakṣarīṃ mahāvidyārājñīṃ jānante /
analyzed: ye ca kula putrāḥ ṣaḍakṣarīm mahāvidyā rājñīm jānante
translated: And those sons of noble family who know the six-syllable great queen of knowledge,

original: na ca te rāgeṇa dveṣeṇa mohena saṃlipyante /
analyzed: na ca te rāgeṇa dveṣeṇa mohena saṃlipyante
translated: they are not smeared by desire, hatred, or ignorance.

original: yathā jāmbūnadasya suvarṇasya na sajjate malam /
analyzed: yathā jāmbūnadasya suvarṇasya na sajjate malam
translated: Just as the gold of the Jambū River is not stained by impurities,

original: evameva kulaputra yasya ṣaḍakṣarī mahāvidyā kāyagatā /
analyzed: evam eva kula putra yasya ṣaḍakṣarī mahāvidyā kāya gatā
translated: in the same way, son of noble family, for whom the six-syllable great knowledge is present in the body,

original: na tasya kāyena na rāgeṇa na dveṣeṇa na mohena saṃlipyate //
analyzed: na tasya kāyena na rāgeṇa na dveṣeṇa na mohena saṃlipyate
translated: he is not smeared by his body, by desire, hatred, or ignorance.

original: atha sarvanīvaraṇaviṣkambhī gāḍhaṃ pāde pariṣvajyainametadavocat vikalendriyasya cakṣurbhūto bhava /
analyzed: atha sarva nīvaraṇa viṣkambhī gāḍham pāde pariṣvajya enam etat avocat vikala indriyasya cakṣuḥ bhūtaḥ bhava
translated: Then Sarvanīvaraṇaviṣkambhin embraced his feet tightly and said this to him: Be an eye for the one with impaired faculties.

analyzed: naṣṭa mārgasya upadarśakaḥ bhava
translated: Be a guide for the one who has lost the path.

analyzed: dharma paritṛṣitasya dharma rasena saṃtarpaya me tvam
translated: Satisfy me with the taste of the Dharma, thirsty for the Dharma.

analyzed: anuttara asamyaksaṃbodhi viprahīṇasya bodhi bījam me dadasva
translated: Give me the seed of enlightenment, deprived of unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

analyzed: dharmāṇām avakāśam dadasva
translated: Give me an opportunity for the teachings.

analyzed: su pratiṣṭhita rūpāṇām kāya pariśuddhim dadasva
translated: Grant the purification of the body to those of well-established form.

original: abhedyānāṃ kuśalānāṃ pratilambha iti sarvajanāḥ kathayanti vākyaṃ madhuropacayam /
analyzed: abhedyānām kuśalānām pratilambhaḥ iti sarva janāḥ kathayanti vākyam madhura upacayam
translated: All people speak these sweet and nourishing words: The attainment of the indestructible wholesome dharmas.

original: evaṃ gururdadasva me ṣaḍakṣarīṃ mahāvidyārājñīṃ yenāhaṃ kṣipramanuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhimabhisaṃbuddho bhaveyam /
analyzed: evam guruḥ dadasva me ṣaḍakṣarīm mahāvidyā rājñīm yena aham kṣipram anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbuddhaḥ bhaveyam
translated: Thus, O Guru, grant me the six-syllable great knowledge queen, by which I may quickly attain supreme perfect enlightenment.

analyzed: dvādaśa ākāram
translated: The wheel of the twelve aspects of the Dharma.

analyzed: mā āvartayeyam
translated: May I turn it.

analyzed: sarva sattvānām sāṃsārikam duḥkham parimocayeyam
translated: May I liberate all beings from the suffering of worldly existence.

analyzed: ṣaḍakṣarī mahāvidyā rājñī labdha lābhaḥ bhaveyam
translated: May I obtain the six-syllable great knowledge queen.

analyzed: dadasva me ṣaḍakṣarīm mahāvidyā rājñīm
translated: Grant me the six-syllable great knowledge queen.

analyzed: trātā bhava
translated: Be a protector.

analyzed: śaraṇam parāyaṇam
translated: Be a refuge, a final resort.

analyzed: a dvīpānām dvipaḥ bhava
translated: For those without an island, be an island.

original: atha sa dharmabhāṇakastasyaitadavocat durlabhaṃ ṣaḍakṣarimahāvidyārājñyā asamavajrapadam /
analyzed: atha sa dharmabhāṇakaḥ tasya etat avocat durlabham ṣaḍakṣari mahāvidyā rājñyāḥ asama vajra padam
translated: Then that Dharma teacher said this to him: The six-syllable great knowledge queen is difficult to obtain, the indestructible vajra verse,

analyzed: abhedya vajra padam  anuttara jñāna darśana padam
translated: the indestructible vajra verse,🔽the verse of unsurpassed knowledge and insight,

analyzed: akṣaya jñāna padam
translated: the verse of inexhaustible knowledge,

analyzed: niruttara padam
translated: the unsurpassed verse,

analyzed: mokṣa praveśana padam
translated: the verse of entering liberation,

analyzed: tathāgata jñāna viśuddhi padam
translated: the verse of the purity of the knowledge of the Tathagata.

analyzed: rāga dveṣa moha saṃsāra duḥkha parivarjana padam
translated: The stage of abandoning the suffering of samsara due to desire, hatred, and delusion.

analyzed: sarva upāya kauśalya padam
translated: The stage of all skillful means.
The stage of perfecting meditation, liberation, concentration, and absorption.

analyzed: sarva dharma praviśana padam
translated: The stage of entering all dharmas.

analyzed: nitya kāla devatā abhikāṅkṣi padam
translated: The stage of always desiring the deities.

analyzed: ye ca kula putrāḥ nānā sthāneṣu dīkṣante
translated: Those noble sons who are initiated in various places,

analyzed: mokṣa artheṣu nānā paṭeṣu dīkṣante
translated: are initiated in various rites for the sake of liberation,

analyzed: tat yathā indra paṭam śveta paṭam dhyuṣita paṭam
translated: such as the Indra rite, the white cloth rite, and the dyed cloth rite.

analyzed: divasa nirīkṣakāḥ maheśvareṣu dīkṣante
translated: They are initiated in the Mahesvara rites that observe the days,

analyzed: bailma vega rūdreṣu nagna śramaṇeṣu ca
translated: in the naked ascetic rites of Baelmavega and Rudra.

analyzed: eṣu sthāneṣu dīkṣante
translated: They are initiated in these places.

analyzed: na teṣām mokṣam saṃvidyate
translated: They do not have liberation.

analyzed: anādigatikānām api na api nāśaḥ bhavati
translated: They also do not attain the end of beginningless existence.

original: sarvadevagaṇāśca brahmaviṣṇumaheśvarāḥ śakraśca devānāmindraścandrādityau vāyuvaruṇādayo yamaśca dharmarājo catvāraśca mahārājānaḥ /
analyzed: sarva deva gaṇāḥ ca brahma viṣṇu maheśvarāḥ śakraḥ ca devānām indraḥ candra ādityau vāyu varuṇa ādayaḥ yamaḥ ca catvāraḥ ca mahārājānaḥ
translated: All the hosts of gods, Brahma, Vishnu, Maheshvara, Shakra, the lord of the gods, the moon and sun, Vayu, Varuna and others, Yama the lord of justice, and the four great kings,

analyzed: te nitya kālam ṣaḍakṣarīm mahavidyā rājñīm prārthayanti
translated: they always long for the six-syllable great queen of knowledge.

original: atha sarvanīvaraṇaviṣkambhī tamāha kathaṃ vayaṃ ṣaḍakṣarīṃ mahāvidyārājñīṃ labhemahi yena vayaṃ kṣipravarā bhavāmaḥ /
analyzed: atha sarva nīvaraṇa viṣkambhī tam āha katham vayam ṣaḍakṣarīm mahāvidyā rājñīm labhemahi yena vayam kṣipra varāḥ bhavāmaḥ
translated: Then Sarvanivaranavishkambhin said to him, How can we obtain the six-syllable great vidya queen, by which we may quickly become supreme?

original: dharmabhāṇakastamuvāca tadyathāpi nāma sarvanīvaraṇaviṣkambhin prajñāpāramitānirjātāḥ sarvatathāgatāḥ /
analyzed: dharma bhāṇakaḥ tam uvāca tat yathā api nāma sarva nīvaraṇa viṣkambhin prajñāpāramitā nirjātāḥ sarva tathāgatāḥ
translated: The Dharma preacher said to him, Just as, Sarvanivaranavishkambhin, all tathagatas are born from the perfection of wisdom,

analyzed: tat prajñāpāramitā sarva tathāgatānām ca netrī iti ākhyāyate
translated: that perfection of wisdom is called the guide of all tathagatas.

original: sāpi ca ṣaḍakṣarīṃ mahāvidyārājñīṃ praṇamate kṛtāñjalipuṭā bhavantī /
analyzed: sā api ca ṣaḍakṣarīm mahāvidyā rājñīm praṇamate kṛta añjali puṭā bhavantī
translated: And that also bows to the six-syllable great vidya queen, with palms joined in reverence,

analyzed: prāk eva tathāgatāḥ arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhāḥ bodhisattva gaṇāḥ
translated: how much more so the tathagatas, arhats, perfectly enlightened buddhas, and the bodhisattva assemblies.

original: ida kulaputra taṇḍulavatsāraṃ mahāyānasya kiṃcidasau bahumahāyānasūtraṃ geyaṃ vyākaraṇagāthānidānetivṛttajātakavaipulyādbhutadharmopadeśakaḥ
analyzed: kula putra taṇḍula vat sāram mahāyānasya kiṃcid asau bahu mahāyāna sūtram geyam vyākaraṇa gāthā nidāna itivṛtta jātaka vaipulya adbhuta dharma upadeśakaḥ
translated: O son of noble family, this is like the essence of rice, the great vehicle. It is a little, but it is the great vehicle sutra, song, prophecy, verse, nidana, itivrittaka, jātaka, vaipulya, adbhutadharma teaching.

analyzed: vaidya
translated: Vaidya

analyzed: kula putra japita mātreṇa śivam mokṣam
translated: O son of noble family, by merely reciting it, one attains the auspicious liberation.

analyzed: kiṃbahunā anya kuśalam iti
translated: What need is there for other virtues?

original: kiṃvā tu samadhyagataṃ sāramupagṛhṇanti śālinastathā sāramityanugṛhṇanti /
analyzed: kiṃvā tu samadhya gatam sāram upagṛhṇanti śālinaḥ tathā sāram iti anugṛhṇanti
translated: But they take up the essence that is in the middle, just as the rice-eaters take up the essence in that way.

original: nītvā svakīye niveśane bhāṇḍāni paripūrṇāni kṛtvā sthāpayitvā divasānurūpeṇa sūryatāpena pariśoṣayitvā musalaprahārairvibhedayanti /
analyzed: nītvā svakīye niveśane bhāṇḍāni paripūrṇāni kṛtvā sthāpayitvā divasa anurūpeṇa sūrya tāpena pariśoṣayitvā musala prahāraiḥ vibhedayanti
translated: They take them to their own homes, fill the vessels, place them, dry them in the sun according to the day, and break them with blows from pestles.

analyzed: tatas catur varṣāṇi parityajanti
translated: Then they abandon the four years.

analyzed: kim sāram iti vyavasthitam
translated: What is the essence?

analyzed: taṇḍula sāram iti
translated: The essence of rice.

analyzed: evam eva anye yogāḥ tuṣa sadṛśāḥ
translated: In the same way, the other yogas are like husks.

original: sarvayogānāṃ ceyaṃ ṣaḍakṣarī mahāvidyā rājñī taṇḍulamiti bhūtā draṣṭavyā /
analyzed: sarva yogānām ca iyam ṣaḍakṣarī mahāvidyā rājñī taṇḍulam iti bhūtā draṣṭavyā
translated: And this six-syllable great knowledge queen of all yogas should be seen as the rice,

original: yasyāḥ kāraṇena kulaputra bodhisattvāḥ śrāvayanto bhramanti dānapāramitārthinaḥ /
analyzed: yasyāḥ kāraṇena kula putra bodhisattvāḥ śrāvayantaḥ bhramanti dāna pāramitā arthinaḥ
translated: for the sake of which, son of good family, the bodhisattvas wander, listening to the meaning of the perfection of giving.

analyzed: śīla pāramitā arthinaḥ  kṣānti pāramitā arthinaḥ vīrya pāramitā arthinaḥ
translated: Seeking the meaning of the perfection of morality.

analyzed: dhyāna pāramitā arthinaḥ
translated: Seeking the meaning of the perfection of patience. Seeking the meaning of the perfection of effort.🔽Seeking the meaning of the perfection of meditation.

analyzed: prajñāpāramitā arthinaḥ
translated: Seeking the meaning of the perfection of wisdom.

analyzed: eka jāpena kula putra ṣaḍ pāramitāḥ paripūrayanti
translated: Son of good family, by reciting it once, they fulfill the six perfections.

analyzed: yasya kasyacid vastra sparśanena api a vaivartika bhūmim pratilabhante
translated: By the touch of anyone's cloth, they attain the stage of non-retrogression.

analyzed: evam eva asyāḥ ṣaṣ akṣarī mahāvidyā rājñī
translated: In the same way, this six-syllable great knowledge queen.

analyzed: durlabham asyāḥ nāmagrahaṇam
translated: It is difficult to obtain the recitation of her name.

analyzed: eka vāra nāma grahaṇena sarve tathāgatāḥ cīvara piṇḍa pātra śayyā āsana glāna pratyaya bhaiṣajya pariṣkaraiḥ sarva upasthānaiḥ upasthitāḥ bhavanti
translated: By uttering the name just once, all the Tathāgatas are served with robes, alms-food, bowls, bedding, medicine for the sick, and all necessary utensils.

original: atha sarvanīvaraṇaviṣkambhī dharmabhāṇakametadavocat dadasva me ṣaḍakṣarimahāvidyārājñīm /

translated: In that pore the ground was made of vajra.

original: tasmin romavivare navanavatikūṭāgāraśatasahasrāṇi divyasauvarṇamayāni muktāhārapaṭadāmakalāpapralambitāni ghaṇṭāmālāpralambitāni candrakāntiratnāvabhāsitāni
analyzed: tasmin roma vivare nava navati kūṭāgāra śata sahasrāṇi divya sauvarṇa mayāni muktā hāra paṭa dāma kalāpa pralambitāni ghaṇṭā mālā pralambitāni candra kānti ratna avabhāsitāni
translated: In that pore there were nine hundred and ninety thousand koṭi kūṭāgāras made of divine gold, draped with pearl necklaces, garlands, and wreaths, hung with garlands of bells, and illuminated by moon-crystal jewels.

analyzed: tat teṣu kūṭāgāreṣu tathāgata vigrahāḥ niṣaṇṇāḥ
translated: In those kūṭāgāras there were tathāgata-forms seated.

original: te jāmbūdvīpakānāṃ manuṣyāṇāṃ ca dharmaṃ deśayanti /
analyzed: te jāmbūdvīpakānām manuṣyāṇām ca dharmam deśayanti
translated: They taught the Dharma to the humans of Jambudvīpa,

analyzed: yat uta ṣaṣ pāramitā nirdeśam nirdiśanti
translated: namely, they taught the six perfections.

analyzed: dāna pāramitā nirdeśam nirdiśanti
translated: They taught the perfection of giving.

analyzed: śīla pāramitā nirdeśam nirdiśanti  kṣānti pāramitā nirdeśam nirdiśanti
translated: They taught the perfection of morality.🔽They taught the perfection of patience.

analyzed: vīrya pāramitā nirdeśam nirdiśanti
translated: They taught the perfection of vigor.

analyzed: dhyāna pāramitā nirdeśam nirdiśanti
translated: They teach the perfection of meditation.

analyzed: prajñāpāramitā nirdeśam nirdiśanti
translated: They teach the perfection of wisdom.

original: evaṃ vividhāṃ dharmadeśanāṃ kṛtvā jāmbudvīpakānāṃ manuṣyāṇāṃ kālena kālaṃ dharma deśayanti /
analyzed: evam vividhām dharma deśanām kṛtvā jāmbudvīpakānām manuṣyāṇām kālena kālam dharma deśayanti
translated: Having thus given various Dharma teachings, they teach the Dharma to the humans of Jambudvīpa from time to time.

original: evaṃ te kulaputra avalokiteśvarasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya romavivarāṇi yāvatpaśyanti /🔽tasminneva jetavanavihāre Vaidya
analyzed: evam te kula putra avalokiteśvarasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya roma vivarāṇi yāvat paśyanti  tasmin eva jetavana vihāre vaidya
translated: Thus, noble sir, they see the pores of the bodhisattva mahāsattva Avalokiteśvara.

analyzed: deva nāga yakṣa gandharva asura garūḍa kinnara mahoraga manuṣya amanuṣya maheśvara nārāyaṇa pūrvaṃgamāni deva putrāṇi saṃnipatitāni
translated: In that very Jeta Grove monastery, the gods, nāgas, yakṣas, gandharvas, asuras, garuḍas, kinnaras, mahoragas, humans, non-humans, Maheśvara, Nārāyaṇa, and other gods have assembled.

original: anekāni bodhisattvakoṭiniyutaśatasahasrāṇi saṃnipatitāni //🔽atha sarvanīvaraṇaviṣkambhī bhagavantametadavocat kiṃ bhagavan /
analyzed: anekāni bodhisattva koṭi niyuta śata sahasrāṇi saṃnipatitāni  atha sarva nīvaraṇa viṣkambhī bhagavantam etat avocat  kim bhagavan
translated: Many hundreds of thousands of millions of billions of bodhisattvas have assembled.

analyzed: yāni roma vivarāṇi
translated: Then Sarvanīvaraṇaviṣkambhin said this to the Blessed One: What are the pores, Blessed One?

analyzed: saṃvidyante vāḥ
translated: Are they existent or not?

original: bhagavānāha tataḥ kulaputra romavivarādatikramya avalokiteśvarasya dakṣiṇaṃ pādāṅguṣṭhaṃ yatra te catvāro mahāsamudrāḥ paribhramanti /
analyzed: bhagavān āha tatas kula putra roma vivarāt atikramya avalokiteśvarasya dakṣiṇam pādāṅguṣṭham yatra te catvāraḥ mahā samudrāḥ paribhramanti
translated: The Blessed One said, Then, noble son, beyond that pore, on the right big toe of Avalokitesvara, there the four great oceans revolve.

analyzed: na ca jānanti avagāhayanti  yadā dakṣiṇa pāda aṅguṣṭhāt udakam niṣkrāmati
translated: But they do not know or understand.🔽When water comes out from the right big toe,

analyzed: tadā vaḍavāmukhe patanti
translated: then it falls into the mouth of the submarine fire.

analyzed: tadā bhasma rāśim anugacchanti
translated: Then it follows the heap of ashes.

analyzed: evam eva kula putra avalokiteśvarasya bodhisattvasya adhiṣṭhānam saṃvidyate
translated: In the same way, noble son, the bodhisattva Avalokitesvara has that kind of empowerment.

original: atha sarvanīvaraṇaviṣkambhī bhagavantametadavocat tadapi bhagavan romavivaraṃ saṃvidyate /
analyzed: atha sarva nīvaraṇa viṣkambhī bhagavantam etat avocat tat api bhagavan roma vivaram saṃvidyate
translated: Then Sarvanivaranaviskambhin said this to the Blessed One: Blessed One, is that pore of hair still there?

analyzed: bhagavān āha tat api kula putra na saṃvidyate
translated: The Blessed One said, Noble son, that is also not there.

analyzed: atha sarva nīvaraṇa viṣkambhī bhagavantam etat avocat na āgacchati bhagavan avalokita īśvaraḥ
translated: Then Sarvanivaranaviskambhin said this to the Blessed One: Blessed One, Avalokitesvara is not coming.

analyzed: bhagavān āha āgacchati kula putra avalokiteśvaraḥ
translated: The Blessed One said, Noble son, Avalokitesvara is coming.

original: asminneva jetavanamahāvihāre mama darśanāya vandanāya paryupāsanāya /
analyzed: asmin eva jetavana mahā vihāre mama darśanāya vandanāya paryupāsanāya
translated: In this very Jetavana monastery, to see me, to pay homage to me, to attend on me.

original: maheśvarasya devaputrasya sahāyā lokadhātau vyākaraṇamuddeśāya ca //
analyzed: maheśvarasya deva putrasya sahāyāḥ lokadhātau vyākaraṇam uddeśāya ca
translated: and for the sake of the prediction of the divine son Maheśvara's attainment of buddhahood in the world system Saha.

analyzed: atha avalokiteśvareṇa bodhisattvena mahāsattvena raśmayaḥ utsṛṣṭāḥ nīla pīta lohita avadāta māñjiṣṭha sphaṭika rajata varṇāḥ
translated: Then the bodhisattva mahāsattva Avalokiteśvara emitted light rays of blue, yellow, red, white, orange, crystal, silver, and golden colors.

analyzed: te ca raśmayaḥ jetavanam āgacchanti
translated: Those light rays came to the Jeta Grove.

original: āgatya bhagavantaṃ triḥ pradakṣiṇīkṛtya punareva jetavanādvihārānniṣkramya avīciṃ mahānarakaṃ gacchanti /
analyzed: āgatya bhagavantam tris pradakṣiṇīkṛtya punar eva jetavanāt vihārāt niṣkramya avīcim mahā narakam gacchanti
translated: Having come, they circumambulated the Blessed One three times and then left the Jetavana monastery again and went to the great Avīci hell.

analyzed: tatra gatvā avīci mahā narakam śīti bhāvam upanayanti
translated: Having gone there, they cooled the great Avīci hell.

original: atha sarvanīvaraṇaviṣkambhī bhagavantametadavocat kuto bhagavan raśmaya āgacchanti kutra gacchanti /
analyzed: atha sarva nīvaraṇa viṣkambhī bhagavantam etat avocat kutas bhagavan raśmayaḥ āgacchanti kutra gacchanti
translated: Then Sarvanīvaraṇaviṣkambhin said this to the Blessed One: Blessed One, where do the light rays come from and where do they go?

original: bhagavānāha evaṃ kulaputra avalokiteśvareṇa nānāvidhā raśmaya utsṛṣṭāḥ /
analyzed: bhagavān āha evam kula putra avalokiteśvareṇa nānāvidhāḥ raśmayaḥ utsṛṣṭāḥ
translated: The Blessed One said, Son of noble family, in this way, the light rays of various kinds were emitted by Avalokiteśvara.

analyzed: te ca asmin jetavane vihāram āgacchanti
translated: And they came to the monastery in the Jeta Grove.

original: āgatya ca māṃ triḥ pradakṣiṇīkṛtya avīciṃ mahānarakaṃ gacchanti /
analyzed: āgatya ca mām tris pradakṣiṇīkṛtya avīcim mahā narakam gacchanti
translated: Having come, they circumambulated me three times and then went to the great Avīci hell.

analyzed: gatvā ca avīci mahā narakam śīti bhāvam kurvanti
translated: Having gone there, they cooled the great Avīci hell.

original: tasmin jetavane vihāre śubhanimittāni prādurbhūtāni /🔽divyāni campakavṛkṣāṇi prādurbhūtāni /
analyzed: tasmin jetavane vihāre śubha nimittāni prādurbhūtāni  divyāni campaka vṛkṣāṇi prādurbhūtāni
translated: In that Jetavana monastery, auspicious signs appeared.🔽Divine champaka trees appeared.

analyzed: divyāḥ puṣkariṇyaḥ prādurbhūtāḥ
translated: Divine lotus ponds appeared.

analyzed: tatra jetavana vihāre divya sauvarṇa nirbhāsāḥ dṛśyante
translated: In that Jetavana monastery, they were seen to be shining with divine gold.

analyzed: īdṛśaḥ jetavana vihāraḥ dṛśyate
translated: Such was the Jetavana monastery that was seen.

analyzed: atha avalokiteśvaraḥ sukhāvatī lokadhātoḥ niṣkramya yena jetavana vihāraḥ tena saṃprasthitaḥ
translated: Then Avalokiteshvara, having emerged from the world system of Sukhavati, set out for the Jetavana monastery.

analyzed: anupūrveṇa jetavana vihāram saṃprāptaḥ
translated: In due course, he arrived at the Jetavana monastery.

original: atha tasmin jetavanavihāre praviṣṭo bhagavataḥ pādau śirasābhivandya ekānte sthitaḥ /
analyzed: atha tasmin jetavana vihāre praviṣṭaḥ bhagavataḥ pādau śirasā abhivandya ekānte sthitaḥ
translated: Then, having entered that Jetavana monastery, he bowed his head at the feet of the Blessed One and stood to one side.

analyzed: tadā kalaviṅka ruta svara abhinirghoṣeṇa bhagavān ārocayati āgataḥ tvam kula putra
translated: At that time, the Blessed One addressed him with a voice resounding like the song of a kalaviṅka bird, You have come, noble son.

analyzed: kṛtaḥ te sattva parīpākaḥ
translated: You have ripened beings.

original: athāvalokiteśvaro bodhisattvo mahāsattvo bhagavantametadavocat yathājñapto bhagavatā /
analyzed: atha avalokiteśvaraḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ bhagavantam etat avocat yathā ājñaptaḥ bhagavatā
translated: Then the bodhisattva mahāsattva Avalokiteśvara said this to the Blessed One: As instructed by the Blessed One,

analyzed: evam ca mayā karma bhūmiḥ niṣpāditā
translated: and thus I have accomplished the field of karma.

original: atha bhagavān sādhukāramadāt sādhu sādhu kulaputra /
analyzed: atha bhagavān sādhukāram adāt sādhu sādhu kula putra
translated: Then the Blessed One gave his approval: Excellent, excellent, noble son!

analyzed: yaḥ tvayā īdṛśā karma bhūmiḥ niṣpāditā
translated: You have accomplished such a deed in this realm.

original: athāvalokiteśvaro bhagavantaṃ padmānyupanāmayati imāni te bhagavannamitābhena tathāgatena prahitāni /
analyzed: atha avalokiteśvaraḥ bhagavantam padmāni upanāmayati imāni te bhagavan amitābhena tathāgatena prahitāni
translated: Then Avalokiteśvara offered the lotuses to the Blessed One, saying, Blessed One, these were sent by the Tathāgata Amitābha.

original: pṛcchatyalpābādhatāṃ ca alpātaṅkatāṃ ca laghūtthānatāṃ ca sukhasparśavihāratāṃ ca /
analyzed: pṛcchati alpa ābādha tām ca alpa ātaṅka tām ca laghu utthāna tām ca sukha sparśa vihāra tām ca
translated: He inquires about your minor ailments, minor troubles, your lightness, your comfort, and ease in living.

analyzed: tatas bhagavatā gṛhītvā vāma pārśve sthāpitāni
translated: Then the Blessed One accepted them and placed them on his left side.

analyzed: atha maheśvaraḥ devaputraḥ yena bhagavān tena upasaṃkrāntaḥ
translated: Then the god Maheśvara approached the Blessed One.

original: upasaṃkramya bhagavataḥ pādau śirasābhivandya bhagavantametadavocat labheyāhaṃ bhagavan vyākaraṇanirdeśasya samuddeśam /🔽bhagavānāha Vaidya
analyzed: upasaṃkramya bhagavataḥ pādau śirasā abhivandya bhagavantam etat avocat labheya aham bhagavan vyākaraṇa nirdeśasya samuddeśam  bhagavān āha vaidya
translated: Having approached, he bowed his head at the feet of the Blessed One and said to the Blessed One, Blessed One, may I receive the prediction and instruction?

original: gaccha kulaputra avalokiteśvaro bodhisattvo mahāsattvaste vyākaraṇaṃ dāsyati /
analyzed: gaccha kula putra avalokiteśvaraḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ te vyākaraṇam dāsyati
translated: The Blessed One said, Go, son of noble family. The bodhisattva mahāsattva Avalokiteśvara will give you the prediction.

original: atha maheśvaro devaputro 'valokiteśvarasya pādayornipatya stotraviśeṣaṃ kartumārabdhaḥ
analyzed: atha maheśvaraḥ devaputraḥ valokiteśvarasya pādayoḥ nipatya stotra viśeṣam kartum ārabdhaḥ
translated: Then the god Maheśvara fell at the feet of Avalokiteśvara and began to make a special praise:

original: namostvalokiteśvarāya maheśvarāya padmadharāya padmāsanāya padmapriyāya śubhapadmahastāya padmaśriye parivṛtāya jagadāsvādanakarāya pṛthivīvaralocanakarāya
analyzed: namaḥ astu alokiteśvarāya maheśvarāya padma dharāya padmāsanāya padmapriyāya śubha padma hastāya padmaśriye parivṛtāya jagat āsvādana karāya pṛthivī vara locana karāya
translated: Homage to Avalokiteśvara, the Great Lord, the lotus-holder, the lotus-seated, the lotus-lover, the one with the auspicious lotus in hand, surrounded by the glory of lotuses, the one who delights the world, the one who bestows the most excellent eyes of the earth,

analyzed: prahlādana karāya
translated: the one who brings joy.

original: evaṃ maheśvaro devaputro gatvā avalokiteśvarasya stotraviśeṣaṃ kṛtvā tūṣṇīṃbhāvena vyavasthitaḥ /
analyzed: evam maheśvaraḥ devaputraḥ gatvā avalokiteśvarasya stotra viśeṣam kṛtvā tūṣṇīṃbhāvena vyavasthitaḥ
translated: Thus, the god Maheśvara, having gone and made a special praise of Avalokiteśvara, remained silent.

original: atha avalokiteśvarastametadavocat kiṃ kāraṇaṃ tvaṃ kulaputra tūṣṇīṃbhāvena vyavasthitaḥ /
analyzed: atha avalokiteśvaraḥ tam etat avocat kim kāraṇam tvam kula putra tūṣṇīṃbhāvena vyavasthitaḥ
translated: Then Avalokiteśvara said to him, For what reason do you remain silent, noble son?

original: atha maheśvaro devaputrastametadavocat dadasva me vyākaraṇamanuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau /🔽avalokiteśvarastametadavocat bhaviṣyasi tvaṃ kulaputra vivṛtāyāṃ lokadhātau bhasmeśvaro
analyzed: atha maheśvaraḥ deva putraḥ tam etat avocat dadasva me vyākaraṇam anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau  avalokiteśvaraḥ tam etat avocat bhaviṣyasi tvam kula putra vivṛtāyām lokadhātau bhasmeśvaraḥ
translated: Then the god Maheśvara said to him, Give me the prediction of unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: nāma tathāgato 'rhan samyaksaṃbuddho vidyācaraṇasaṃpannaḥ sugato lokavidanuttaraḥ
analyzed: nāma tathāgataḥ rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ vidyā caraṇa saṃpannaḥ sugataḥ loka vid anuttaraḥ
translated: Avalokiteśvara said to him, You will become, noble son, in the open world system, the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One, the one endowed with knowledge and conduct, the Well-Gone One, the Knower of the world, the Unsurpassed One,

original: puruṣadamyasārathiḥ śāstā devānāṃ ca manuṣyāṇāṃ ca buddho bhagavān /
analyzed: puruṣa damya sārathiḥ śāstā devānām ca manuṣyāṇām ca buddhaḥ bhagavān
translated: the Trainer of human beings to be tamed, the Teacher of gods and humans, the Buddha, the Blessed One, named Bhasmeśvara.

original: atha sā umādevyupasaṃkramyāvalokiteśvarasya pādau śirasā vanditvā avalokiteśvarasya stotrābhidhānaṃ kartumārabdhāḥ
analyzed: atha sā umā devī upasaṃkramya avalokiteśvarasya pādau śirasā vanditvā avalokiteśvarasya stotra abhidhānam kartum ārabdhāḥ
translated: Then Goddess Uma approached and bowed her head at the feet of Avalokiteshvara. She began to praise Avalokiteshvara:

original: namo 'stvalokiteśvarāya meheśvarāya prāṇaṃdadāya pṛthivīvaralocanakarāya śubhapadmaśriye parivṛtāya nirvāṇabhūmisaṃprasthitāya sucetanakarāya
analyzed: namaḥ stu alokita īśvarāya meha īśvarāya prāṇaṃdadāya pṛthivī vara locana karāya śubha padma śriye parivṛtāya nirvāṇa bhūmi saṃprasthitāya su cetana karāya
translated: Homage to Avalokiteshvara, the Lord of Compassion, the Giver of Life, the One who Bestows the Eyes of the Earth, the One with the Auspicious Lotus Glory, the One Surrounded by Nirmanakayas, the One who Sets out for the Stage of Nirvana, the One who Brings Good Thoughts.

analyzed: dharma dharāya
translated: To the One who Upholds the Dharma.

original: evaṃ sā umādevī stotrābhidhānaṃ kṛtvā avalokiteśvarasya pratyāhāraṃ kartumārabdhā
analyzed: evam sā umā devī stotra abhidhānam kṛtvā avalokiteśvarasya pratyāhāram kartum ārabdhā
translated: Having thus praised Avalokiteshvara, Goddess Uma began to request him:

analyzed: parimocaya me strī bhāvāt jugupsanīyāt
translated: Deliver me from this despised state of womanhood,

analyzed: kali mala paripūrṇa garbhāvāsa duḥkhāt satata parigraha saṃgṛhītāt parimokṣaya mām
translated: from the suffering of dwelling in a womb filled with the filth of Kali Yuga, from being constantly bound by attachments. Deliver me.

original: athāvalokiteśvarastāmetadavocat bhaviṣyasi tvaṃ bhagini umeśvaro nāma tathāgato🔽'rhan samyaksaṃbuddho vidyācaraṇasaṃpannaḥ sugato lokavidanuttaraḥ puruṣadamyasārathiḥ
analyzed: atha avalokiteśvaraḥ tām etat avocat bhaviṣyasi tvam bhagini umeśvaraḥ nāma tathāgataḥ  rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ vidyā caraṇa saṃpannaḥ sugataḥ loka vid anuttaraḥ puruṣa damya sārathiḥ
translated: Then Avalokiteshvara said to her, Sister, you will become the Tathagata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One, the One with Knowledge and Conduct, the Well-Gone One, the Knower of the World, the Unsurpassed One, the Tamer of Men, the Teacher of Gods and Humans, the Buddha, the Blessed One, named Umeshvara.

original: śāstā devānāṃ ca manuṣyāṇāṃ ca buddho bhagavān /
analyzed: śāstā devānām ca manuṣyāṇām ca buddhaḥ bhagavān
translated: The One with Attained Knowledge and Conduct, the Well-Gone One, the Knower of the World, the Unsurpassed One, the Tamer of Men, the Teacher of Gods and Humans, the Buddha, the Blessed One.

original: himavataḥ parvatarājasya dakṣiṇe pārśve tava lokadhāturbhaviṣyati /
analyzed: himavataḥ parvatarājasya dakṣiṇe pārśve tava lokadhātuḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: To the south of the king of mountains, the Himalayas, your world realm will be.

analyzed: atha sā umā devī vyākaraṇam anuprāptā
translated: Then that goddess Uma received the prophecy.

analyzed: bhagavān āha paśya sarva nīvaraṇa viṣkambhin
translated: The Blessed One said, Look, Sarvanivarana Viskambhin.

original: vyākṛtā umādevī avalokiteśveraṇa bodhisattvena mahāsattvena sarve te 'nuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau //
analyzed: vyākṛtā umā devī bodhisattvena mahāsattvena sarve te nuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau
translated: The goddess Uma was prophesied by the bodhisattva mahasattva Avalokiteshvara. All of them are in unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: ayaṃ kulaputra maheśvaranirvyūho nāma khyāta iti //
analyzed: ayam kula putra maheśvaranirvyūhaḥ nāma khyātaḥ iti
translated: This, O son of noble family, is known as the Array of Mahesvara.

analyzed: start kvyu
translated: Here begins the Kavyadarsa.

analyzed: aṣṭamam prakaraṇam
translated: The eighth chapter.

analyzed: atha sarva nīvaraṇa viṣkambhī bhagavantam etat avocat āgataḥ bhagavan avalokiteśvaraḥ
translated: Then Sarvanivarana Viskambhin said this to the Blessed One: Blessed One, Avalokiteshvara has come.

analyzed: yathā andha bhūtena cakṣuḥ anuprāptam
translated: Just as one who is blind has obtained sight.

analyzed: evam bhagavan avalokiteśvaraḥ nuprāptaḥ
translated: Thus, Blessed One, Avalokiteshvara has arrived.

analyzed: adya me saphalam janma
translated: Today my birth has borne fruit.

analyzed: adya me āśā paripūrṇā
translated: Today my hopes are fulfilled.

analyzed: adya me pariśodhitaḥ bodhi mārgaḥ
translated: Today my path to enlightenment is purified.

analyzed: sa cetana sadharmakāya nirvāṇa upadarśakam
translated: He shows the nirvana of the body of consciousness and the Dharma body.

original: atha sarvanīvaraṇaviṣkambhī punareva bhagavantametadavocat adyāsmākaṃ bhagavan deśaya tvamavalokiteśvarasya guṇaviśeṣam //
