translated: Just as a white cloth follows the blue,

analyzed: sa pāpa rāśiḥ iva draṣṭavyaḥ
translated: it should be seen as a mass of evil.

original: evameva kulaputra idaṃ kāraṇḍavyūhaṃ mahāyānasūtraratnarājaṃ sarvapāpāni dahati /
analyzed: evam eva kula putraḥ idam kāraṇḍa vyūham mahāyāna sūtra ratna rājam sarva pāpāni dahati
translated: In the same way, son of noble family, this Karanda Vyūha Mahāyāna Sūtra Ratnarāja burns away all evils.

analyzed: su śukla bhāvam kurute
translated: It makes them very white.

original: tadyathāpi nāma sarvanīvaraṇaviṣkambhin varṣākālasamaye sarvāṇi tṛṇagulmauṣadhivanaspatayaḥ sarve nīlābhirūpā bhavanti /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma sarva nīvaraṇa viṣkambhin varṣā kāla samaye sarvāṇi tṛṇa gulma oṣadhi vanaspatayaḥ sarve nīla abhirūpāḥ bhavanti
translated: For example, Sarvanīvaraṇaviṣkambhin, during the rainy season, all the grass, bushes, herbs, and trees become blue in color.

original: atha śatamukho nāma nāgarājaḥ bhavanādavatīrya sarvāstā tṛṇagulmauṣadhivanaspatīrdahati /
analyzed: atha śatamukhaḥ nāma nāga rājaḥ bhavanāt avatīrya sarvāḥ tāḥ tṛṇa gulma oṣadhi vanaspatīḥ dahati
translated: Then the nāga king named Śata-mukha descends from his abode and burns all those grass, bushes, herbs, and trees.

original: evamevāyaṃ kulaputraṃ kāraṇḍavyūhaṃ mahāyānasūtraratnarājaṃ sarvapāpāni dahati /
analyzed: evam eva ayam kula putram kāraṇḍa vyūham mahāyāna sūtra ratna rājam sarva pāpāni dahati
translated: In the same way, O son of noble family, this Karandavyūha, the king of the Mahāyāna sūtra jewels, burns all evil deeds.

analyzed: śukla bhāvam kurute  sukhitāḥ te sattvāḥ bhaviṣyanti
translated: It makes them pure.

original: ya imaṃ kāraṇḍavyūhaṃ mahāyānasūtraṃ ratnarājaṃ Vaidya śroṣyanti /
analyzed: ye imam kāraṇḍa vyūham mahāyāna sūtram ratna rājam vaidya śroṣyanti
translated: Those beings who will hear this Karandavyūha, the king of the Mahāyāna sūtra jewels, will be happy.

original: na te kulaputra pṛthagjanā iti vaktavyāḥ /
analyzed: na te kula putra pṛthagjanāḥ iti vaktavyāḥ
translated: O son of noble family, they should not be called ordinary beings.

analyzed: avaivartikāḥ bodhisattvāḥ iva draṣṭavyāḥ
translated: They should be seen as irreversible bodhisattvas.

original: teṣāṃ ca maraṇakāraṇasamaye dvādaśa tathāgatā upasaṃkramya āśvāsayanti mā bhaiṣīḥ kulaputra /
analyzed: teṣām ca maraṇa kāraṇa samaye dvādaśa tathāgatāḥ upasaṃkramya āśvāsayanti mā bhaiṣīḥ kula putra
translated: When the time comes for their death, twelve tathāgatas will approach and comfort them, saying, 'Do not be afraid, O son of noble family.

analyzed: tvayā kāraṇḍa vyūham mahāyāna sūtra ratna rājam śrutam
translated: You have heard the Karandavyūha, the king of the Mahāyāna sūtra jewels.

analyzed: na tvayā punar eva saṃsāram saṃsaritavyam
translated: You will not have to wander in saṃsāra again.

analyzed: na punar api teṣām jāti jarā maraṇam bhaviṣyati
translated: They will not have birth, old age, and death again.

analyzed: tatas iṣṭa priya viprayogaḥ priya saṃprayogaḥ na bhaviṣyati
translated: Then there will be no separation from what is desired and loved, and no union with what is loved.

analyzed: gamiṣyasi tvam kula putra sukhāvati lokadhātum
translated: O son of noble family, you will go to the world system Sukhāvatī.

analyzed: amitābhasya tathāgatasya sakāśāt dharmam anuśroṣyasi
translated: You will hear the Dharma from the Tathāgata Amitābha.

original: evaṃ kulaputra teṣāṃ sattvānāṃ sukhamaraṇaṃ bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: evam kula putra teṣām sattvānām sukha maraṇam bhaviṣyati
translated: In this way, noble son, those beings will have a happy death.

original: athāvalokiteśvaro bhagavataḥ pādau śirasābhivandya ekānte prakrāntaḥ /
analyzed: atha avalokiteśvaraḥ bhagavataḥ pādau śirasā abhivandya ekānte prakrāntaḥ
translated: Then Avalokiteśvara bowed his head at the feet of the Blessed One and departed to one side.

analyzed: atha sarva nīvaraṇa viṣkambhiḥ tūṣṇīṃbhāvena vyavasthitaḥ
translated: Then Sarvanīvaraṇaviṣkambhin remained silent.

original: ta ca devā nāgā yakṣā gandharvā asurā garūḍāḥ kinnarā mahoragā manuṣyāmanuṣyāḥ prakrāntāḥ //
analyzed: ta ca devāḥ nāgāḥ yakṣāḥ gandharvāḥ asurāḥ garūḍāḥ kinnarāḥ mahoragāḥ manuṣya amanuṣyāḥ prakrāntāḥ
translated: And the gods, nāgas, yakṣas, gandharvas, asuras, garuḍas, kinnaras, mahoragas, humans, and non-humans departed.

original: yadā te prakrāntāstadāyuṣmānānando bhagavantametadavocat deśayatu me bhagavānasmākaṃ śikṣāsaṃvaram /
analyzed: yadā te prakrāntāḥ tadā āyuṣmān ānandaḥ bhagavantam etat avocat deśayatu me bhagavān asmākam śikṣā saṃvaram
translated: When they had departed, the venerable Ānanda said this to the Blessed One: May the Blessed One teach us the restraint of training.

analyzed: bhagavān āha ye bhikṣavaḥ upasaṃpadā abhāvam icchanti
translated: The Blessed One said, Monks who wish for the state of higher ordination,

analyzed: taiḥ prathamataram gatvā āvāsam samyak avalokayitavyam
translated: they should first go and properly inspect the dwelling place.

analyzed: vyavalokayitvā bhikṣuka
translated: Having inspected it, monks,

original: mārocayitavyaṃ śuddhayate bhadanta nānāvāsaṃ na ca yatra nānāvāse 'sthīni saṃvidyante /
analyzed: mā ārocayitavyam śuddha yate bhadanta nānā vāsam na ca yatra nānā vāse sthīni saṃvidyante
translated: they should announce, 'Venerable sir, it is a separate dwelling place, and in that separate dwelling place there are no bones present.

analyzed: uccāra prastāve na saṃvidyete
translated: There are no excrement and urine present.

analyzed: pariśuddhayā ati
translated: It is completely pure.'

analyzed: evam bhadanta nānā vāsam arhati upasaṃpadā abhāvaḥ bhikṣūṇām
translated: 'In this way, venerable sir, the state of higher ordination for the monks is suitable in a separate dwelling place.'

analyzed: bhagavān āha duḥśīlena bhikṣuṇā na upasaṃpādayitavyam
translated: The Blessed One said: A monk who is immoral should not be given full ordination.

analyzed: na ca jñaptiḥ dātavyā
translated: And a motion should not be given to him.

original: kiṃ bahunā / bhikṣavo duḥśīlena bhikṣuṇā nānāvāsaṃ na kartavyam /
analyzed: kim bahunā bhikṣavaḥ duḥśīlena bhikṣuṇā nānā vāsam na kartavyam
translated: What's the use of much talk? Monks, a monk who is immoral should not go to another residence.

analyzed: prāk eva jñapti caturtham
translated: Let alone a motion and a fourth [announcement].

analyzed: ete hi śāsana dūṣakāḥ
translated: For they defile the teaching.

original: duḥśīlānāṃ bhikṣūṇāṃ śīlavatāṃ dakṣiṇīyāṇāṃ madhye āvāso na dātavyaḥ /
analyzed: duḥśīlānām bhikṣūṇām śīlavatām dakṣiṇīyāṇām madhye āvāsaḥ na dātavyaḥ
translated: A dwelling should not be given to immoral monks in the midst of those who are moral and worthy of offerings.

analyzed: teṣām bahis vihāre āvāsaḥ dātavyaḥ
translated: They should be given a dwelling outside the monastery.

original: tathā saṃghālāpo na dātavyaḥ /🔽na ca teṣāṃ sāṃghikī bhūmimarhati /
analyzed: tathā saṃgha ālāpaḥ na dātavyaḥ  na ca teṣām sāṃghikī bhūmim arhati
translated: And they should not be given a place in the Sangha assembly.🔽And they do not deserve any of the land belonging to the Sangha.

analyzed: na ca teṣām kiṃcid bhikṣu bhāvam saṃvidyate
translated: And they have no status as monks at all.

original: atha khalvāyuṣmānānando bhagavantametadavocat katame kāle bhagavannīdṛśādakṣiṇīyā bhaviṣyanti /🔽bhagavānāha tṛtīye varṣaśatagate mama parinirvṛtasya tathāgatasya īdṛśādakṣiṇīyā bhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: atha khalu āyuṣmān ānandaḥ bhagavantam etat avocat katame kāle bhagavan īdṛśa a dakṣiṇīyāḥ bhaviṣyanti  bhagavān āha tṛtīye varṣa śata gate mama parinirvṛtasya tathāgatasya īdṛśa adakṣiṇīyāḥ bhaviṣyanti
translated: Then the Venerable Ānanda said this to the Blessed One: At what time, Blessed One, will they become unworthy of offerings?

analyzed: ye vihāre gṛhi saṃjñām dhārayiṣyanti
translated: The Blessed One said: Three hundred years after my parinirvāṇa, those who will hold the notion of householder in the monastery will become unworthy of offerings.

analyzed: te dāraka dārikā parivṛtāḥ bhaviṣyanti
translated: They will be surrounded by sons and daughters.

original: te sāṃghikaṃ mañcapīṭhaṃ vaṃśikopabimbopadhānakaṃ śayanāsanaṃ asatparibhogena paribhokṣyante /
analyzed: te sāṃghikam mañca pīṭham vaṃśika upabimba upadhānakam śayanāsanam asat paribhogena paribhokṣyante
translated: They will use the Saṅgha's beds, benches, bamboo spread mats, and pillows as personal belongings.

original: ye ca sāṃghikopacāre uccāraṃ prasrāvaṃ kurvanti /
analyzed: ye ca sāṃghika upacāre uccāram prasrāvam kurvanti
translated: Those who defecate and urinate in the Saṅgha's courtyard,

original: te vārāṇasyāṃ mahānagaryāmuccāraprasrāve gūḍhamṛttikodare prāṇino jāyante /
analyzed: te vārāṇasyām mahā nagaryām uccāra prasrāve gūḍha mṛttikā udare prāṇinaḥ jāyante
translated: they will be born as creatures in the great city of Vārāṇasī, in the hidden mud of excrement and urine.

analyzed: ye sāṃghikam dantakāṣṭham asat paribhogena paribhuñjante
translated: Those who use the Saṅgha's tooth cleaners as personal belongings,

analyzed: te kūrma makara matsyeṣu jāyante
translated: they will be born as turtles, crocodiles, and fish.

analyzed: ye sāṃghikam tila taṇḍula kodrava kulattha dhānya ādīn asat paribhogena paribhūñjante
translated: Those who use the Saṅgha's sesame seeds, rice, kodo millet, horse gram, and other grains as personal belongings,

original: te pretanagareṣupapadyante /🔽hīnendriyā dagdhasthūṇākṛtibhirasthipatravaducchritaiḥ svakeśaromapraticchannaiḥ parvatodarasaṃnibhaiḥ sūcīchidropamamukhaiḥ kāye īdṛśaṃ te
analyzed: te preta nagareṣu upapadyante  hīna indriyāḥ dagdha sthūṇā ākṛtibhiḥ asthi patra vat ucchritaiḥ sva keśa roma praticchannaiḥ parvata udara saṃnibhaiḥ sūcī chidra upama mukhaiḥ kāye īdṛśam te
translated: they will be reborn in the cities of the pretas.🔽With such bodies, they experience suffering like this:

analyzed: duḥkham pratyanubhavanti
translated: with impaired faculties, their bodies are like burnt skeletons, standing like skeletons, covered with their own hair, resembling mountain peaks, with mouths like the eye of a needle.

original: ye sāṃghikasyānnapānāderanyāyena paribhogaṃ kurvanti /🔽te 'lpaśruteṣu kuleṣu jāyante /
analyzed: ye sāṃghikasya anna pāna ādeḥ anyāyena paribhogam kurvanti  te lpa śruteṣu kuleṣu jāyante
translated: Those who use the Saṅgha's food, drink, and so on unjustly,🔽they will be born in families with little learning.

analyzed: hīna indriyāḥ ca jāyante
translated: They will be born with impaired faculties.

analyzed: khañja kubja kāṇa vāmanāḥ ca jāyante
translated: They are born lame, hunchbacked, blind, and dwarves.

analyzed: para mukha yācanakāḥ ca jāyante
translated: They are born beggars, dependent on the mouths of others.

analyzed: tatas ca uttari vyādhitāḥ ca jāyante  pūya śoṇitam kāye vahanti
translated: Then, after that, they are born sick.🔽They carry pus and blood in their bodies.

analyzed: svakīya loma saṃkucita kāyāḥ uttiṣṭhanti
translated: Their bodies are covered with their own hair.

analyzed: tadā māṃsa piṇḍāḥ bhūmau patanti
translated: Then, flesh-balls fall on the ground.

analyzed: asthīni dṛaśyante
translated: Bones are seen.

original: evaṃ te bahūni varṣaśatāni kāyikaṃ duḥkhaṃ pratyanubhavanti /
analyzed: evam te bahūni varṣa śatāni kāyikam duḥkham pratyanubhavanti
translated: Thus, they experience bodily suffering for many hundreds of years.

analyzed: ye sāṃghikīm bhūmim asat paribhogena paribhuñjante
translated: Those who use the Sangha's land by improper enjoyment.

original: te dvādaśa kalpān raurave mahānarake upapadyante /
analyzed: te dvādaśa kalpān raurave mahānarake upapadyante
translated: They are reborn in the great hell of Raurava for twelve eons.

analyzed: teṣām taptāni ayaḥ muhāni mukhe vaidya
translated: For them, burning iron balls enter their mouths.

analyzed: viṣkambha ante dahyante
translated: They burn.

analyzed: oṣṭham api dantāḥ api viśīryante
translated: The lips also, the teeth also, are destroyed.

analyzed: tālūni sphūṭanti dahyante
translated: The palates burst and burn.

analyzed: kaṇṭham api tālu api hṛdayam api
translated: The throat also, the palate also, the heart also.

analyzed: anyāni api sarveṇa sarvam dahyante
translated: And all the rest is burned.

analyzed: avaśeṣam gacchanti
translated: It becomes nothing left.

original: tadā bhikṣavaḥ karmavāyavo vānti yena te mṛtāḥ purūṣāḥ punareva jīvanti /
analyzed: tadā bhikṣavaḥ karma vāyavaḥ vānti yena te mṛtāḥ purūṣāḥ punar eva jīvanti
translated: Then, monks, karma-winds blow, by which those dead men come to life again.

analyzed: tatas punar api yama pālaiḥ puruṣaiḥ saṃgṛhyante
translated: Then again they are seized by the men who are the guardians of Yama.

original: tataḥ teṣāṃ karmopagānāṃ karmavaśānāṃ mahatī jihvā prādurbhavati /
analyzed: tatas teṣām karma upagānām karma vaśānām mahatī jihvā prādurbhavati
translated: Then for those who follow their karma, under the power of karma, a great tongue appears.

analyzed: tatra jihvāyām upari hala śata sahasram kṛṣyate
translated: On that tongue, a hundred thousand plows are plowed.

original: evaṃ te bahūni varṣaśatāni bahūni varṣasahasrāṇi bahūni varṣaśatasahasrāṇi nārakaṃ duḥkhaṃ pratyanubhavanti /
analyzed: evam te bahūni varṣa śatāni bahūni varṣa sahasrāṇi bahūni varṣa śata sahasrāṇi nārakam duḥkham pratyanubhavanti
translated: Thus they experience the suffering of hell for many hundreds of years, many thousands of years, many hundreds of thousands of years.

analyzed: tatas cyutvā agni ghaṭe mahā narake upapatsyante
translated: Having fallen from there, they will be reborn in the great hell of the pot of fire.

original: tataste yamapālapuruṣā gṛhītvā ca tasya jihvāyāṃ sūcīśatasahasraṃ vidhyanti /
analyzed: tatas te yamapāla puruṣāḥ gṛhītvā ca tasya jihvāyām sūcī śata sahasram vidhyanti
translated: Then those men who are the guardians of Yama seize them and pierce their tongue with a hundred thousand needles.

analyzed: tat api karma vaśāt jīvanti
translated: By the power of karma, they live.

analyzed: tatas utkṣipya agni khadā madhye kṣipanti
translated: Then, having lifted them up, they throw them into the middle of a pit of fire.

analyzed: tasyām agni khadāyām utkṣipya mahatīm vaitaraṇīm kṣipanti
translated: In that pit of fire, having lifted them up, they throw them into the great Vaitaraṇī.

analyzed: tat api kālam na kurvanti
translated: They do not die even then.

analyzed: tad anya narakeṣu upapadyante
translated: They are reborn in other hells.

original: evaṃ parikramatāṃ teṣāṃ trayaḥ kalpāḥ parīkṣīyante /
analyzed: evam parikramatām teṣām trayaḥ kalpāḥ parīkṣīyante
translated: Thus, as they wander, three eons are exhausted for them.

analyzed: tatas cyutvā jambūdvīpe jāyante daridrāḥ jāti andhāḥ
translated: Having fallen from there, they are reborn in Jambudvīpa as poor people who are blind from birth.

analyzed: tasmāt te hi anindāni uttarāṇi sāṃghikāni vastūni rakṣitavyāni
translated: Therefore, those should be protected, the Sangha's northern properties that are beyond reproach.

analyzed: ye bhikṣavaḥ śikṣā saṃvara saṃvṛtāḥ ca bhavanti
translated: Those monks who are restrained by the restraint of training,

analyzed: taiḥ imāni trīṇi cīvarāṇi dhārayitavyāni
translated: by them these three robes should be worn.

analyzed: ekam cīvaram saṃghasya viśvāsena saṃgha paribhogāya
translated: One robe should be worn as a robe of the Sangha, out of trust, for the enjoyment of the Sangha.

analyzed: tathā dvitīyam cīvaram rāja kula dvāra gamanāya ca
translated: Similarly, the second robe should be worn for going to the royal palace gate,

analyzed: tṛtīyam cīvaram grāma nagara nigama pallī pattaneṣu ca
translated: and the third robe in villages, towns, markets, and hamlets.

analyzed: imāni trīṇi cīvarāṇi bhikṣavaḥ dhārayitavyāni
translated: These three robes should be worn by the monks.

original: ye śīlavanto guaṇavantaḥ prajñāvantastairbhikṣava imāni śikṣāpadāni mayā prajñaptāni dhārayitavyāni /
analyzed: ye śīlavantaḥ guaṇavantaḥ prajñāvantaḥ taiḥ bhikṣavaḥ imāni śikṣā padāni mayā prajñaptāni dhārayitavyāni
translated: Those who are virtuous, have good qualities, and are wise, by those monks these precepts proclaimed by me should be upheld.

original: asatparibhogena bhikṣavo na paribhoktavyaṃ sāṃghikaṃ vastu agnighaṭopamam /
analyzed: asat paribhogena bhikṣavaḥ na paribhoktavyam sāṃghikam vastu agni ghaṭa upamam
translated: Monks, the Sangha's property should not be enjoyed improperly, like a pot of fire.

analyzed: sāṃghikam vastu viṣa upamam  sāṃghikam vastu vajra upamam
translated: The Sangha's property is like poison.🔽The Sangha's property is like a thunderbolt.

analyzed: sāṃghikam vastu bhāra upamam
translated: The Sangha's property is like a burden.

analyzed: viṣasya pratīkāram kartum śakyate
translated: It is possible to counteract poison,

original: na tu sāṃghikasya vastunaḥ pratikāraṃ kartuṃ śakyate //
analyzed: na tu sāṃghikasya vastunaḥ pratikāram kartum śakyate
translated: but it is not possible to counteract the Sangha's property.

analyzed: atha āyuṣmān ānandaḥ bhagavantam etat avocat ājñaptāni bhagavatā śikṣā padāni
translated: Then the Venerable Ānanda said this to the Blessed One: The precepts have been taught by the Blessed One.

analyzed: ye bhikṣavaḥ dhārayanti
translated: Those monks who uphold them,

analyzed: te pratimokṣa saṃvara saṃvṛtāḥ bhavanti
translated: they become restrained by the Prātimokṣa restraint.

analyzed: vināya abhimukhāḥ bhavanti
translated: They become inclined towards the Vinaya.

analyzed: kośa abhimukhāḥ bhavanti
translated: They become inclined towards the treasury.

analyzed: śikṣā kuśalāḥ bhavanti
translated: They become skilled in the training.

analyzed: tāni ca bhagavataḥ śikṣā padāni bhavanti
translated: And those are the Blessed One's precepts.

original: āyuṣmānānando bhagavataḥ pādau śirasā vanditvā prakrāntaḥ /
analyzed: āyuṣmān ānandaḥ bhagavataḥ pādau śirasā vanditvā prakrāntaḥ
translated: The Venerable Ānanda, having bowed his head at the feet of the Blessed One, departed.

original: atha te mahāśrāvakāḥ svakaṃ svakaṃ buddhakṣetraṃ prakrāntāḥ /
analyzed: atha te mahāśrāvakāḥ svakam svakam buddhakṣetram prakrāntāḥ
translated: Then those great hearers departed to their own buddha-fields.

original: te ca devā nāgā yakṣā gandharvā asurā garuḍāḥ kinnarā mahoragā manuṣyāḥ /
analyzed: te ca devāḥ nāgāḥ yakṣāḥ gandharvāḥ asurāḥ garuḍāḥ kinnarāḥ mahoragāḥ manuṣyāḥ
translated: And those gods, nāgas, yakṣas, gandharvas, asuras, garuḍas, kinnaras, mahoragas, and humans,

analyzed: sarve te prakrāntāḥ
translated: all of them departed.

analyzed: iti śikṣāsaṃvaraḥ nāma dvādaśam
translated: Thus ends the twelfth chapter, on the restraint of training.

analyzed: prakaraṇam
translated: The chapter on the Vinaya.

analyzed: idam avocat bhagavān
translated: The Blessed One said this.

original: te ca bodhisattvāḥ sā ca sarvāvatī parṣat sadevamānuṣāsuragandharvaśca loko bhagavato bhāṣitamabhyanandanniti //
analyzed: te ca bodhisattvāḥ sā ca sarvāvatī parṣad sa deva mānuṣa asura gandharvaḥ ca lokaḥ bhagavataḥ bhāṣitam abhyanandan iti
translated: And those bodhisattvas, and the entire assembly, and the world with its gods, humans, asuras, and gandharvas, rejoiced in the Blessed One's words.

analyzed: ayam kāraṇḍa vyūha mahāyāna sūtra ratna rājasya dhāraṇi vyūhaḥ maheśvaraḥ samāptaḥ
translated: This is the conclusion of the chapter on the retention array of the precious king of the great vehicle sūtras, the Karanda Vyūha, by Maheśvara.

analyzed: ārya kāraṇḍa vyūhaḥ mahāyāna sūtra ratna rājaḥ samāptaḥ
translated: The noble Karanda Vyūha, the precious king of the great vehicle sūtras, is concluded.

original: ye dharma hetuprabhavā hetusteṣāṃ tathāgato hyavadat /
analyzed: ye dharma hetu prabhavāḥ hetuḥ teṣām tathāgataḥ hi avadat
translated: Those dharmas that arise from causes, the Tathāgata has declared the causes of those,

original: teṣāṃ ca yo nirodha evaṃ vādī mahāśramaṇaḥ //
analyzed: teṣām ca yaḥ nirodhaḥ evam vādī mahā śramaṇaḥ
translated: And also their cessation—thus speaks the great renunciant.
